loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Adamu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ayuba and Grace.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Adamu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Adamu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked, Adamu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, hoping to ensure his children are educated and eventually obtain professional jobs.

loans.use: to meet expenses like school fees and clothing; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Norma Marina

texts.es: Norma de 33 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, Norma está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que no poseen luz eléctrica y con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra se podrán beneficiar con su familia ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en:
Norma, who is 33 years old, lives with her husband and two children in her own house. She makes her living selling clothes. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a solar lamp since they don't have electric lights and what they earn is not enough to buy any. 

The lamp is a charging station with energy from solar panels in the shape of a lamp for homes in rural areas that don't have electricity. With this purchase her whole family will benefit, since they will have their own light during the night.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized, corrugated tin; wood; nails; sand; and cement in order to construct a kitchen at her residence.

loans.name: Auwal

texts.en: Auwal is a maize farmer from Auta Makeri village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Auwal would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Auwal can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Auwal, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to meet expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ezekiel Nuhu

texts.en: Ezekiel Nuhu is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ezekiel Nuhu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ezekiel Nuhu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Ezekiel Nuhu is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family and hopes to earn more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to meet expenses like food, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de l’habillement, de chaussure, de sucre et du savon.
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente DJELIKA, première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de l’habillement. Elle compte acheter des puces de pagnes chez les grossistes à Bamako.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women, who have an average age of 31 years and an average of 4 children each. They all live in traditional families in the city of Fana, district of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of Mali.) 

The women came to know each other through family, neighbors, and friendship. They are in the business of selling clothing, shoes, sugar, and soap. The women of Benkadi are on their third group loan. In order to better meet the great demand from their customers, they turned to Soro Yiriwaso. 

Djelika is the first person pictured from left to right in the row of seated women in the photos. She cannot read, and she is currently a seller of clothing. She plans to purchase pieces of "pagne" cloth (the traditional bright colored cloth of western Africa) from wholesalers in Bamako. She makes her sales at retail for cash from her home and also at the market, to a customer base made up of both men and women.

Djelika hopes to earn a monthly income of 70,000 francs CFA, which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 19-year-old single man. He is part of a nine-member family living in Ajloun. Their family income depends on the father's retirement salary from the military and his mother's salary from working as a babysitter. Mohammad is now a second-year student majoring in English literature. He is requesting a loan to help him pay his school fees for the next semester.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Elis

texts.es: Elis de 35 años de edad, habita en un municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad, con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 7 y 9 años. Ella hace 9 años, adquirió su experiencia en técnicas de elaboración de calzado, trabajando en varios talleres en la ciudad de Bucaramanga, lugar donde la calidad y la excelencia en el trabajo del calzado la marroquinería y las confecciones, es muy reconocida. Cuando a Elis la liquidaban en cada taller, con este dineros logró ahorrar y con ello    organizar su propio taller,   iniciando, con 2 maquinarias, hormas, etc. y empezó a trabajar independiente. Poco a poco sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, iniciaron sus relaciones comerciales con Elis, y hoy esta tarea no se ha detenido, por eso debió contratar un ayudante, para generar mayor productividad. Sus ventas las realizan a crédito y de contado y fabrica por encargo  que le hacen propietarios de almacenes, misceláneas y vecinos que aún no la abandonan. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará suelas, hebillas, cuero, cuerina, pegante, broches y accesorios varios, con el fin de aumentar su productividad, elaborar nuevos diseños ajustados a la temporada, que se acerca, de gran festividad, donde las ventas repuntan. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará pues con más ventas mas utilidades.
texts.en:
Elis is 35-years old.  She lives in a municipality in a metropolitan area of the city with her husband and their two children, who are seven- and nine-years old, respectively.   
Nine years ago Elis acquired experience as a shoe-making specialist by working in various workshops in Bucaramanga.  Bucaramanga is a place where the quality and excellence in footwear, leather goods and manufacturing are well-known.  When Elis was paid up at each workshop, she was able to save the money and set up her own workshop.  She started with two pieces of equipment, lasts etc., and began working independently.  Little by little, neighbors, friends and family members started business relationships with Elis.  She has continued to be very busy and needs to hire an employee to increase her productivity.  Elis sells on credit and takes cash payments for orders made by department store and corner store owners and neighbors who have stuck with her.  
Elis is currently requesting a "credikiva," her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the loan, she will purchase soles, buckles, leather, faux leather, glue, fasteners and various accessories.  Her goal is to increase her productivity and make new designs appropriate for the upcoming holiday season, when her sales pick up.   Her business will improve with this loan; greater sales mean greater profits.

loans.use: to purchase soles, buckles, leather, faux leather, glue, fasteners and various accessories.

loans.use: To access a loan that meets expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Zakariya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. loans.name: Sindiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SINDIYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de l’habillement, de poisson fumé et d’articles divers.
Les femmes du groupe SINDIYA sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FATOUMATA, deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de l’habillement. Elle compte acheter 8 puces de pagnes wax chez les grossistes à Bamako. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Sindiya group is made up of married women, who have an average age of 34 years and an average of 4 children each. They all live in traditional families in the city of Fana, district of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of Mali.) 

The women came to know each other through family, neighbors, and friendship. They are in the business of selling cereals, clothing, smoked fish, and various items. The women of the Sindiya group are on their third group loan. In order to meet the great demand of their customers, the women turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

Fatoumata is the second person from right to left in the row of seated women in the photo. She cannot read, and is currently a seller of clothing. She plans to purchase 8 pieces of wax "pagne" cloth (the colorful cloth of western Africa) from wholesalers in Bamako. 

She makes her sales at retail for cash from her home and sometimes door to door, to a customer base made up of both men and women. She plans to earn a monthly income of 80,000 francs CFA, which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Wendsongda 1 De Bingo Group

texts.fr:
Mr TOMAS est responsable du groupe WENDSONGDA 1 DE BINGO. Marié, il est sans  enfant. Il a 02 personnes en charge.
Mr est gérant de kiosque (maquis) depuis plus de 12ans. Il s’approvisionne dans une cave en ville.
Il veut s’acheter 15caisses de sucrerie et 35caisses de bière.
Avec ses b bénéfices, il veut ouvrir d’autres  maquis. Mr ambitionne ouvrir une cave.
texts.en:
Tomas is the representative of the Wendsongda 1 de Bingo group. He is married and without children, but has 2 people in his care.

Tomas has run a stall for more than 12 years. He stocks up at a cellar in town. He would like to purchase 15 cases of sweet drinks and 35 cases of beer.

With his profits, Tomas wants to open other stalls. His goal is to one day open his own cellar.

loans.use: to purchase 15 cases of sweet drinks and 35 cases of beer

loans.name: Shaba Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her late 50s is married with seven kids and all of them are grown up.  She has been selling chips with chicken, fish, meat balls and eggs for twenty years now.  She works from 4pm to midnight daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Fatuma's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use it to buy irish potatoes, meat, chicken, eggs, fish,cooking oil, charcoal for cooking and increase fabric stock.  She dreams of selling big stock of fabrics and more stock of chips.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group "Shaba" which consists of two members total who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy irish potatoes, meat, chicken, eggs, fish, cooking oil, charcoal for cooking and increase fabric stock

loans.name: Ofelia Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Ofelia es una mujer emprendedora, acompañada, y tiene la edad de 47 años, donde está luchando por mantener su negocio el cual lleva cinco años, la socia se dedica a la venta de fritanga en su domicilio. Con ese negocio doña Ofelia ayuda a sustentar su hogar, la socia cuenta con la ayuda de dos muchachas que se encargan de apoyarla a cocinar y venderle al cliente final. Con el crédito quiere comprar frijoles, maíz, leña, queso, harina, gaseosas, mesas, sillas, arroz, verduras, frutas etc. Con los créditos que ha obtenido anteriormente ha logrado mejorar su casa y mantener estable el negocio.
texts.en:
Ofelia, 47, is an enterprising woman in a relationship who has been struggling for five years to maintain her business.  The partner makes a living from sales in small restaurant in her residence.  With this business, Ofelia helps to sustain her home.  The partner has the help of two young men to assist her to cook and sell to the customers. 
With the loan, she wants to buy beans, corn, firewood, cheese, flour, soft drinks, tables, seats, rice, vegetables, fruits, etc.  With the loans obtained previously, she was able to improve her house and maintain a stable business.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, firewood, cheese, flour, soft drinks, tables, seats, rice, vegetables, fruits, etc. and be able to satisfy the demand.

loans.name: Tasiu

texts.en: Tasiu is a maize farmer from Gunda village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Tasiu would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Tasiu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Tasiu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland. He hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Koba, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de l’habillement et de chaussure.
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente CHATA MARRO, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de l’habillement. Elle compte acheter des puces de pagne chez les grossistes à Dioïla
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The BENKADI group is made up of married women who are, on average, 34 years old with three children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Koba, Cercle of Dioïla, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They are involved in the preparation of meals, and they also sell grains, condiments, clothes and shoes. They are on their second solidarity loan. They have turned to Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the very high demand from their customers.

The group's featured borrower, Chata Marro (in the middle of the standing row in the photo), is illiterate and is currently selling clothes.  She is planning to buy second-hand "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) from wholesalers in Dioïla. She sells her merchandise on a retail basis, from home and also sometimes as an itinerant seller, to both men and women.  She gets paid in cash. She is expecting to make a monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: La Carrera Group

texts.es:
El grupo “La Carrera” se encuentra en una comunidad mazahua, para llegar a ella se necesita tomar un taxi especial o caminar debido a que el único autobús que llega hasta ella, solo pasa una vez y no tiene un horario fijo. Las integrantes del grupo son muy alegres pero sobre todo muy trabajadoras cada una de ellas solicita un préstamo a VisionFund para invertir en sus negocios: Alejandra, Julia y Laura invertirán en pollos; Leonor y Francisca, en borregos y Aurelia y Angela, endulces. Todas ellas están muy agradecidas con VisionFund porque sus negocios han crecido con el apoyo económico. 
“Fui mamá de cuatro hijos mis niños eran muy pequeños y de alguna manera me veía en la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos del hogar y con sus estudios” comentó Doña Ángela. Anteriormente, ella se dedicaba a la cría y engorda de pollos, pavos y a bordar servilletas para ganar dinero extra. Sin embargo, poco a poco dejó de ser un buen negocio. Hace tres años Ángela decidió abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes aunque actualmente ya solo vende dulces, afortunadamente los niños no le han dejado de comprar. Ella quiere invertir en dulces, frituras, jugos, refrescos, etc. A pesar de que Ángela ya no tiene dependientes ella desea continuar con el negocio para seguir obteniendo sus ganancias.
*En la imagen:  doña Ángela tiene en brazos a su nieto, la foto se tomó en el jardín del municipio donde viven los integrantes.
texts.en:
The group “La Carrera” is located in a Mazahua community. To get to it, you have to take a special taxi or walk because the only bus that goes there only passes once, and it does not have a fixed schedule. The group's members are very happy, but above all, they are very hardworking. Each one of them is requesting a loan with VisionFund to invest in their business: Alejandra, Julia and Laura will invest in chickens, Leonor and Francisca will invest in sheep, and Aurelia and Angela will invest in sweets. They are all very thankful for VisionFund because their businesses have grown with the economic help.

“I was the mother of four very young children, and somehow I needed to help with the household expenses and their studies” commented Ms. Ángela. Previously, she worked raising and fattening chickens and turkeys, and embroidering napkins to earn extra money. Nevertheless, little by little it stopped being a good business. Three years ago, Ángela decided to open a small grocery store, although currently she only sells sweets. Fortunately, the children have not stopped buying from her. Ángela wants to invest in sweets, fritters, juices, soft drinks, etc. Although she no longer has dependents, Ángela hopes to continue her business to keep making a profit.

*In the image: Ms. Ángela has her grandson in her arms. The photo was taken in the garden in the municipality where the members live.

loans.use: to buy more sweets, fritters, juices, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Florecitas 3 Panajachel Group

texts.en:
Panajachel is a well-known highland town on the shores of Lake Atitlan that swells with tourists at various times throughout the year. Friendship Bridge has its main office on the main street of Santander and has 85 employees who fan out across the country visiting groups of women in Trust Banks. A local Trust Bank is “Florecitas 3 Panajachel” composed of eight women, each with an average of three children.

Eva is the Secretary of the Trust Bank. She is 36-years-old, divorced with four daughters. She has to work very hard to provide the basic necessities for her daughters. Eva sells snacks as well as piñatas and confections. She rents a space in the local market. Eva is beginning her second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. She needs a loan to purchase ingredients for her snack business including flour, sugar and other supplies as well as paper and other supplies to make piñatas. From now until the end of the year, there are many celebrations including baptisms, weddings and graduations. Eva’s products are in great demand and she wants to be ready.

The Friendship Bridge program, called “Microcredit Plus”, combines micro-loans with business training and education programs designed to teach business and life skills, improve confidence and lay the foundation for a pathway to empowerment.  Each month, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares practical information with the ladies about such subjects. 

It is impossible for these women to walk into a bank and secure a loan. They have no collateral and no credit history. Friendship Bridge and Kiva investors form a most valuable partnership for these women. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her snack business including flour, sugar and other supplies

loans.name: Maria Gloria Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria Gloria lives on her small farm, where she raises cows, rabbits and poultry. She dedicates herself to selling the rabbits and her chicken's eggs, and also grows corn and kidney beans on a plot of land surrounding her farm. When she learned about the opportunity to invest in a biodigester, she was mostly interested in reducing the operating costs on her farm, since the LP gas she needed for her energy supply is expensive. 

Prior to owning her biodigester, she also used to cook and heat water with the wood she collected in the forest close by, which was a time consuming and harmful activity for her own health as she inhaled the damaging smoke while cooking, and contributed to deforestation. By taking advantage of her animals' manure to produce her own biogas and biofertilizer, she will be able to save money, protect the environment and turn her farm into a cleaner and more comfortable place to live (less bad smells and flies), while protecting her and her family's health. The organic and nutrient-rich fertilizer produced by the bacteria in the biodigester will allow her to increase the yield of the vegetables in her garden in a natural way, at zero cost. 

With her savings, Maria Gloria plans to buy more animals and expand her farm.This loans represents 16% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part is covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Todo tipo de mercancia para damas, caballeros juvenil e infantil, es lo que comercializa Luisa desde hace 14 años, cuando sus amigas le recomendaron que iniciara un negocio, con el fin de genera ingresos que beneficiaran a ella y a su familia. Ella inició poco a poco, comprando en diversos lugares y hoy en día hace su oferta mediante guias especializadas de productos, pues está vinculada a organizaciones que así lo ofrecen. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y de contado todos los dias desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche  comprando a crédito a sus proveedores y distribuyendolo entre sus clientes que son principalmente sus vecinos, familiares y referidos, que conforman hoy su base de datos. Su meta es convertirse en mayorista y finalmente tener una casa propia aunque su mayor desafio es las circunstancias que se derivan de su edad, no obstante se sienta activa y muy saludable. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiemitnoq ue ahce a ala Fundación mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará lociones, collares, pusos, ropa etc. todo este en un mayor volumen con el fin de obtener mejores precios, para ser mas competitiva y por esto justamente su credikiva mejora las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Every type of merchandise for ladies, gentlemen, teens, and children is what Luisa has sold for the past fourteen years.  That is when her friends recommended that she begin a business with the goal of generating income for herself and her family.  

She started out bit by bit, buying in various locations, until the current day when she offers her merchandise through specialized catalogs of products, because the organizations she is connected to do it that way.  She makes her sales by credit and cash everyday from 7 a.m. until 10 p.m., buying on credit from her suppliers and distributing the products to her customers, who are primarily her neighbors, family members, and those referred to her, who today make up her database.  

Her goal is to become a wholesaler and, in the end, to have her own home.  Her biggest challenges are the circumstances that come with her age, in spite of the fact that she feels active and very healthy.  

At this point in time she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan that she has taken out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the loan she will buy lotions, necklaces, track suits, clothing, etc.  She’ll buy all of this in bulk in order to get better prices so that she can be more competitive.  Because of exactly that, her Kiva loan will improve the state of her business.

loans.use: to buy lotions, necklaces, track suits, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Nabonswende De Bingo Group

texts.fr:
Mr AUGUSTIN est responsable du groupe NABONSWENDE DE BINGO. Marié, il est père d’un enfant. Il est âgé de 18mois et  ne va pas à l’école.
Mr fait l’agriculture et vend des céréales depuis plus de 40ans. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché de son village.
Il veut s’acheter 03 sacs de mil et 01 sac de maïs.
Avec ses b bénéfices, il veut participer à l’épanouissement de sa famille. Mr ambitionne devenir un grand agriculteur.
texts.en:
Augustin is the representative of the Nabonswende de Bingo group. He is married and the father of one child, who is 18 months old and does not attend school.

Augustin has been a farmer and sold cereals for more than 40 years. He stocks up in the market of his village. He wants to purchase 3 bags of millet and 1 bag of corn. With his earnings, he would like to help his family prosper.

Augustin's dream is to become a big farmer.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bags of millet and 1 bag of corn

loans.name: Teedbeogo De Bingo Group

texts.fr:
Mr WANENOGO EDMOND est responsable du groupe TEEDBEOGO DE BINGO. Marié, il est père de 09enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins a 04mois. 03 vont à l’école.
Mr fait l’élevage depuis plus de 20ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Il veut s’acheter  02 moutons, 02 chèvres et des œufs de pintade pour faire pondre.
Avec ses b bénéfices, il veut ajouter l’agriculture. Mr ambitionne devenir un grand éleveur.
texts.en:
Wanenogo Edmond is the representative of the Teedbeogo de Bingo group. He is married and the father of 9 children. His oldest is 21 years old and the youngest is 4 months old. 3 of Wanenogo Edmond's children attend school.

Wanenogo Edmond has raised livestock for more than 20 years. He stocks up at nearby markets. 

He would like to purchase 2 sheep, 2 goats, and guinea fowl eggs to hatch. With his profits, Wanenogo Edmond wants to add farming to his business. His dream is to become a big stockbreeder.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sheep, 2 goats, and guinea fowl eggs for hatching

loans.name: Sabiu

texts.en: Sabiu is a maize farmer from Badamasi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sabiu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sabiu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Sabiu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access a loan that meets expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ali would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ali can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ali, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for daily expenses in order to eliminate the pressure to sell his corn crop for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Buhari

texts.en: Buhari is a maize farmer from Makera village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Buhari would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Buhari can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Buhari, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access a loan that meets expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en: Abdu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Nura and Binta. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Abdu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to meet expenses like child school fees and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel de 55 años de edad, vive con su esposo y no  tiene  hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 8 años  a la venta de tortilla, sus clientes le prefieren por su buen trato y también porque atiende  a sus clientes en las dos jornadas.
 Doña María es una mujer trabajadora y con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de maíz, leña y cal, con el apoyo del préstamo espera suplir su necesidad de financiamiento, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma, su sueño es mejorar su casa y tener otro negocio que le genere ingresos.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras- Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Isabel, who is 55 years old, lives with her husband and has no children who depend on her. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. She has her own house, and she has been working for 8 years selling tortillas. Her customers prefer her for her good treatment of them and also because she serves her customers on two working days.

Doña Maria is a hardworking woman with desires to advance. She is applying for the loan to purchase corn, firewood, and lime. With the support of the loan, she hopes to supply her need for financing. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma. Her dream is to improve her house and have another business that will generate income for her.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras- October 2014.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Rayito De Sol Group

texts.es:
Doña Paula tiene 58 años y está casada con el señor Agustín, juntos formaron una familia con nueve hijos que actualmente ya son independientes. 

Doña Paula y Don Agustín son personas de la tercera edad, ambos son comerciantes y necesitan comprar más vasos de licuadora y aspas, mercancía que venden desde hace 20 años en las calles ya que no tienen un local. “...Pero caminando entre las personas nuestras ganancias son mejores porque si nos establecemos en un lugar fijo la competencia nos dejaría sin clientes” comentó Doña Paula. Ella recuerda el tiempo en que sus hijos aún eran pequeños y las ganancias de su esposo no eran suficientes para cubrir todos los gastos, por ello decidió salir a vender con él. Aunque todos sus hijos ya son independientes, Paula desea continuar con su actividad para que ella y Don Agustín puedan seguir teniendo su propio dinero.  

Las demás integrantes del grupo son: Guadalupe quien invertirá en ropa, Eufemia comprara calcetines, Florentina y Elvia invertirán en la tienda de abarrotes, Juana invertirá en batas y mandiles, Paula y Maricela invertirán en vasos de licuadoras y aspas, Carolina invertirá en controles, Elena comprara jarcería y protectores de celular. 

*La foto fue tomada debajo del kiosko del municipio donde viven los integrantes, Paula viste un suéter rojo.
texts.en:
Ms. Paula is 58 years old and married to Mr. Agustín. Together, they built a family with nine children who are all independent now.

Ms. Paula and Mr. Agustín are senior citizens. Both are retailers, and they need to buy more blender jars and blades, merchandise that they have sold for 20 years in the streets since they don't have a shop. “...But walking among people our earnings are better because if we establish a fixed location the competition would leave us with no clients,” commented Ms. Paula. She remembers the time when her children were small and her spouse's earnings weren't sufficient to cover all the expenses, so she decided to go out selling with him. Although all their children are independent,  Paula wants to continue the activity so that she and Mr. Agustín can continue to have their own money.  

The other members of the group are: Guadalupe who will invest in clothing, Eufemia who will buy socks, Florentina and Elvia who will invest in their convenience store, Juana who will invest in smocks and aprons, Paula and Maricela who will invest in blender jars and blades, Carolina who will invest in controls, and Elena who will buy cleaning supplies and cellular protectors. 

*The photo was taken under the kiosk in the municipality where the members live. Paula is wearing a red sweater.

loans.use: to buy blender jars and blades.

location.town: San Agustin San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a maize farmer from Daura village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Simon would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Simon can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Simon, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for daily expenses, such as food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Musa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Juspin, Ayuba and Agustin. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Musa's ambition is to use the additional income to educate his children, with the hope of ensuring they are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for expenses, such as school fees and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah is a maize farmer from Gwangwamawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isah would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isah can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Isah, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for expenses such as food and clothing eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Opal Amparo

texts.es:
La señora Opal Amparo de 28  años de edad, vive con su familia en su  casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de ropa americana,  ella vende pantalones, camisas, chores, bóxer, licras, camisetas, faldas, vestidos, Sandalias, tenis, etc.
Doña Opal Amparo vive en un municipio de Pespire, Choluteca, al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Opal Amparo está solicitando el préstamo para compra de 5  fardos  de ropa americana clasificada que incluye blusas, vestidos, faldas, camisas, pantalones, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del  2014.
texts.en:
Señora Opal Amparo, who is 28 years old, lives with her family in her own house. She has been working for 10 years in her business of selling American clothing. She sells pants, shirts, shorts, boxers, Lycra, t-shirts, skirts, dresses, sandals, tennis shoes, etc.

Doña Opal Amparo lives in a township of Pespire, Choluteca, in the south of Honduras. She is an entrepreneurial woman with the desire to get ahead, and she works hard every day to improve her quality of life.

Doña Amparo is applying for a loan to purchase 5 bundles of sorted American clothing, which includes blouses, dresses, skirts, shirts, pants, etc. With the support of this loan, she plans to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a borrower with the desire to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good business and increase her customers and at the same time improve her future along with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2014.

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, skirts, shirts, pants, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ramón Antonio

texts.es: Don Ramón es un microempresario laborioso, tiene la edad de 40 años, acompañado, y comercializa productos varios en su Pulpería desde hace veinte años y tiene el deseo de aumentar sus ventas, esto lo ha motivado a solicitar el crédito e invertir en la compra de cremas de cabellos, papel higiénico, pierna de pollo, pechuga con ala,  granos básicos, jabón de lavar ropa, aceite, pan, y una mantenedora etc., de modo que podrá satisfacer a la población con los productos que más demandan y de esta manera mejorara sus ingreso en su hogar.
texts.en:
Ramón is a hardworking small-business owner. He is 40 years old, in a relationship, and for the past 20 years he has sold various products in his grocery store. 

He wants to increase his sales, and this has motivated him to request a loan and invest in the purchase of hair creams, toilet paper, chicken legs, breasts with wings, basic grains, laundry detergent, oil, bread, and a refrigerator, etc. With this, he will be able to satisfy the town with the products that they demand the most, and will be able to improve his household income.

loans.use: to buy hair creams, toilet paper, chicken legs, breasts with wings, basic grains, laundry detergent, oil, bread, and a refrigerator, etc.

loans.name: Olga Esperanza

texts.es:
En el departamento de Suchitepéquez, durante 4 años Olga mujer casada de 34 años se ha dedicado elaboración de cortes típicas. Como mujer trabajadora, ha tomado el reto de la vida de sacar adelante sus tres hijos que se han convertido en el motivo de luchar cada día para tener un mejor futuro para su familia y que ellos tengan la condición de vida adecuada.  

Su actividad principal es la venta de cortes, dicha actividad lo ha venido realizando desde hace 4 años, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de comida por los alrededores de su comunidad, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora siempre busca nuevas estrategias para poder tener un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia para que tengan la condición de vida que se merecen.

El uso respectivo que le dará al préstamo es para la compra de mercadería de cortes típicas para contar con mas mercadería para poner a la disposición de las clientela y al mismo tiempo el obtiene recurso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida en la que ahora se encuentra. Uno de los sueños de Olga es la construcción de casa para sus hijos para que ellos tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada y mejorar sus ventas con el requerimiento de un préstamo.
texts.en:
In the Department of Suchitepéquez, for four years Olga, a married woman 34 years of age, has made a living from making traditional clothing.  As a hardworking woman, she has taken on the challenge of getting her three children ahead, which has become the motive to struggle every day to have a better future for her family so that they have the conditions for an adequate life.
Her principal activity is the sale of traditional clothing, something she has been doing for four years.  The second thing she does is to sell food around the outskirts of her community.  She is a very enterprising woman who always searches for new strategies to have an economic income for the benefit of her family so that they have the life conditions they deserve.
The use toward which she will put the loan is to buy merchandise of typical cloth so as to have more merchandise available to her clientele and at the same time obtain economic resources to improve the life conditions which she currently has.  Olga's dreams are the construction of a house for her children so that they have adequate life conditions and to improve her sales which requires a loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise of traditional cloth.

loans.name: Sadiku

texts.en: Sadiku is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sadiku would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sadiku can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Sadiku is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for expenses such as clothing and food eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
De 32 años de edad casado originario del departamento de Solola tiene tres hijos el primero casado y tiene ya su familia, el segundo y tercero estudian en la comunidad donde viven, el realiza un impresionante esfuerzo a pesar de su edad el es una hombre emprendedor y el comenta que nunca es demasiado tarde para empezar a desarrollar y tener una visión en el futuro.

La actividad que el dignamente a desempeñado durante 5 años es la compraventa de abarrotería en la comunidad, ya que es por medio de ella puede obtener un ingreso económico para su familia y una ganancia para mejora su condición de vida.

El uso respectivo que el le dará al préstamo que solicita es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotería, ya que el requiere de productos para poner a la disposición de la clientela productos variados para que el obtenga mejores ingresos económicos que le ayudaran a mejorar sus condiciones de vida en un futuro. 

Los sueños de el es que las condiciones de su familia sean las adecuadas para un futuro y es por eso que quiere compra dos molinos de nixtamal instalarlas en su comunidad e brindar estudio a sus hijos para que ellos lleguen a profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
At 32 years old, married, a native of the Solola department, he has three children. The first is married and has a family. The second and third study in the community where they live. He puts forth impressive effort despite his age. He is an enterprising man, and he says that it is never too late to start to develop and have a vision for the future.

The activity he performed with dignity for 5 years is selling groceries in his community. That is how he made an income for his family and earnings to improve their living conditions.

The respective use that he will give this loan he is requesting is to buy grocery merchandise, since he needs the products to be able to have various products at his clients' disposition so he can obtain greater income, which will help him to improve his living conditions in the future. 

His dreams are that his family's conditions will be adequate for the future. That is why he wants to buy two nixtamal mills to install them in his community and to provide an education to his children so that they can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en: Hauwa is a maize farmer from Makera village in the Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after the harvest in order to cover her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hauwa can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Hauwa, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland and hopes to ensure that other members in her community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to cover immediate expenses like food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Voces Unidas Group

texts.es: Voces unidas está integrado por cuatro mujeres emprendedoras que solicitan por primera vez el financiamiento de la institución para sus negocios, es coordinado por la señora Alejandra quien tiene la edad de 30 años, acompañada y madre de un hijo que es su motivación para su superación, se dedica a la comercialización de frutas en el mercado de Estelí desde hace diez años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de papaya, sandia y melón. Otra de las integrantes es Fátima quien tiene la edad de 24 años, comerciante de frutas en el mercado más populoso de la capital desde hace un año, Melissa una joven de 20 años de edad y quien comercializa derivados del maíz desde hace dos años en uno de los mercados capitalinos, y Miuris de 24 años de edad es propietaria de una mini pulpería.
texts.en:
Voces Unidas (United Voices) is made up of four entrepreneurial women who for the first time are applying to the institution for financing for their businesses. The group is coordinated by Señora Alejandra, who is 30 years old. She has a partner and is the mother of a son who is her motivation to improve. She has been selling fruits in a market in Estelí for 10 years. The loan that she is applying for is to purchase papayas, watermelons, and melons.

Another of the members is Fátima, who is 24 years old. She has been selling fruit in the busiest market of the capital for a year. Melissa, a young woman of 20, has been selling corn products for two years in one of the capitol markets, and Miuris, who is 24, is the proprietor of a mini grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase papayas, watermelons, and melons with the goal of covering the demand for these products.

loans.name: Dúo Paccorral Group

texts.es:
DUO PACORRAL
Doña Flavia es originaria de la aldea Pacorral del municipio del Tecpan, Guatemala ella tiene 40 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad esta 1 hija menor de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de animales.
Gracias a Dios su negocio poco a poco a crecido, ahora ya le hacen pedidos de tejidos y eso la a ayudado para que su negocio creciera un poco más.
El crédito que ella recibió lo utilizo para comprar mas materia prima para  sus tejidos, también compro otros animalitos, ya que es el medio que tiene para salir adelante.
Ella  sueña con ampliar más su negocio, ya que de esa forma ella obtendrá mejores ganancias y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos
texts.en:
Flavia is a native of Pacorral, a village in the municipality of Tecpan, Guatemala. She is forty years old and she has a young daughter under her care. 

Flavia makes a living creating traditional hand-woven textiles, as well as raising animals. Her business has gradually grown, thank goodness, and by now she produces some fabric work on order, which has helped the business to grow a little more.

She used the loan she received to buy source materials to work with, and she also bought other small animals, since this is her way to get ahead. 

Flavia dreams of expanding her business in order to get better income and improve the quality of her life. She is requesting this loan to buy source material to produce and sell traditional textiles.

loans.use: to buy source material to produce traditional textiles.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María Luisa de 50  años de edad, vive con su hija en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, Valle  al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 20 años  al negocio de la venta de frescos, churros, jugos, cuajada y también vende cerdos.
Doña María Luisa en está ocasión está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de frescos, churros, jugos  que es uno de sus negocios y también para la compra de una reja para proteger su casa. Con el apoyo de este préstamo desea salir adelante es una buena cliente con varios ciclos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es mejor su casa y tener un mejor negocio.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old and lives with her daughter in the city of San Lorenzo, located in Valle in the south of Honduras. She has her own home and has made a living for over 20 years selling soft drinks, churros, juices, cheese curd and pigs. 

This time Maria Luisa is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, churros, and juices which she sells at one of her businesses. She will also use the loan to buy metal bars to protect her home. With the support of this loan she wants to get ahead as a good client and work with Prisma for many more loan periods. 

Her dream is to make improvements on her house and run a better business. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2014

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, churros, and juices for one of her businesses.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, se dedica a vender pan, tamales, pupusas, flores, etc., también ofrece productos según la temporada, vive con su compañero de vida y 6 nietos; aprendió a desempeñar estas actividades cuando ayudaba a su madre, luego la tomo como fuente de ingresos para ayudar a su pareja a  crecer sus hijos, ya tiene 20 años de tener su negocio y lo hace en un horario de 8:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.
Invertirá en papelería, harina, carnes, quesillo, condimentos, etc., comprará una nueva plancha y construirá una galera, fortalecerá sus actividades económica para ir ampliando su negocio, brindara una mejor comodidad a sus clientes y productos de calidad, al realizar está inversión podrá seguir teniendo recursos económicos para cubrir los gastos de la deuda y las necesidades familiares.
 Su visión es llegar a tener un negocio que funcione con capital propio y darle a su familia una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Juana sells bread, tamales, pupusas, flowers, and others and she also offers seasonal products. She lives with her husband and 6 grandchildren. She learned this trade when she was young helping her mother. She later on, used the skills to get a second income and help her husband raise their children. She's done so for over 20 years and she works from 8:00 am to 3:00 pm.
She will invest this loan in stationery, flour, meat, fresh cheese, condiments, etc. She will buy a new cooking pan and she will build a galley, so she can strengthen her position and expand her business, and in the future provide better quality products and improve the facilities for her customers. This investment will help her stay in business, repay her loan and cover family expenses. Her goal is to own a business that is self-sustaining and provide her family with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to invest in stationery, flour, meat, fresh cheese, condiments, and buy a new cooking pan and build a galley, so she can expand her business

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ephraim Benjamin would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ephraim Benjamin can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Ephraim Benjamin  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To meet expenses like food and child school fees; eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tisongtaba Bimbilla-Kunkuna Group

texts.en:
Fushetu is a 43-year-old hard-working woman from Bimbilla in the Northern region of Ghana. Fushetu is married and has 5 children. Fushetu is the individual pictured with her hands on the milled parboiled rice among members squatting.

Fushetu is a member of a parboiled rice processing group that has been in business for the last 20 years. The name of the group is ‘Tisongtaba Bimbilla-Kunkuna’. She earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process high quality parboiled rice for the local markets around Bimbilla and non-local markets.

Fushetu and ‘Tisongtaba Bimbilla-Kunkuna’ have asked for a loan of GHS 10,600.00. Fushetu’s share of the loan is GHS 400.00 which would be used to buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing. Fushetu aspires to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her family with food, health care and educational expenses.

Fushetu thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy paddy rice from rice farmers for processing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy footwear and apparel clothing

loans.name: Xiomara Marisol

texts.es:
Xiomara, utilizo el préstamo anterior para cultivar maíz y pipían en época de invierno, logrando tener un negocio más estable y con mejor rentabilidad, en su familia hay un nuevo miembro.
Necesita de un nuevo préstamo para invertir en abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, tubos pvc, para cultivar tres manzanas y media de pipían, espera que su negocio siga mejorando y tener nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Xiomara used the previous loan to plant corn and squash during the winter season.  It helped her to have a more stable business and better profitability.  In addition, she has a new family member. 
Xiomara needs a new loan to invest in compost, herbicides, insecticides and PVC pipes to plant three-and-a-half plots of squash.  She hopes that her business continues to improve and to have new customers.

loans.use: to invest in compost, herbicides, insecticides, and PVC pipes so she can plant three-and-a-half plots of squash.

loans.name: Fulgence

texts.en:
Fulgence owns a coffee washing station, Mugina Coffee Co, in Rwanda's Eastern Province. For the last few years, Fulgence has been a supplier of the Rwanda Trading Company, one of East Africa's largest coffee exporters.  

Fulgence doesn't want to just continue supplying washed coffee beans to Rwanda Trading Company, but he wants to be their leading supplier. During the off-season, Fulgence has made significant improvements to his coffee business, such as working to improve the quality from his farmers, and constructing new water tanks and storage. 

Fulgence is looking for a loan of 10,000 USD to build more drying tables, thus nearly doubling his production capacity. With this increase, he will create 30 new jobs for men and women from his community. 

In AEC's experience working with Fulgence, he is a very dedicated and responsive entrepreneur. In the past when his business was struggling, he actively sought help from coffee washing experts, humbly took their advice, and implemented with fidelity.

loans.use: To build new drying tables and storage for his coffee washing station

loans.name: Lami

texts.en: Lami is a maize farmer from Galadima village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Lami would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Lami can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. loans.use: to meet expenses like food and clothing by eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 10 mobile solar powered kiosks

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, es poseedora de una tienda en la que oferta productos de la canasta básicas y otros, su negocio tiene 12 años de haber sido fundado, lo abre a las 6:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m., lo aprendió por iniciativa propia y por necesidad de salir adelante, en la zona no cuenta con mucha competencia lo que la da una ventaja, Francisca es casada, tiene un hijo de 19 años de edad, todos viven en la misma vivienda.
Está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar pastas, arroz, bebidas, frijoles, golosinas, etc. y una vitrina, tendrá una mejor vistosidad de los productos que tiene a la venta, con ello protegerá algunos productos de delicada conservación y continuara teniendo su negocio bien surtido, los peligros a los que está expuesta son los niveles de delincuencia.
Sus anhelos son mantener el negocio con vida, reconstruir la vivienda y mejorar día a día la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca is the owner of a store in which she offers products for the basic food basket and other items. Her business was founded 12 years ago. She opens it from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.. She learned [the business] on her own initiative and out of the necessity to get ahead. She doesn't have much competition in the zone, which gives her an advantage. Francisca is married and has a 19-year-old son. They all live in the same residence.

She is applying for financing to buy pastas, rice, beverages, beans, candies, etc., and a display case so that she will have better visibility for the products that she has for sale. With it she will protect some products that are delicate, and she will continue having her business well stocked. The dangers to the products that are exposed are the levels of crime.

Her dreams are to keep her business alive, to reconstruct her house, and to improve day by day the nourishment of her family.

loans.use: to buy pastas, rice, beverages, beans, candies, etc., and a display case so that she will have better visibility for the products that she has for sale.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en: Anabelle is 37 years old and lives in Dumingag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 5 school age children. She was happy and proud assisting her husband managing their farming activity. She has worked this business for 20 years. She requested a loan to purchase farm inputs and sacks of fertilizers to provide the maintenance of her rice field for more harvest. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Anabelle hopes that God will always blessed their business so she can provide the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Emetudio

texts.en: Emetudio is 62 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is single and manages the rice field of his family. He has had this farming activity for 40 years. He requested a loan to buy farm inputs and pesticides for his rice field. He has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Emetudio hopes to find a wife and build a family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pesticides

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 26 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is single and a hardworking daughter to support the needs of her parents. She has a shop that sells different kinds of food and has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for land redemption to prepare for her corn production. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Emily wants to find a husband and to have children.

loans.use: to redeem land for corn production

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, ha mejorado notablemente su negocio de venta de tortillas, está teniendo mayor demanda de sus productos por el crecimiento de su clientela, además le está enseñando el negocio a su nuera para tener un apoyo en la realización de dicha actividad. Su estilo de vida familiar es más digno.
Se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar maíz y leña, que son materia prima para mantener la continuidad del negocio, además podrá seguir atendiendo mejor a sus clientes y teniendo ingresos para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gloria has greatly improved her business selling tortillas. She has increased demand of her products because of her growing clientele. In addition, she is teaching the business to her daughter-in-law to have help performing the activity. Her family lifestyle is more worthy.

She has decided to request a new loan to buy corn and firewood, which are raw materials to maintain the continuity of her business. In addition, she will be able to continue to better serve her clients and have income to move forward.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood, which are raw materials to maintain the continuity of her business.

loans.name: Jose Efrain

texts.es: Don José, tiene 70 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos y reside en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara junto a su esposa y un hijo. Don José, lleva muchos años dedicado a la agricultura y ganadería. Su negocio comenzó hace 18 años con el cultivo de  maíz, frijoles y café el cual vende en el mercado de la zona y es su fuente de ingresos. El cultivo ha mejorado por la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente solicita el sexto ciclo a la institución y es por 5,000 Lempiras para comprar insumos, abonos y pago por limpieza de la finca de café y poderle brindar mejor asistencia a su finca. Tiene como meta seguir comprando terreno para siembra de mas café y comprar un vehículo para la familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 70 years old, married with four children. He lives in Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara with his wife and a son. 
Jose has dedicated many years to agriculture and livestock. His business began 18 years ago cultivating corn, beans and coffee which he sells at the local market as a source of income. His crops have improved after investing several loans; he is currently on his sixth cycle asking for 5.000 Lempiras to buy supplies, fertilizers and to pay for cleaning services for the coffee farm, so he can take better care of it. His goal is to continue buying land to plant more coffee and buy a vehicle for the family.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers and to pay for cleaning services for the coffee farm

loans.name: Ado

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ado would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest in order to to cover his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ado can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Ado expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, ensure that other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.name: Chela

texts.en:
Chela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a personal products retail business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF in order to buy additional personal products to resell.

Chela successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Chela's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional personal products to resell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Alma works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Alma is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Azucena is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Azucena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles works hard to support her family. Angeles is widow and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Angeles has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 42 years old and single. She works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling educational books. Cherry is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional bundles of ready-to-wear to sell for her buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business.

Cherry has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma works hard to support her family. Elma is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net.

Elma has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net.

loans.name: Nolvia Janeth

texts.es: Doña Nolvia, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera, tuvo 3 hijos, actualmente vive con un hijo adoptado, en el municipio de Tocoa, Colon. Lleva  8 años de dedicarse  a la venta de ropa usada  y venta de sandalias. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa, ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio anteriormente tenia pulpería. El  préstamo que solicita es de 10,000 lempiras y  lo invertirá en la compra de un fardo de ropa variada y clasificada. Esta inversión le ayudara  a surtir y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, lo que le permitirá  obtener ganancias. Su plan es expandir su negocio con otros productos y crecer para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Nolvia is 50-years old.  She is a single mother who had three children and currently lives with an adopted son in Tocoa, Colon.  Doña Nolvia has made her living for the last eight years selling sandals and used clothing.  The business is set up in her house.  Doña Nolvia has always worked in the commercial sector; she previously had a small grocery store.  
The loan Doña Nolvia is requesting is for 10,000 lempiras (USD $475).  She will invest it in the purchase of a bundle of varied and sorted clothing.  The loan will help her to stock up and to meet her customers' demand, which will allow her to earn a profit.  Her plan is to expand and grow her business with other products so she can earn a better income.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of a varied and sorted used clothing for re-sale.

loans.name: Safiyanu

texts.en: Safiyanu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Safiyanu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Safiyanu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Safiyanu expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to meet expenses like clothing and food, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Basiru

texts.en:
Basiru is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Zahardinu, Nsziru and Mizambiloz.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Basiru would have had to sell his maize at a low price soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for such basics as food and clothing. With this 9,485 NGN loan and Babban Gona’s support, Basiru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Basiru spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: store his maize at harvest time, then sell it later at up to 40% higher.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is a 39-year-old maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Deborah joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her child: Jenifer.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Deborah would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Deborah can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Deborah spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her child, eventually hoping to ensure her child is educated and has access to professional jobs.

loans.use: to meet expenses like child school fees and clothing; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Isiyaku Lover

texts.en: Isiyaku Lover is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Isiyaku Lover joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Istifanus, Rejoice and Zainap.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku Lover would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiyaku Lover can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Isiyaku Lover spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to meet expenses like child school fees and clothing; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Samaila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Aminu, Suwidi and Naja.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Samaila spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to meet expenses like child school fees and clothing; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante is 37 years old and married with three children. He  resides in Lopez Jaena with his family. 

His wife is peddling fresh fish in the local community to make a living while he does fishing. For over twenty years, it sustained and had provided his children's education costs. 

He successfully repaid his previous loan used for buying fish to sell. He is now taking a new loan to buy fishing nets used for fishing. He is hopeful to earn more income and be able to operate his business safely.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Her name is Natividad, 63, and a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Heracleo, a welder, and has six children.  She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support them and meet their daily personal, household needs and to send children to school. 

Natividad is in the retail business. She sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also has a water distribution business where she is shown in her photo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 600 a day. 

To help her grow her business she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, soda and also to maintain her water business. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her.  Her earnings are a big help in meeting their daily expenses and in sending her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Natividad hopes to maintain and grow her business so she they could have a better life. She strives hard to give her children the best education possible to ensure them a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fresh meat, sacks of rice and soft drinks to sell and also to maintain her water business.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines and also earns additional income from an internet café. Doris is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of purified drinking water to sell.

Doris has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Ermie

texts.en:
Ermie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Ermie has been in this business for two years now.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional rice to sell. In the future, Ermie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle transport business.

Elenita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Elenita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es: Paola de 32 años de edad habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 14 y 17 años, al sur oriente de la ciudad, lugar donde vende mercancía variada y ofrece el servicio de llamadas a celulares, aprovechando la concentración de su clientela.  Su negocio inició hace 2 años impulsada por su hermana, mujer comerciante muy reconocida en el barrio donde habita, lo que le permitió desarrollar su oferta de Jean, calzado, suéteres, vestidos, bermudas y planes de minutos, pues ellos le solicitaban que les llevaran mercancías; Paola y su hermana sin tener fondo de efectivo decidieron  acudir a un agiotista, para iniciar su negocio, vendiendo a diario y cobrando semanalmente, los productos que le habían entregado a su clientela  para pagarlos en cuotas. Hoy se ha independizado de su hermana y sus  ventas las realiza a crédito, trabajando todos los días, desde las 7 de la mañana, hasta las 10 de la noche, con el fin de que finalmente pueda contar con un local propio, donde exhibir la mercancía; su mayor desafío es lograr que sus hijos alcancen estudios profesionales y ellos son justamente es el motor de su vida y la de su cónyuge .
