En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa calzado y vestuario, artículos que han sido encargados por su clientela, Con esta inversión mejora su negocio en cuanto que aumenta su capital de trabajo y con ello la oferta a su clientela, lo que hace que su credikiva tenga éxito.
texts.en: Paola is 32. She lives with her husband and their two children ages 14 and 17. She lives on the south east side of the city, where she sells a wide variety of products. She even offers cell phone call services taking advantage of a large customer pool. She started the business two years ago, encouraged by her sister, who is well known in the neighborhood. This allowed them to develop a business selling jeans, shoes, sweaters, dresses, shorts and cell phone plans, making daily sales and collecting every week, so people could make small payments. She has her own business now, without her sister. She sells on credit, working every day from 7am to 10pm, so she can finally open her own store, where to show her products. Her biggest challenge is to see her children become professionals; they are the driving force for her and her husband. She is currently asking for a her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy footwear and apparel clothing pre-ordered by her customers. She will invest her profits in business improvements, which will translate in better offers to her customers, and thus will prove that her loan was successful.

loans.use: to buy footwear and apparel clothing pre-ordered by her customers

loans.name: Ernesto Cristino

texts.es:
Ernesto se alista muy de mañana para preparar el negocio de su mama y también para asistir a clases, quién un día, no muy lejano, podrá alzar el birrete y obtener el título como ingeniero telemático quién  será capaz de desarrollar sistemas de transmisión y procesamiento de información, que permitan aumentar la productividad de las instituciones a las que sirva, de esa manera podrá obtener un trabajo digno que ayudara a cubrir a sus necesidades y apoyar a sus padres quienes siempre le han brindado apoyo. 
Sin embargo para convertirse en un profesional, Ernesto necesita de herramientas que le ayuden a facilitar su trabajo y de esa manera cumplir con las asignaciones y deberes de la universidad. Ernesto solicita el crédito para la compra de una computadora que le será de utilidad en su labor diaria, así como formarse como un buen profesional, confía en el financiamiento que le brindara un fututo prospero para él y su familia, Ernesto tiene muchos anhelos de culminar sus estudios, se caracteriza por ser un joven, responsable, honesto, comprometido con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ernesto gets ready very early in the morning to set up his mother's business and go to school.  One day,  in the not too distant future, he will be able to raise up his cap and gown and get his degree as a telematic engineer.  He will be able to develop information transmission and processing systems which increase the productivity of the institutions they serve.  This work will allow Ernesto to get a dignified job and will help cover his expenses as well as help his parents, who have always given him their support. 
Nevertheless, in order to become a professional, Ernesto needs the tools that will facilitate his work and complete his university assignments and obligations.  Ernesto needs the loan to purchase a computer, which will be useful to him in his daily work as well as in becoming a good professional.  Ernesto is confident that the loan will offer a prosperous future for himself and for his family.  He has a great desire to finish his education.  Ernesto is known for being a responsible, honest young man who is committed to his studies.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Yulis

texts.es: Yulis  de 42 años de edad se dedica al servicio de peluquería en un pequeño espacio ubicado en el patio del lugar donde habita; Desde muy pequeña a Yulis le gustó aprender las técnicas de corte de cabello y aprendió viendo a peluqueros en su día a día. Inicialmente motilaba a sus muñecas y posteriormente cuando fue creciendo, se ejercitó con sus amigas, y vecinos. Poco a poco esta clientela creció y debió recurrir al apoyo de su sobrino, quien motila a los hombres y está muy actualizado en el diseño de figuras en el corte, cuando así lo requieren sus clientes. .  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un aire acondicionado, y materiales constructivos, para adecuar mejor su local.  Con esta inversión mejora su negocio en cuanto que mejora la imagen y la calidad del servicio, pues actualmente trabaja en el patio de su vivienda, lo que hace que su credikiva tenga éxito.
texts.en:
Yulis, who is 42 years old, makes her living as a hairdresser in a small space located on the patio of her home. Since she was young, Yulis loved to learn the techniques for cutting hair and learned watching hairdressers in her daily life. At first she cut dolls' hair, and later, when she had grown, she would practice on her friends and neighbors. Little by little her clientele grew and she had to turn to the help of her nephew, who cuts men's hair and is very up-to-date on fashionable haircuts when his clients require them.

Currently Yulis is applying for a credikiva, the first financing she's making with la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,with which she will buy an air conditioner and constructive materials to better tailor her shop. With this investment she will improve her store while she improves the image and quality of her service. Since she is currently working from the patio of her home, what she will do with her credikiva will bring her success!

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and constructive materials to tailor her shop

loans.name: Uwalle

texts.en: Uwalle is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Uwalle joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Alhamdu, Absalam and Jilios. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Uwalle would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Uwalle can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about her goals, Uwalle spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, hoping to eventually ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to meet expenses like her children's school fees and clothing; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rabi

texts.en:
Rabi is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children, Nasiru, Ya'U and Nafisa.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rabi would have had to sell her maize at a low price soon after harvest to meet her immediate cash needs for such basics as food and clothing. With this 9,485 NGN loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rabi can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Rabi spoke of her ambition not only to use the additional income to educate her children but eventually to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than harvest time rates.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Hansu, Hadiza and Ibrahim.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at a low price soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for such basics as food and clothing. With this 9,485 NGN loan and Babban Gona’s support, Adamu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Adamu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, hoping to ensure his children are eventually educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: store his maize at harvest time and sell it later for up to 40% higher than harvest time rates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines. Teresita has been in this business for 30 years now.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish. In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 77 years old and married, with eleven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Clarita requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 32 years old and married woman with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of products to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of products to sell

loans.name: Flordeluna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Flordeluna works hard to support her family. She has a sari sari, or general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing.

Flordeluna has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She is applying for a 23,000 PHP loan to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, etc. for her store. She hopes that her hard work will help her save enough money to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her well-organized store.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nancy works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell ready-to-wear.  Nancy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell for her buy-and-sell frozen foods business.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 50 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Nora has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Nora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Illuminada

texts.en:
Illuminada works hard to help support her six children. She is married and has a sari sari, or general store in the Philippines.

Illuminada has applied for a 4,600 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar-powered lamp. She is getting it because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. She is aware that by using it, she is not only saving money but is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar-powered lamp.

loans.name: Merah

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Merah works hard to support her family.

She has a nipa-roofing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Merah is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her nipa-roofing business.

Merah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her nipa roofing.

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a flower shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of flowers to sell for her flower shop business.

Rochelle has been in this business for three years. Rochelle earns more income from pre-paid mobile load cards.

Rochelle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of flowers to sell.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 61 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Isabelita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Isabelita requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Isabelita has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Isabelita would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Maria Veraliz

texts.es: María, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y reside en el Municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. María, lleva 5 años de dedicarse a su propia actividad que le genera ingresos para sostener a la familia. Vende camisas, blusas, jeans, faldas, short y otros que le piden. Esta mercadería la vende de forma ambulante y por pedidos. Ha mantenido activa esta actividad gracias a los prestamos que ha invertido, actualmente solicita el cuarto ciclo a ODEF, que es por 8,000 Lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de camisas, blusas y jeans lo que le permitirá aumentar el inventario y sus ventas. Sus planes son crecer como comerciante y vivir del negocio ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 41 years old. She is a single mother of a boy and they live in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Maria has been working on her own for the past five years supporting her family. She sell shirts, blouses, jeans, skirts, shorts and other items. She sells door to door and upon request. She's been able to stay active, thanks to several loans she has invested and she's currently asking for a fourth from ODEF, for 8.000 Lempiras. She will use it to buy shirts, blouses and jeans that will allow her to increase her sample inventory. Her goal is to grow as a business woman and life off of her business and help her family.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses and jeans to sell

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jeanette works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling aluminum and glass. Jeanette is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Jeanette has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 68 years old and married, with five children. She resides in Lopez Jaena with her family. 

She peddles fresh fish in the local community to make a living. For over fifteen years, it has sustained her and provided for her children's education costs. She has successfully repaid her previous loan which was used to buy fish to sell. She has taken a new loan to buy a variety of fish to offer to her customers.

She hopes to earn more income and to be able to operate her business safely.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to offer to her customers

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is from Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Edgar and they have two children. She has been employed by a garment factory in Cavite for two years through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Fe supervises the Production Cutting. Before sewing can begin, pattern pieces must be made, layouts determined, and fabric cut. She pays close attention on how the cutters and trimmers take the patterns and cut out material to minimize mistakes.

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Fe, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Fe is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying them since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day.  She looks forward for your positive response and any coming amount from you will surely be of great help. She will also use the loan to pay for the operational expense of her mother-in-law who has an intestinal problem.

Fe hopes to improve the general living condition of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay for her mother-in-law's operation.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a grocery store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of goods to sell in her store.

Rosalie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Rosalie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina works hard to support her family. Regina is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, young coconuts, etc.

Regina has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, young coconuts, etc.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and farming sugarcane. Elsie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gerbert Antonio

texts.es:
Gerbert, tiene un negocio de tienda, librería y depósito de bebidas; vive con sus padres, es soltero, con el negocio puede tener ingresos para apoyar en los gastos familiares a sus padres; su negocio nació hace 20 años, su familia le ayuda a atenderlo de 5:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., su madre le enseño está actividad y poco a poco la ha mejorado, su ventaja es que los productos son muy variados y actualizados.
 Utilizará el crédito para comprar cereales, carnes, verduras y pan, ofrecerá nuevos productos, los cuales tienen demanda en la época de fin de año por las gradaciones estudiantiles y fiestas navideñas, espera satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, tener ingresos nuevos con los que respalda el pago de sus compromisos.
Gerbert sueña con expandir más su negocio, cancelar su deuda y  tener la oportunidad de una mejor vida junto a sus padres.
texts.en:
Gerbert owns a store, bookstore, and beverage shop. He lives with his parents, is single, and with his shop he can generate income to support his parents with their expenses.

His business started 20 years ago. His family helps him with it from 5am to 5pm; his mother taught him this business and little by little he has improved it. His advantage is that his products are very diverse and up-to-date.

Gerbert will use this loan to buy cereal, meat, vegetables and bread, and so he will be able to offer new products, which are in demand around the end of the year, for school graduations and Christmas parties. He hopes to satisfy the needs of his clients and to generate new income he can use to support the payment of his commitments. Gerbert dreams of expanding his store more, paying off his debt, and having the opportunity for a better life together with his parents.

loans.use: to buy cereal, meat, vegetables and bread, so he will be able to offer new products

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 62 years old and a widow, with four children. She is a very-hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a buy-and-sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for five years. In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Maridy

texts.en:
Maridy is 34 years old, married, and has four children.  

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Maridy requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

Maridy has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pig

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 66 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal for eight years.

Marietta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinat, 53 years old, is living in a community of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has five children in total; two are single and three are married. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a rice farming business in a small farmland which is located near her house. So far, it is more than twenty years that she has been a farmer. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 5.00 per day.

Sinat wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, she hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV, and radio. She is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a solar energy home system

loans.name: Guillermo Isai

texts.es:
Guillermo de 23 años de edad, estudió hasta el bachillerato, no continuó estudiando debido a la falta de recursos económicos. Sin embargo, aprendió muy bien la agricultura y ahora es su fuente de ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, está casado y junto a su esposa han procreado 4 hijos, la última es una pequeña que apenas está en parvularia, los otros 3 están mas avanzados en la educación. 

Guillermo aprendió la agricultura a la edad de 12 años, le ayudaba a su padre y asi fué aprendiendo poco a poco, ahora él sabe muchísimo de ese oficio y es por eso que decidió independizarse y hacer su propia cosecha desde que se casó, siembra maíz, el terreno donde tiene la cosecha está a una distancia de un kilómetro aproximadamente, tiene que levantarse muy temprano ya que también se dedica a la ganadería y tiene 2 vacas a las que ordeña antes de irse para el campo.


El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar insumos agrícolas, tales como abono, herbicidas para plaga entre otros, para que su cosecha sea buena y abundante, ademas pretende comprar unos novillos de repasto para cuidarlos y venderlos cuando ya estén mas grandes y asi tener ingresos adicionales que le permitan satisfacer las necesidades básicas que vayan surgiendo.

El sueño para Guillermo es que su cosecha sea abundante y buena para obtener mejores resultados y por ende ganancias, asi mismo mejorar su vivienda para darle una vida digna a su familia y ayudar a sus hijos para que se preparen con una buena educación y tengan mayores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 23 years old and studied until his high school diploma, but did not continue studying because of a lack of economic resources. Nevertheless, he learned agriculture really well and today it's his source of income to cover the necessities of his family. He is married and together with his wife they have four children, the last of which is small enough to barely be in kindergarten. The other three are more advanced in their education. 

Guillermo learned to farm at the age of 12. He helped his father and thus learned little by little. Today he knows much more of this trade and thus he's decided to branch off and make his own harvest, since he's married. He sows maize, and the land where he has his harvest is about a kilometer in length. He must get up very early considering that he also makes his living raising cattle and has two cows which he must milk before leaving for the field.

He will use this loan to buy farming goods such as fertilizer and weed-killers for invasions etc so that his harvest is good and abundant. Additionally he hopes to buy some grazing cows to take care of and sell when they are large enough and to thus generate additional income which he can use to settle basic necessities that may come up. 

Guillermo's dream is for his harvest to be abundant and good, in order to obtain better results and thus better profits, likewise to improve his home in order to give his family a decent life and help his children to have a good education and better opportunities.

El sueño para Guillermo es que su cosecha sea abundante y buena para obtener mejores resultados y por ende ganancias, asi mismo mejorar su vivienda para darle una vida digna a su familia y ayudar a sus hijos para que se preparen con una buena educación y tengan mayores oportunidades.

loans.use: to buy farming goods such as fertilizer and weed-killers for invasions etc so his harvest will be good and abundant, and grazing cows

loans.name: Oydiniso

texts.ru:
Ойдинисо уроженка города Куляб. Куляб славиться своим гостеприимным, добрым и вежливым народом сохранивший древние традиции и обычаи. 
   У Ойдинисо большая семья. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей и двоих внуков. Ей никогда не бывает скучно с детьми. Ойдинисо как многие таджички занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она на дому принимает заказы на шитье. Данную деятельность она продвигает уже 5 лет. Ойдинисо с каждым заказом растет профессионально и самосовершенствуется. На данный момент Ойдинисо нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить швейные принадлежности. Она уверена, что с новыми материалами ей удастся продвинуть бизнес на новый уровень, и Вы можете помочь Ойдинисо!
texts.en: Oydiniso is a native of the city of Kulyab, known for its kind, hospitable and polite people who have preserved ancient traditions and customs to this very day.  She's married and has a large family.  With four children and two grandchildren, there's rarely a dull moment in her life.  Like many Tajiks, she's a seamstress by trade, and has worked at home making women's clothing to order for the past 5 years.  With each filled order, she gains new skills and perfects her craft.  At the moment, she needs a loan to buy some dressmaking materials.  Oydiniso is confident that, with your help, she'll have a fresh supply of materials and be able to expand her business like never before.

loans.use: buy dressmaking materials

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DEMBAGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Biba, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales et de condiments.
Les femmes du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente SANATA, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter des sacs de sel, des sacs d’oignon, des cartons de cube Maggi, des cartons de patte de tomate et du grain d’arachide chez les grossistes à Dioïla.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en: The DEMBAGNOUMA group is made up of married women, who are on average 46 years old and who have 4 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Biba, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali). They met through family, neighbor, and friend connections. They sell grains and seasonings. The women of the DEMBAGNOUMA group are on their second group loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand of their clientele, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso. The client, Sanata, second from the left, is illiterate, and currently sells seasonings. She plans to buy sacks of salt, sacks of onions, boxes of Maggi cubes, boxes of tomato paste, and peanut grains wholesale in Dioïla. She sells at retail for cash out of her house or at the market to a mixed clientele. She foresees making a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonings

loans.name: Diamadjigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DIAMADJIGUI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments et de l’habillement.
Les femmes du groupe DIAMADJIGUI sont à leur quatorzième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente DJELIKA, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de céréales. Elle compte acheter des sacs de mil et de maïs sur place.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en: The DIAMADJIGUI group is made up of married women, who are on average 32 years old and who have 3 children. They all live in traditional families in the city of Massigui, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali). They met through family, neighbor, and friend connections. They sell seasonings and clothing. The women of the DIAMADJIGUI group are on their fourteenth group loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand of their clientele, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso. The client, DJELIKA, second person standing from the left, is illiterate, and currently sells grains. She plans to buy sacks of millet and corn on the spot. She sells at retail for cash at the market to a mixed clientele. She foresees making a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory of grocery items, soft drinks, fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert supports his family by raising pigs for sale. He also works on the family's farm to make extra income. He has repaid successfully his previous loan used for buying feeds. 

He is now planning for the expansion of his business. He took a new loan to buy materials to make a fence for his pigs. He plans to build a shelter for his pigs to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy materials to make a fence for his pigs

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean works hard to support her family. Mary Jean is married and has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines.

She requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Mary Jean has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Waguessé 2 Group

texts.fr: Fatimata membre représentatif est mariée et mère de deux enfants tous 2 scolarisés. Elle vend des céréales(maïs et petit mil). Avec ce prêt, cette brave dame va acheter 3 sacs de maïs de 100 kg chacun à raison de 14 000 francs l'unité ,soit    42 000 francs CFA les 3 sacs. En plus de cela, elle pourrait acheter 2 sacs de petit mil d'un montant de 48 000 francs CFA. Le reste de l'argent servirait à faire les autres dépenses liées à son commerce comme le transport, etc. Après ses ventes, elle pourrait avoir une bénéfice nette minimum de 30 000 francs CFA qui lui permettra de pourvoir aux petits besoins de ses enfants tout en continuant son activité.
texts.en:
Fatimata, [the group's] featured member, is the married mother of two children, both in school. She sells cereals (maize and millet).

This fine lady will use her loan to buy three 100-kilo bags of maize at 14,000 francs each, that is 42,000 CFA francs for three bags. On top of that she could buy two bags of millet for 48,000 CFA francs. The rest of the money would go to other expenses related to her trade such as transportation, etc.

After her sales, she could achieve a minimum net profit of 30,000 CFA francs that will enable her to meet her children's small needs while pursuing her business activity.

loans.use: stock up on cereals for resale

loans.name: Wurobarika Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de Marie, emprunteur représentatif est un groupe de femmes battantes qui est à son quatrième prêt avec ACFIME. ce groupe fait des remboursement correctes et à la bonne date. Marie est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle vend des légumes( choux, tomates, concombres, etc). Son époux est jardinier et les deux s'entraident pour la gestion de leur famille.Avec prêt, cette brave dame va acheter chaque jour des légumes pour vendre à ses clients. les bénéfices lui permettront de continuer son commerce et d'aider sa famille.
texts.en: Marie’s group, a typical borrowing group, is a group of warrior women on their fourth loan with ACFIME. This group correctly repays their loans on time. Marie is a married mother of eight. She sells vegetables (cabbage, tomatoes, cucumbers, etc.). Her husband is a gardener and they help each other out in managing their family. With this loan, this good lady is going to buy vegetables everyday to sell to her customers. The earnings will allow her to continue with her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to stock up daily on vegetables to sell

loans.name: Wuro Sindja Group

texts.fr: Assita, membre représentatif du groupe Wuro Sindja est célibataire et mère d'un enfant qu'elle a scolarisé. Elle fait le commerce de l'huile en détail et vend aussi des fruits. cette brave dame fait ces deux activités depuis 10 ans maintenant. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 7 bidons d'huile de 20 l chacun d'un montant total de 115 000 francs cfa stocker pour vendre . le reste servira à acheter des fruits qu'elle revendra. Le bénéfice qu'elle gagnera lui permettra de continuer ses activités et de s'occuper de son enfant.
texts.en: Assita, the representative of the Wuro Sindja group, is single and a mother of a child, who she educated. She sells oil for cash and also sells fruit. This good lady has been doing this for ten years. With this loan, she plans to buy seven 20-liter canisters of oil for a total of 115,000 FCFA to stock and sell. The rest will go towards buy fruit that she will sell. The earnings will allow her to continue with her businesses and to take care of her child.

loans.use: to buy seven 20-liter canisters of oil and fruit to sell

loans.name: Esther De Petitanse 2, 4 & 5 Group

texts.fr:
Modone est le coordonateur de son groupe Esther de Petitense 2, 4 & 5. Il est marie et Il a 3 enfants. Modone habite dans la region nord d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de Léau portable est très limité. Avant de ce commencer ce commerce il était  un proffesseur. Modone dirige son commerce de Produit divers. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce. 

Des autres membres de Esther de Petitense 2, 4 & 5 ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce tel que ventes produits cosmétiques, charbon, vetement, produit divers, etc. Modone dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera a construire une grande maison et faire l´éducation de ses enfants avec l’aide  d’Esperanza Int
texts.en:
Modone is the coordinator of his group, Esther de Petitense 2, 4 & 5. He is married and has 3 children. Modone lives in the region north of Haiti, where electricity is rare and potable water is very limited. Before starting this business, he was a professor. Modone sells diverse products. He hopes that this loan will help him to grow his business.

Some other members of Esther de Petitense 2, 4 & 5 need a loan for their businesses in selling cosmetic products, coal, clothing, miscellaneous items, etc. Modone says that his main goal is to have a big business, which will help him to build a big house and to educate his children with the help of Esperanza, Int'l.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Marilisa

texts.en:
Marilisa is from Laguna, Philippines. Her partner is Edgar, and they have two children. She has been employed at a garment factory in Cavite for two years through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Marilisa is a sample maker. She constructs the pattern and design provided by the garment pattern maker for the pre-production sampling.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Marilisa is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses, and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Marilisa is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative, and she had no problem in returning it back, since the loan payment is being deducted every payday. She looks forward for your positive response and any coming amount from you will surely be of great help. She will also use the loan to pay for the educational expenses of her child.

Marilisa hopes that there will always be provision for her family in each day, and she prays for guidance and protection for them. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for the educational expenses of her child.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a 51-year-old married woman from Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Philippines, who has 10 children. She signed up for her membership in PMPC in 2010, after she learned of the financial assistance it gives. 

Editha owns and manages a small restaurant in front of her house, which is positioned near a national road that many people pass through looking for places to eat. Due to the improvements to their town, many people travel in and out of the vicinity, so she has decided to expand her business to cook more dishes in order to draw more people to visit and eat in her eatery. 

To fund this project, she needs additional capital to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

location.town: Tangub-P3 Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 54 years old and lives in Josefina, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with three adult-age children. She has a store that sells foods and medicines. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan to restock cases of soft drinks for retailing. She has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Merlinda wants to buy a hectare of land for a farming activity.

loans.use: to restock cases of soft drinks for retailing

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Gina is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Narziniso

texts.ru: Нарзинисо женщина 55 лет ,замужем,мать четверых детей . Она родилась и выросла в сельской местности и с детства ухаживала за домашним скотом,помогала родителям по дому.У её родителей не было средств,чтобы обучить её и дать высшее образование ,поэтому Нарзинисо после замужества продолжила дело родителей и начала заниматься животноводством.В настоящее время на своём участке земли она ухаживает за пятью коровами и семью баранами.Молоко ,полученное от коров,её дочь продаёт на рынке.Она хочет закупить корм для скота,но не имеет нужной суммы.Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Нарзинисо заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Narziniso is a 55 years old, married and a mother of four children. She was born and grew up in a rural area and took care of livestock since her childhood, and helped her parents with the household. Her parents did not have money to teach her and provide her with higher education, and this is why Narziniso, after getting married, continued her parents' business and became involved in animal husbandry. At the present time, she takes care of five cows and seven rams on her plot of land. Her daughter sells the milk, obtained from the cows, at a market. She wants to purchase livestock feed, but does not have the needed amount. This is why she requested financial support from MDO Arvand. Narziniso is grateful to MDO Arvand in advance for the support and trust.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is 43 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is a widow with four adult children. She has a shop that sells meat from her own pigs and has had this business for five years. She requested a loan to buy five sacks of feed and vitamins to sustain her piglets and have healthy meat to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future Angelita wants to raise two heads of pigs to save money for her children.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 49 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with six adult-age children. She has a store that sells different kinds of products. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan to restock her sari-sari (variety) store with basic commodities like shampoo and detergent bars to sell and supply her customers' demand. 

She has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Imelda dreams that her sari-sari store becomes a mini grocery.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari (variety) store with basic commodities like shampoo and detergent bars

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 48-year-old mother who owns and manages a small retail store within the local community. Due to the hardship of living, she aims to make her business more profitable in order to support the education of her seven children and sustain their daily necessities. 

Having inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more stock of canned goods, noodles, bakery breads, dried fish, eggs, laundry soaps, beverages and seasonings to resell. She is hoping that someday, she will further improve her store through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stock of canned goods, noodles, bakery breads, dried fish, eggs, laundry soaps, beverages and seasonings to resell

loans.name: Leonites

texts.en:
Leonites is 42 years old and married. She has six children living with her in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Leonites is peddling fresh fish variants in the local community to make a living. She has been doing this job for over 16 years already. 

Her loan application is worth 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), which will be used to purchase fresh fish supplies and in return sell to the local community. Leonites hopes to obtain enough revolving funds for the business and acquire enough resources to vend. In so doing, she can gain more income and get the chance to build up a small fish stall operated in its own place in the mini-market lane.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of fresh fish to sell to the local community.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 32 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Lorna has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, biscuits, candies, soft drinks, cereals, etc. 

In the future, Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 37 years old and has six children. Alma is married and has five children who are currently in school.

Alma is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alma has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia has always the enthusiasm for managing her farming activities, from which she earns a meager income, helping her husband in support of their family. At the age of 51 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family, most especially for her children's education. She never stopped pursuing her goals for the benefit of the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her farming activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for labor cost in land preparation for growing her crops. In the future, Delia wishes to own a hauling truck for easy transport of her produce to any marketplace in the province.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost in land preparation for growing her crops

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 74 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children who are now at their adult age. For her source of living, Rufina has been engaged in a snack processing and vending business for 20 years already. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity, to help her husband in providing for their family's needs. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing various ingredients like flour, sugar, oil, margarine and other ingredients for her snack processing and vending business. Rufina has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future Rufina hopes to establish a mini snack hauz in her area.

loans.use: to purchase various ingredients like flour, sugar, oil, and margarine.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Gemma is borrowing 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 48 years old and married with four children.

Leny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Leny has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming bananas and a tailoring business.

Leny aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gulzada

texts.ru: Гулзада, 44 года, замужем,есть 3 детей, у нее высшее образование, работает директором школы. Гулзада известна как принципиальный, честный и добросердечный человек. Семья Гулзады в 2014 году в поисках источника дохода, начала свой бизнес в предоставлении услуг в станции техобслуживания, помещение станции собственное. Уже наработаны постоянные клиенты, ежемесячный доход Гулзады - 10,000 сом (KGS). Гулзаде необходимо приобрести дополнительные станки и автомобильные шины для перепродажи, чтобы увеличить количество клиентов и ассортимент предоставляемых услуг. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на закупку станков и шин. Доходы от кредита Гулзада будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие семейного бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на высшее образование ее детей.
texts.en: Gulzada is 44, married, and has three children.  She has a university education and works as a school principal.  She's known as a principled, honest and kindhearted woman.  In search of new sources of income, Gulzada's family started a new auto repair business this year, and owns the station it runs out of.  They've already developed a solid customer base, and Gulzada is now earning roughly 10,000 som per month.  She needs to buy more machine tools and car tires for resale to expand her client base and the services she offers, and is seeking a loan of 150,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to do so.  Gulzada plans on using her extra income due to the loan to further develop her family business so she'll be able to set aside money for her children's college funds.

loans.use: buy machine tools and car tires to increase the variety of services in her auto repair shop and attract more customers

loans.name: Nongtaaba De Bingo Group

texts.fr:
Mme EVELYNE est responsable du groupe NONGTAABA DE BINGO. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 13ans. 04 vont à l’école.
Mme vend du dolo (bière de mil) et des céréales depuis plus de 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son village.
Elle veut s’acheter 01 sac de mil germé, 01sac d’haricot et une rangée de bois de chauffe.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut ajouter l’élevage des porcs. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande dolotière.
texts.en:
Ms. Evelyne is the person responsible for the Nongtaaba de Bingo group. She is the married mother of five children, the eldest of whom is 25 years old and the youngest is 13. Four of them attend school.

She has been selling dolo (millet beer) and grain for over seven years. She resupplies at the village market and wants to buy one bag of sprouted millet, one bag of beans and a row of firewood.

With her profits, she wants to add pig farming [to her activities]. She aims to become a great seller of dolo.

loans.use: buy one bag of sprouted millet, one bag of beans and a row of firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, and fuel for her tractor

loans.name: Maria Patrocinia

texts.es:
La señora María Patrocinia de 70 años de edad es casada tiene 01 hijo que depende de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, frescos, granos básicos, etc.
Doña María Patrocinia  es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su  hijo que está estudiando, su venta es en su casa de habitación es una persona muy especial es de un carácter fuerte, es una  muy  buena cliente de Prisma.
Doña María Patrocinia está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de arroz, azúcar, café, frijoles, frescos, churros, papas, plátanos, etc.  Con el  apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y de esta forma mejorar también su condición de vida ya que desea vender lo suficiente para obtener de esa forma mejores ganancias. Su sueño es tener mejor su casa y también mejorar mas su negocio para vender de todo y que su negocio sea el mejor de la zona.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
70-year old Sra. María Patrocinia is married and has a dependent son. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She has her own house. For the last five years she has earned her living running a corner store where she sells groceries, soft drinks, basic grains etc.

Sra. María Patrocinia is an enterprising woman with a great desire to help her son who is a student. Her store is located in her house. She is a special person with a strong character; she is a good client of Prisma. 

She is seeking a loan to buy rice, sugar, coffee, beans, doughnuts, potatoes, bananas etc. With help from this loan Sra. María will be able to increase income and improve her standard of living. Her greatest wishes are to make improvements to her house, expand her business, and make it the best in the area.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -- October 2014.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, coffee, beans, soft drinks, doughnuts, potatoes, bananas etc. for her store

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJANTOYERELA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 49 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Fala Koulikoro, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales et de condiments.
Les femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA sont à leur vingt septième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente AWA, première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter des sacs d’oignon, des paniers de tomate, du poisson fumé et du beurre de karité sur place.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Djantoyerela group consists of married women who on average are 49 years old with five children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Fala Koulikoro, part of the Dioïla district in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They are retail merchants of cereals and condiments. The women in the Djantoyerela group are on their twenty-seventh group loan. In order to meet their customers' huge demands, they call upon Soro Yiriwaso.

The client Awa, the first person standing from left to right, is illiterate. She is currently a retailer of condiments. She intends to buy bags of onions, baskets of tomatoes, smoked fish and shea butter locally.

Retail sales are conducted from her home, for cash to a mixed clientele. She expects to achieve monthly profits of 40,000 CFA francs which will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Koba, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments et de l’habillement.
Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente TENIN, première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter 2 sacs de sel, de l’oignon, de la potasse et de la feuille de baobab séché sur place.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Djekafo group consists of married women who on average are 39 years old with three children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Koba, part of the Dioïla district in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They are retail merchants of cereals, condiments and clothing.

The women in the Djekafo group are on their second group loan. In order to meet their customers' huge demands, they call upon Soro Yiriwaso.

The client Tenin, the first person standing from left to right, is illiterate. She is currently a retailer of condiments, and intends to buy locally two bags of salt, onions, potash and dried leaves from the baobab tree.

Retail sales are conducted from her home, for cash to a mixed clientele. She expects to achieve monthly profits of 15,000 CFA francs which will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Mil Amores Group

texts.es: Mil amores lo conforman tres socios exitosos en sus vidas laboral, quien lo coordina es la señora Idalia, una joven de 24 años de edad, casada y madre de una hija por quien se esfuerza cada día para poder brindarle mejores condiciones de vida, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa nueva en su municipalidad desde hace dos años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de flete de leña, golosinas y frijol, se ha propuesto como meta impulsar otro negocio, para percibir ingresos tanto de la venta de ropa como de la venta de golosinas y frijoles cocidos. El resto de los integrantes son el señor Rafael quien tiene la edad de 54 años y se dedica a la elaboración de piñatas en su domicilio desde hace dos años, y el señor Ervin de 44 años de edad y quien vende churros y golosinas nacionales desde hace tres años en las calles de su comunidad, municipalidad y en la capital.
texts.en:
The Mil Amores group consists of three members who have successful work lives. The coordinator of the group is Sra. Idalia. She is 24 years old, married, and has a daughter for whom she works hard every day in order to provide her with better living conditions.  For two years now Idalia has earned her living selling clothing. The loan will be used to buy a load of firewood, candy, and beans. Her goal is to to start another business and earn more money by selling candy and cooked beans as well as clothing.

The other members of the group are 54-year old Sr. Rafael who has made piñatas in his home for two years, and 44-year old Sr. Ervin who has sold doughnuts and candy for three years in the streets of his community, the municipality, and the capital.

loans.use: Buy clothing, candy, nd beans so she can start another business

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 63 years old and married with three children.  

Elisa is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a businesswoman who earns through retailing various items. She is a fully-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. 

Recently she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. 

She is on her way to renovating her house, because she wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks for house renovation

loans.name: Elorna

texts.en: Elorna is 50 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with three adult-age children. She has a restaurant that sells different kinds of food. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan to buy meat, vegetables, seasonings and other spices for her restaurant to cook different kinds of food to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Elorna wants to extend her restaurant to accommodate all her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, seasonings and other spices for her restaurant

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie is 43 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with 3 school-aged children. 

Charlie is one of the members in good standing (MIGS) of PMPC in their area, and he has been a member for 1 year. He has a hectare of rice field and has had this business for 10 years. 

He has requested a loan for land redemption and cultivation, as he plans to plant corn as an additional farming activity to earn more to support the financial needs of his children.  

In the future, Charlie hopes to have more harvest every quarter.

loans.use: to redeem land and cultivate it for corn production

loans.name: Gerame

texts.en:
Gerame works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Gerame has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 7 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizers used in farming

loans.name: Keneya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KENEYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Koba, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de l’habillement et d’articles divers.
Les femmes du groupe KENEYA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente KOURANI, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de céréales. Elle compte acheter 4 sacs de maïs sur place.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Keneya group consists of married women who on average are 35 years old with three children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Koba, part of the Dioïla district in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They are retail merchants of cereals, clothing and various products. The women in the Keneya group are on their second group loan. In order to meet their customers' huge demands, they call upon Soro Yiriwaso.

The client Kourani, the second person from left to right, is illiterate. She is currently a retailer of cereals, and intends to buy four bags of maize locally.

Retail sales are conducted at the market, for cash to a mixed clientele. She expects to achieve monthly profits of 45,000 CFA francs which will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: buy cereals

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 49 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are in school. Merly works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 20 years. She requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to purchase a solar lamp.

In the future Merly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Abdulhafiz

texts.ru:
Абдулхафиз начинающий бизнесмен. Ему 26 лет. Он уроженец района Бохтар. Он женат, его жена портниха. Мама Абдулхафиза домохозяйка. Его отец имеет магазин продуктов питания и Абдулхафиз работал продавцов в магазине.
   Абдулхафиз решил начать свой бизнес и стать хорошим предпринимателем как свой отец. Он собирается получить кредит и купить двое телят и после 30 дней откорма продаст их с наценкой. Для начала данной деятельности он подготовился отлично. Он построил коровник и запасался кормом для скотин. Ему не хватает только $1000, чтобы купить телят. Вы можете помочь Абдулхафизу начать новый бизнес, стать успешным предпринимателем и добиться признания в этой области.
texts.en: Abdulhafiz is an aspiring entrepreneur.  He is 26, and a native of the Bohtar region of Tajikistan.  His wife is a seamstress, his mother is a homemaker, and his father owns a grocery store where Abdulhafiz worked as a clerk.  He's decided to start his own business and become a savvy businessman like his father, and is seeking a loan to buy two calves, which he'll then fatten for 30 days and sell for a profit.  He's made thorough preparations for his new business, building a cattle barn and laying in stores of feed for his animals.  He only needs a loan of $1,000 to buy the calves.  It's in your power to help Abdulhafiz get his business up and running, and gain recognition as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: start a new livestock-raising business

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNONTALA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Koba, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de l’habillement, de chaussure et d’articles divers.
Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNONTALA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente SATA, deuxième personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de céréales. Elle compte acheter 4 sacs de maïs sur place.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Massigui à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Kotognontala group consists of married women who on average are 32 years old with three children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Koba, part of the Dioïla district in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They are retail merchants of cereals, clothing, shoes and various products. The women in the Kotognontala group are on their second group loan. In order to meet their customers' huge demands, they call upon Soro Yiriwaso.

The client Sata, the second person sitting from left to right, is illiterate. She is currently a retailer of cereals, and intends to buy four bags of maize locally.

Retail sales are conducted in Massigui, for cash to a mixed clientele. She expects to achieve monthly profits of 35,000 CFA francs which will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: Achat de céréales

loans.name: Saniya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SANIYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, de fruits et légumes et de henné.
Les femmes du groupe SANIYA sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente KADIA, première personne de la gauche vers la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de fruits et légumes. Elle compte acheter des paniers de bananes chez les grossistes à Banco. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Saniya group consists of married women who on average are 32 years old with three children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Dioïla, part of the Dioïla district in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They are caterers and retail merchants of condiments, fruit and vegetables, and henna [dye].

The women in the Saniya group are on their first group loan. In order to meet their customers' huge demands, they call upon Soro Yiriwaso.

The client Kadia, the first person from left to right, is illiterate. She is currently a retailer of fruits and vegetables, and intends to buy baskets of bananas from wholesalers in Banco.

Retail sales are conducted from her home and at the market, for cash to a mixed clientele. She expects to achieve monthly profits of 20,000 CFA francs which will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: buy fruit

loans.name: Olaya

texts.es:
La señora Olaya de 36  años de edad es casada, tiene un hijo  que dependen de ella, vive en una  comunidad de San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 02 años  a la venta de abarrotería su venta es de lunes a domingo.
Doña Olaya es una mujer emprendedora que también vende ajonjolí y sandia junto con su esposo, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de frescos, pollo, aceites, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, queso, leche, pan, café, jabones, aceite, etc. Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos  y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y que sea uno de los más grandes y conocidos de la zona.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2014
texts.en:
Olaya is 36 years old and married. She has one son who depends on her. Olaya lives in a community in San Lorenzo, Valle, in the south of Honduras. She owns the house where she lives and, for two years, she has been working seven days a week selling groceries.

Olaya is an enterprising woman. She also sells watermelons and sesame alongside her husband. Olaya is applying for this loan in order to buy fresh food, chicken, oil, sugar, rice, beans, cheese, milk, bread, coffee, soap and more for her business. Olaya intends to increase her income with the help of this loan and thus improve her quality of life and continue supporting her family.

Olaya’s dream is to improve her business and for it to become one of the biggest and best-known in the area.

San Lorenzo, Honduras,  October 2014

loans.use: to buy fresh food, chicken, oil, sugar, rice, beans, cheese, milk, bread, coffee, soap and more for her business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, es propietaria de un chalet en el que vende comida y bebidas, vive en casa propia con su esposo (quien cuanta con una pensión) y su hijo; se dedica a atender su negocio, lo fundo hace 20 años, en ocasiones trabaja y su hermana le ayuda en la atención del chalet, trabaja de lunes a sábado, está ubicado en una zona muy concurrida.
Invertirá el préstamo en la compra de láminas y pintura para remodelar el chalet, mejorará la imagen e higiene de su negocio, su objetivo es atraer nuevos clientes y mantenerlos satisfechos, espera mejorar su situación financiera.
Sueña con mejorar de forma sustancial y progresiva su negocio con el buen manejo de los créditos.
texts.en:
María owns a stall where she sells food and drinks. She lives in the house that she owns with her husband (who earns a pension) and their son. María makes a living running her business, which she started 20 years ago. María works and sometimes her sister helps. María works from Monday to Saturday. The business is located in a very busy area.

María will use this loan to buy metal sheeting and paint to do up her stall. This will improve her business’s image, and improve hygiene. María’s goal is to attract new customers and keep them satisfied. María hopes to improve her financial situation.

María dreams of making substantial progress at her business by managing her loan well.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and paint to do up her stall.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is a hardworking mother who mastered her skill in making homemade peanut butter.  She has been engaged in this work for four years.  The income from peanut butter helps her to support their family. Norma became a member of Paglaum Cooperative last May 2004, with several loans and no defaults.  Norma applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy 25 kilos of peanuts, 5 kilos of margarine, 10 kilos of sugar, and the remaining amount will be used to purchase bottles for peanut butter packaging.  Norma is very happy because she can continue saving in Paglaum for emergency needs and dreams of buying a motorcycle for deliveries.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and other ingredients to make homemade peanut butter to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Her name is Remedios, 60, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is now a widow and all her six children are working but their families are still struggling to have a better life. She still works hard to support herself and help her grandchildren get an education. 

Remedios has a rug-making business. She makes rugs for different uses and in various sizes. There are from round palm sized ones to clean cabinets and kitchen counters and large doormats . In the Philippines, rugs are a major item for housekeeping and cleaning, every household has them. Aside from her rug-making, she also sells barbecue for added income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 34,000 loan, which she will use to buy additional raw materials like fabric and thread to sew more rugs and doormats. Part of the loan she will use to buy fresh meat and charcoal for her barbecue business. She is thanking God and you for a good return on her investment and for the financial help that will be given her.

Remedios dreams of having a tailoring shop someday. She desires to see her children and grandchildren lead a much better, stable life.
