She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Esther De La Paz

texts.es:
Esther, manifiesta que los préstamos son de utilidad para tener un mejor negocio y generar ingresos para la subsistencia familiar, ya cuenta con una bomba en su pozo y ha mejorado la alimentación familiar.
Opta por un nuevo crédito para invertir en cocos, bebidas, azúcar, pan, condimentos y otros productos para elaborar la venta de refrescos y panes, busca seguir aprovechando la oportunidad de trabajar con créditos.
texts.en:
Esther demonstrates that loans are useful ways for people to improve their businesses and generate more income for their families. She now has a pump for her well and her family's food is better.

Esther now wants a new loan to buy coconuts, drinks, sugar, bread, spices and other ingredients for making and selling drinks and baking. She is hoping to continue taking advantage of this opportunity to obtain loans.

loans.use: buy coconuts, drinks, sugar, bread, spices and other ingredients for making and selling drinks and baking

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo; con la idea de tener recursos económicos para construir su casa propia hizo la apertura de una tienda, con la buena administración fortaleció su negocio y actualmente ya tiene una tienda mejor establecida y venta de comida. 
Invertirá en la compra de cereales, boquitas, jugos, gaseosas, dulces, huevos, aceite, etc., incrementara la mercadería de su negocio, sus clientes encontraran mejores ofertas, pretende aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
Tiene el ideal de cancelar su deuda con buena calificación crediticia y tener una vida familiar con menos necesidades.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband. With the idea of having the economic resources to build their own house, she opened a shop. Through good management, she strengthened her business and now has a better established shop and retail food store.

She will invest in the purchase of cereals, snacks, juices, sodas, sweets, eggs, oil, etc. She will increase her business' merchandise. Her customers will find better offers. She intends to expand her sales and income. She has the goal of repaying her debt with good quality credit and having a family life with fewer needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals, snacks, juices, sodas, sweets, eggs, oil, etc. and increase her business' merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, scallops and other seafood to support her business.

loans.name: Mercedesa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mercedesa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Mercedesa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc for her food vending business.

Mercedesa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc for her food production business.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 54 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Eufemia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eufemia has been in the pig fattening business for five years and also earns additional income from selling fish. 

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en: Vevencia is 65 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, the Philippines. She is a widow with 9 adult-age children. She manages her rice field with the help of her children and has had this business for 50 years. She has requested a loan to buy 2 sacks of fertiliser to make her rice healthy and grow a larger harvest to sustain her family's daily needs. She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Vevencia wants to see her children loving and caring for each other.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of fertiliser.

loans.name: Reysale

texts.en:
Reysale is married and works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years now.

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

In the future, Reysale would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan, 44, lives in a small community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He is the father of four dependent children. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling it to the local dealers. On average, he can make an income of USD 2.00 per day.

Sophan is facing challenges with water utilization. Therefore, he would like to request a KIVA loan to buy a water pump for household use. With support from this loan, he hopes the water pump will be a convenient way for his family members to access clean water. He thanks all the lenders for their financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Numan Elias

texts.es:
Numan, está satisfecho por la atención y facilidad de pago que le brinda Padecomsm, solicita más capital para comprar algunas herramientas y repuestos para reparar vehículos, así continuara dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Invirtió el financiamiento anterior en su taller de vehículos, de esta manera ha mejorado la atención a sus clientes, la estabilidad de sus ingresos es favorable para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en: Numan is satisfied with the attention and payment facility that Padecomsm provides to him. He is requesting more capital to buy some tools and spare parts to repair vehicles. Thus he will continue giving good service to his customers. He invested the previous loan in his car shop. In this way, he has improved his customer service. The stability of his income is favorable for meeting his obligations.

loans.use: to buy some tools and spare parts to repair vehicles.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie is 38 years old and married with four children. She is a farmer together with her husband. They plant and harvest corn to sell. Elvie is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertiliser and insecticides. This will help improve crop production. Elvie will use additional profits as an emergency fund for the family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertiliser and insecticides.

loans.name: Felyn

texts.en: Felyn is 48 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, the Philippines. She is married with 2 adult-aged children. She has had a grocery store for 10 years. She has requested a loan to restock her store with rice, salt, oil and diapers to supply what her customers demand. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Felyn hopes to have more customers to buy her products so she can save some money.

loans.use: to restock her store with rice, salt, oil and diapers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy resources to fertilize and maintain cocoa plants.

loans.name: Madres Unidas Group

texts.es: Glady de 24 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella es parte del grupo “Madres Unidas” y está conformado por 06 socios Unidos y responsables. Glady cuenta con su negocio de repostería y pastelería. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio. Así mismo como actividad secundaria se dedica al servicio de transporte público. El crédito que solicitó es para la compra de harina, huevo, azúcar y leche. Su mayor deseo es acondicionar su local para exhibir sus productos. El grupo “Madres Unidas” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Glady se encuentra de pie es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo celeste.
texts.en:
Glady, 24 years old, is separated with one dependent daughter. She is part of the "Madres Unidas" group, which is made up of 6 responsible members who stay connected. 

Glady owns her business, a bakery and pastry shop. Through her efforts, she has been able to improve the business. As a secondary activity, she works in public transportation services.

She has requested a loan to buy flour, eggs, sugar and milk. Her greatest wish is to fix the shop so she can display the products.

The "Madres Unidas” group is thankful to Kiva lenders for the help provided. Glady is seen standing, second from the left and wearing a light blue top.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do home improvements (putting up walls in a room). She will buy blocks, cement, sand and pay for labor.

loans.name: Gilda Leonor

texts.es:
Gilda es una mujer de 48 años de edad que poco a poco se ha ido empoderando en el mundo de los negocios. Ella emprendió de forma independiente desde hace 18 años vendiendo productos Avon, para luego iniciar con una pequeña pulpería. Como madre soltera de tres hijos que la han apoyado desde que estaban pequeños, ha sabido dar todo de sí para sustentarlos mientras estaban bajo su tutela. 
Ahora su trabajo es vender enchiladas desde su casa y de forma ambulante en unas cuantas horas al día. También ha aprovechado unas habitaciones de su casa para alquilarlas, lo que confirma su visión por salir adelante. Gilda quiere seguir creciendo, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar perfumes, repollo, bolsas de plástico y enchiladas para aumentar su venta de comida y de cosméticos. Entre sus planes está comprar una vitrina donde pueda exhibir fácilmente sus productos de venta.
texts.en:
Gilda is a 48-year-old woman who has gradually established herself in the world of business. She started independently 18 years ago selling Avon products. She then opened a small grocery store. 

As a single mother of three children, who have helped her since they were little, she has known to give all from herself to support them while they were under her care. 

Now she works selling enchiladas from her home and also as a street vendor for several hours a day. She has also made the most of some rooms in her house by renting them, which confirms her vision to get ahead. 

Gilda wants to continue growing, and she is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, cabbage, plastic bags, and enchiladas, in order to expand her sales of food and cosmetics. She plans to buy a display case to easily display her products for sale.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, cabbage, plastic bags, and enchiladas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in chickens, concentrate and vitamins.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a single mother with one child. She lives in Northern Poblacion, Calamba, Philippines.  

She has a sari-sari store, which gives her a source of income to support their daily expenses. She is also engaged in pig raising for additional income, and she has been doing this type of work for 3 years.  

Jessica has been a member of Paglaum Cooperative for two years, and has paid back several loans with no default. Now she is applying for a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to buy materials for the improvement of her pig fencing, to make her piglets comfortable.  

She hopes and prays to have a meat shop someday.

loans.use: to buy materials for the improvement of pig fencing

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 32-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marivic has a buy-and-sell, ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jose Saturnino

texts.es:
José, necesita un nuevo financiamiento con el que comprará abono, herbicidas semilla mejorada y pagará mano de obra, realizara la milpa de postrera y el cultivo de hortalizas, espera tener una mejor cosecha.
Su negocio ha ido evolucionando con la ayuda del crédito anterior, la productividad de la cosecha es mayor, los ingresos incrementaron su familia está muy saludable y se mantiene igual.
texts.en: José needs a new loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide, improved seeds, and to pay for labor for the last corn crop and to plant vegetables. He hopes to have a better harvest. His business has evolved with the help of the previous loan. His crop yield is better, his income increased, his family is very healthy and the same as before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, improved seeds, and to pay for labor for the last corn crop and to plant vegetables.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Pascual,  tiene 63 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, estas actividades las heredo de su familia, se ha esforzado por mantener su negocio funcionado para tener recursos económicos con los que puede disminuir las necesidades familiares.
El préstamo le será de ayuda para comprar abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas e insecticidas, con los que dará a su cultivo de maíz un buen desarrollo, espera tener una cosecha abundante para alimentar a su familia y abastecer a sus clientes en época de verano.
Sus sueños son que sus hijos aprendan todo lo relacionado con el negocio y que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Pascual is 63 years old and lives with his wife and three children. He grows food and raises animals, two activities he inherited from his family. He has worked hard to keep his business afloat in order to have an income that can help him fulfill all of his family’s needs.

This loan will help him to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides in order to keep his crops in good shape. He hopes to have an abundant harvest in order to feed his family and supply his customers during the summer.

His dream is that his children learn everything related to his activity and that they continue studying.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides for his corn plantations.

loans.name: Aezelyne

texts.en:
Being a responsible housewife, Aezelyne aspires to improve her retail store and increase her income to support the education of her children and to pay for their daily necessities. 

She wants to increase her product offerings but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 40,000 to purchase more inventory of grocery items like rice, soft drinks, fruits, vegetables, and Avon and Natasha products, to resell.

Being a patient and industrious mother, she believes that she will be able to improve her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of grocery items like rice, soft drinks, fruits, vegetables, and Avon and Natasha products, to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, and gravel to fix the concrete water basin and the floor of her home

loans.name: Lucia Armida

texts.es:
Lucía, vive en casa propia con su esposo de 50 años de edad y dos hijos de 20 y 25 años de edad, todos colaboran en mantener su fuente de ingresos en el mercado, su negocio consiste en la venta de bebidas y antojitos como enchiladas, atoles, tostadas, etc., lo tiene desde hace 25 años, está ubicado en la parada de buses hacia la capital del país, en este momento no representa dificultades en el negocio.
Invertirá gatorade, gaseosas, jugos, papas, plátanos, tomates, condimentos, cebollas y otros materiales importantes para elaborar la venta, su visión es tener más surtido el negocio para atraer nuevos clientes y recuperar la inversión con mejores ganancias.
Sus proyectos son finalizar la construcción de su vivienda y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucía lives in a house of her own with her husband, who is 50, and her children, who are 20 and 25. Everyone contributes to the household economy. Lucía works selling beverages and snacks such as enchiladas, atoles [a traditional hot corn and masa based beverage], and crisps. She has been doing this for twenty-five years in a place where the buses that go to the capital stop. At the moment, her business does not face any difficulties.

She will buy Gatorade, sodas, juices, potatoes, plantains, tomatoes, spices, onion and other important ingredients for her business. Her goal is to widen her assortment in order to attract new customers and recover her investment with better profits. She has a project, which is to finish building her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, potatoes, tomatoes and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is 61 years old and lives in Mahayag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 8 adult children. She was assists her husband with farming. She has corn and rice production near in her house. At harvest time, Leonida sells their rice at the market. She has had this business for 40 years. She requested a loan to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizer and pesticide to maintain the healthy growing of her rice and corn. She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Leonida wants to finish her house to make her family safe and comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 50 years old and lives in San Jose Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

She has been farming with the help of her husband since she was 35 years old, and loves it. She has requested a loan to cultivate her land for corn production, in order to provide corn for those customers who do not buy rice. 

She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. 

In the future, Antonieta wants to plant different kinds of vegetables to sell in order to earn more money for her children.

loans.use: to cultivate land for corn production

location.town: Molave - San Jose Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay monthly bills and school tuition for her son.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan is from Tipan, Oroquieta City. He is a very responsible father when it comes to the welfare of his family, since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He is earning a living through buying and selling grocery items. To generate more income, Allan decided to expand his resources after he learned that he can get financial assistance from PMPC. As Allan has saved an amount from his business, he thought of doing farming activities to earn additional income. Consequently, he requested a loan to pay for the acquisition of a pawned parcel of agricultural land to start his farming project. Allan smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing his family and even his grandchildren a better life.

loans.use: to pay for the acquisition of a pawned parcel of agricultural land.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en: Hilario is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 60 and married in Aloran, he runs a store to provide for the basic necessities of their family. Everyday he patiently tends his store until 10:00 o'clock in the evening. Hilario wants to expand his business; he recently signed up his membership in Paglaum MPC to access insurances and financial assistance. Now, he has borrowed a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, he dreams of sustaining his store to continuously provide for his needs and those of the whole family.

loans.use: to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for the maintenance of his cacao plants.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. Elvira is married and has a solar lamp business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 4,600  through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend her business hours, even after nightfall.

Elvira is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, she is helping the environment and she is reducing the health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, tiene como negocio el cultivo de granos básicos y crianza de ganado, lo aprendió con ayuda de sus padres, tiene 10 años de trabajar independiente, las actividades que su negocio demanda las realiza solo, eventualmente contrata mozos para agilizar los trabajos, su horario es de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde; vive con su esposa y un hijo de 12 años de edad, además es el único que genera ingresos para salir adelante con su familia.
Comprará dos vaquillas valoradas en $600.00 c/u, fortalecer su negocio, ve en la inversión una oportunidad de tener más ganado, producir derivados de la leche, mejorar su situación financiera y cubrir las necesidades familiares.
Sus sueños son continuar mejorando su negocio, cancelar su deuda y tener un futuro más prometedor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
José has a business growing basic grains and raising cattle. He learned this with the help of his parents. He has worked for 10 years independently; he does the work his business demands alone and sometimes he hires workers to speed up the work. His work schedule is from seven in the morning to three in the afternoon. He lives with his wife and one child who is 12 years old. In addition, he is the only one who generates income to get ahead with his family. 

He will purchase two heifers valued at $600.00 each, strengthen his business. He sees in the investment, an opportunity to have more cattle, produce dairy products, improve his financial situation, and cover family needs. 

His dreams are to continue improving his business, pay off his debt, and have a more promising future alongside his family.

loans.use: He will purchase two heifers valued at $600.00 each and strengthen his business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 31 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

Lilian is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been pig fattening for five years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lilian requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Lilian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 39 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Erna works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like chips, bread, canned goods, etc.

Erna has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Erna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like chips, bread, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has four grown children. 

She has a small snacks eatery that sells bread, candies and soft drinks. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan to buy cases of soft drinks and bread to sell to earn money. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. 

In the future, Erlinda hopes that she can build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks and bread to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 29 years old and lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has two school-age children. 

She has a sari-sari store and has had this business for three years. Her husband is managing their rice field. 

She requested a loan to purchase housing materials like hollow blocks, sand and gravel to finish her home for her family. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. 

In the future, Helen hopes to have a motorcycle for their service.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials like hollow blocks, sand and gravel to finish their home.

loans.name: John Tayaban

texts.en: John Tayaban is 35 years old and still single. Due to lack of job opportunities, he engages in reselling food supplements and personal care products within the local community. He wants to acquire more stock of the said products to sell, but he has not enough capital. For this reason, he would like the help of an additional capital loan of PHP 5,000.00 to buy the said additional stock of food supplements and personal products to resell. He is hoping that he will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of food supplements and personal care items to resell.

loans.name: Siony

texts.en:
Siony is a factory worker. She is from Cavite, Philippines and has two children. She is one of the beneficiaries of the employment program of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Siony works as an Assistant Production Line Leader. She conducts inspection and tests per a control plan, work instruction and procedures. She maintains good housekeeping at all times at the respective working area. She is also responsible for the group of operators and carries out manpower utilization effectively to meet shipment.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Siony is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses, and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Siony is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying, since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day. She looks forward to your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to pay their electric bill and for the maintenance and renovation of their house.

Siony dreams to give her family a better life and future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay their electric bill and pay for the maintenance and renovation of their house.

loans.name: Honey Joy

texts.en:
Honey Joy works hard to support her family. Honey Joy is married and has a solar lamp business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to purchase a solar lamp.

Honey Joy has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Honey Joy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice works hard to support two children. She is married and has a solar lamp business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Janice is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia, tiene tres hijos de 16, 14 y 12 años de edad, ellos estudian y dependen económicamente de él; desempeña la actividad económica de crianza y comercialización de ganado, su padre le enseñó a desempeñar esta actividad, luego lo apoyo dándole un pequeño capital para iniciar su propio negocio, con responsabilidad y buena administración hoy cuenta con un negocio más estable y amplio.
El préstamo le servirá para cancelar el alquiler de los terrenos en el que su ganado pastara por un año, en este tiempo ira preparándose para tener más recursos que le ayuden a producir pastos, espera sacar el mejor provecho de la inversión.
Sus proyecciones son resarcir su deuda y que su familia tenga un nivel de vida mucho más digno.
texts.en:
José lives with his family, he has three children, ages 16, 14, and 12. They are students and depend on him economically. He carries out the economic activities of raising and selling cattle. His father showed him how to do this work, and later supported him giving him a little capital to start his own business. With responsibility and good management, today he has a more stable and bigger business.

The loan will be to pay off the rent of the land where his cattle pastured for a year. In this time he will prepare himself to have more resources which will help him to produce hay, and he expects to take the most advantage of the investment.

His projections are to pay off his debt and that his family has a level of living which is much more dignified.

loans.use: to pay off the rent on the land where his cattle pastured for a year.

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena is 33 years old and married with six children, four of whom in school. Jena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Jena has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Jena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lelesa

texts.en:
Lelesa is 38 years old and has three children. Lelesa is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Lelesa is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Lelesa requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Lelesa has been in pig-fattening for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lelesa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a wardrobe and a set of chairs.

loans.name: Juana Marizol

texts.es:
La señora Juana es una mujer con vision de futuro que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado profesionalizarse en las especialidades de maestra de educacion primaria y licenciatura en administracion de empresas, actualmente se desempeña como responsable de recursos de humanos del ministerio de educacion de la comunidad donde vive, con 10 años de laborar.
Actualmente, esta solicitando un financiamiento el que utilizaria pago  de mensualidades universitario , seminarios y modulos de su hija lo que vendria a mejoar el nivel de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Juana is a woman with a vision for the future.  With great effort she has managed to become a professional with a major in teaching elementary school and a degree in business administration.  She currently works as the head of human resources for the ministry of education in the community where she lives.  She has been working there for ten years.

She is now requesting a loan to pay for her daughter’s monthly university costs, seminars, and modules.  This would improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s monthly university costs, seminars, and modules.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in corn farming.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 43 years old, married, and resides in Jimenez with her family. 

She is peddling fresh fish in the local community to make a living. For over seven years, it has sustained them and has provided her children's education costs. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying fish to sell. She took a new loan to cover the cost for boat repair and maintenance. She is hopeful to earn more income and be able to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to cover the cost for boat repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is 46 years old and lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has three school-age and two adult-age children. 

She has a one-hectare rice field and has had this business for 14 years. She requested a loan to pay for labor and seedbed preparation for the next cropping season. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. 

In the future, Rosalita hopes to have her own Jeep for service.

loans.use: to pay for labor and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is 30 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is single and he helps support the needs of his parents. 

He manages their rice field and has done this farming activity for three years. 

He requested a loan to purchase farm inputs and pesticides for more harvest and to provide the needs of his parents. He has been a member of PMPC for one year. 

In the future, Jeffrey hopes to settle with his own family someday.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pesticides.

loans.name: Diolinda

texts.en:
Diolinda is 59 years old, married and has four children, two of whom in school.  

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Diolinda requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Diolinda has been farming rice for 15 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Diolinda would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 59 years old and married with eleven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell like chips, candies, soap, etc.

Delia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns income from raising pigs.

Delia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like chips, candies, soap, etc.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn works hard to support her family. Madelyn is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.
Madelyn has been in this business for three years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Madelyn would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Quilofa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Quilofa works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. Quilofa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Quilofa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
José, requiere de un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y semilla mejorada de pepino, ejotes, chile y tomate, será de ayuda para incrementar el área de cultivo y aumentar la productividad de su negocio.
El financiamiento anterior le ayudo a tener una cosecha abundante con la que pudo tener ingresos suficientes para suplir las necesidades familiares y solventar el compromiso de la deuda.
texts.en:
José needs a new loan to buy agricultural supplies and cucumber, bean, chili, and tomato seeds.  This will help to increase the area that he cultivates and increase the productivity of his business.

The previous loan helped him to have an abundant harvest.  With this he was able to have sufficient income to meet the family needs and repay the debt.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and cucumber, bean, chili, and tomato seeds.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy works hard to support her family. 

Daisy is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Sergio Ramon

texts.es:
Sergio, es una persona reconocida en su comunidad por sus diferentes actividades de su negocio, está soltero, vive con su madre, quien depende económicamente de él, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y ganado, así mismo también cultiva granos básicos, oficio que heredó de su padre, puesto que de niño lo acompañaba a comercializar sus productos, su negocio tiene 10 años de estar funcionando en un horario de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde.
Le será de ayuda el capital para comprar cerdos y ganado de repasto para engordarlos y posteriormente venderlos, será de beneficio para tener un negocio más rentable y amplio, que le genere ingresos necesarios para mantener su negocio activo, cancelar se deuda y mejorar la calidad de vida familiar, los riesgos son enfermedades en los animales y la competencia.
Sergio sueña con seguir trabajando para tener un patrimonio cuando decida formar su propia familia y seguir cuidando de su madre.
texts.en:
Sergio is known in his community for the various aspects of his business.  He's single and lives with his mother, who depends on him financially.  He has no financial help from abroad.

Sergio earns a living raising pigs and cattle as well as growing basic grains, work he learned from his father when he accompanied him to sell his products.  He has run his business for 10 years and works from 7 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon.

The capital will help him buy pigs and grazing cattle to fatten and then sell.  This will be beneficial to him for having a bigger and more profitable business that generates the income he needs to keep his business viable, pay back his debt, and improve his family's quality of life.  The risks are animal disease and competition.

Sergio dreams of continuing to take care of his mother and of continuing to work to have a legacy for when he decides to have his own family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and grazing cattle to fatten and sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, 48, is a married woman with eleven children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Gloria has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Gloria has been in this business for three years. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is from Laguna, Philippines. She is married and has children. She has been employed at a garment factory in Cavite for years, through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Glenda works as a Measurer. She collects and prepares measurements, weights, or identification labels, and attaches them to products.

One of the main problems for employees like Glenda is the improper balancing of their salaries and family expenses, and they have no access to savings or credit. This is a situation that can leave them heavily indebted to usurious moneylenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Glenda is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying the money since the loan payment is deducted every pay-day. 

She looks forward to your positive response and any amount from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to buy frozen products that she sells for additional profit.

Glenda wants her family to be always healthy and happy. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, to provide quality for jobs, to cultivate savings consciousness, and to provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before the start of their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To purchase frozen products to sell for additional income.

loans.name: Ramo

texts.en:
Ramo, 38, is an experienced and active farmer. He lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, and he is the father of two dependent children.

By operating a farming business on a cassava field, he can earn around USD 4 a day to support his family. So far he has been involved in this career for twenty-four years.

To keep his cassava productive and growing well, he is going to use natural fertilizers on his farmland. Because there is a shortage of money, he would like to get a Kiva loan via HKL to buy fertilizers to use in his farming process. With the support of this loan, he hopes that he can make his cassava grow better and produce more crops for him.  

He also thanks all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Ana has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from buying and selling hollow blocks.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of flowers and new styles of clothing to fulfill requests from clients.

loans.name: Maria Salvacion

texts.en:
Maria Salvacion works hard to support her family. Maria Salvacion is married and has a business doing direct selling of Vita Plus food supplements in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of food supplements to sell.

Maria Salvacion has been in this business for a year now.

In the future, Maria Salvacion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of food supplements to sell.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима женщина в возрасте 54 лет, имеет 2 детей. Фотима жительница сельской местности, как  и все жители сельской местности Фотима занимается скотоводством. По сезону Фотима выходит на полевые работы в поле по найму. Все оставшееся время Фотима занимается скотом. Она разводит и откармливает скот для дальнейшей ее продажи. Фотима с раннего детства занимается скотоводством и эта занятие является основным источником ее дохода. Муж Фотимы работает в России на стройке разнорабочим. У Фотимы сейчас трудный период в бизнесе и ей нужна финансовая помощь. С данной проблемой она обратилась в «Арванд» за поддержкой. На полученные деньги Фотима собирается купить корм для скота и пару баранов так, как сейчас цены на скот упали. Фотима благодарна организации за предоставленную помощь сельским жителям.
texts.en:
Fotima is a woman of 54 who has two children. She lives in a rural area and, like all rural residents, works in animal husbandry. She earns wages doing seasonal farm work, and the rest of the time is busy with her livestock. She raises and fattens them for further resale. She has been working in this field since early childhood and this occupation is her primary source of income. Her husband is working in Russia as a construction worker.

Fotima is currently having a difficult period in her business and needs financial support. She has turned to Arvand for help with this problem. She is planning to use the loan funds to buy livestock feed and a pair of rams, since livestock prices have fallen. She is thankful to the organization for the help they offer to rural residents.

loans.use: to buy rams and livestock feed.

loans.name: Safdar

texts.en:
Safdar is 59 years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of a six children. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of this, he is unable to generate any amount of income. 

He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Safdar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Safdar is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Rasheedan

texts.en:
Rasheedan is a 36-year-old married woman. She purchases stock of different edibles including popcorn, crackers, etc. from the market. After packing it in various sizes, she sells it in the local market. She has been involved in this business for ten years. With the support of her husband, she is earning enough to lead a decent life. Her husband assists her in packing and selling these items door-to-door and in local markets. They serve well in their community.

In order to meet day-to-day expenses, Rasheedan wants to increase her sales. She requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stock of tasty crackers and popcorn in large quantity, which ultimately will lead to more revenue and increase their profit.

loans.use: to buy stock of tasty crackers and popcorn.

loans.name: Basira

texts.en:
Basira is a young single girl aged 21 years old. She lives in Dangara district with her mother, father and three brothers. Her parents help Basira in her trading business and her brothers are still in school. 

Basira began to earn a living after graduating from school. With the support of her parents she opened a grocery store in her district, and for 4 years she has been engaged in selling food. Her grocery store is located in a good place so her goods are always in demand. 

Basira would like to increase the assortment of food in the store in order to attract more customers and to earn more profit from the business. With this aim, she has applied for a loan and hopes to get help from you.

This loan will help her to develop her small business and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase food for the development of trade in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an appliance for her house.

loans.name: Ivy June

texts.en:
Ivy June is 26 years old and married. She has two children. With one child in school, Ivy June works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, groceries, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 34 years old, married, and has two children.

She earns a living by raising poultry in the Philippines. Lolita has been raising poultry for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Lolita is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds for her poultry.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Ma. Elizabeth

texts.en:
Ma. Elizabeth is 37 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Elizabeth has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ma. Elizabeth requested a PHP 7,500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Ma. Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mel Rose

texts.en:
Mel Rose works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Mel Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали молодой мужчина в возрасте 35 лет, женат и имеет 2 детей. Шерали живет в сельской местности и занимается животноводством. Это занятие перешло ему по наследству от отца. Шерали с детства помогал отцу ухаживать за скотом и полюбил это занятие. Сейчас Шерали сам занимается животноводством, покупает молодняк и откармливает его для дальнейшей продажи. Животноводство является основным источником дохода для его семьи. Жена Шерали домохозяйка и помогает мужу в ведении хозяйства. Дополнительно Шерали подрабатывает таксистом на своем автомобиле в свободное время. Сейчас у Шерали трудности с финансами из за упадка цен на скот и он не может себе позволить продать скот за малую цену. Шерали решил взять кредит и обратился в "АРВАНД" за поддержкой. На полученный кредит он хочет купить корм для скота.
texts.en:
Sherali is 35 and married with two children. He lives in a rural area and works in animal husbandry, a trade passed on to him by his father. Since he was a child he helped his father care for the animals and fell in love with this profession. He currently works in the field by purchasing young animals and fattening them for further resale. Animal husbandry is the primary source of income for his family. His wife is a homemaker and helps her husband with the farm, and Sherali also earns a bit of money in his free time offering taxi services with his own car.

Sherali is currently having financial difficulties due to a fall in livestock prices and can't bear to sell his animals for such a low price. He has decided to take out a loan and turned to Arvand for support. He wants to use the loan money to purchase livestock feed.

loans.use: to buy cattle and a cattle feed

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 37-year-old married woman with six children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Helen has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. Helen requested a 12,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase utensils and ingredients for her food business. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Martir

texts.es:
Martir, utilizo el préstamo anterior para aumentar la productividad de los cultivos de maíz, mejorando así los ingresos y circunstancias familiares.
Requiere de un préstamo nuevo para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar el arrendamiento del terreno en el que sembrara maíz, le será de ayuda para mantener su negocio y alimentar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mártir used the previous loan to increase the productivity of his corn crop, which improved his income and his family circumstances.

He needs a new loan to buy agricultural inputs and pay the rent on the plot of land where he grows corn.  It will help him a lot to keep up his business and feed his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to pay the rent on the land where he grows corn

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a married woman. She along with her son (also shown in the photo) is involved in the business of cattle sale and purchase. They have five buffaloes and four goats. Naseem has been working with Kashf for six years and has always used her loans for productive purposes. Currently, she has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees to buy calves and goats in order to increase their sales to provide basic necessities of life to her family. She has a very strong credit history. Naseem has always believed that hard work is the key factor in her success.

loans.use: to buy calves and goats in order to increase their sales to provide basic necessities of life to her family.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is a 36-year-old man residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He has been running a general store for many years. He is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Asif wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g., rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items, for his business. But due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all these products to sell. Therefore, Asif has applied for a Kiva SEP loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to buy all these commodities and also help him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Asif is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of foodstuff and other commodities to sell.

loans.name: Babi Rahayu Group

texts.en:
The Babi Rahayu Group succeeded in paying off all their loan. They are really grateful to MUK, Kiva and lenders for supporting their business. Now they can be an example to other breeders on how to run a business.

Ni Ketut, a housewife, runs a pig business in order to improve her family's income. With the last loan, she purchased superior feed for her sow and succeeded in selling all the pigs to a big buyer. With the profit she has earned, she can support her husband's income and help to meet their daily needs, as well as saving for their future.

The Babi Rahayu Group are continuing to borrow money in order to increase their business. They were motivated by their friends who have already succeeded in running their businesses by themselves.

Ni Ketut is using her loan to purchase piglets and feed. With motivation from her friends, she manages her business better than before and hopes for a satisfactory profit. The goal for her is to have enough capital to run her business. 

One member couldn't attend the meeting because of a religious ceremony at her temple.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Sedana Yoga Group

texts.en:
The Sedana Yoga group have now had three loan periods. As in previous periods, the group has always met its obligations on time, and even before the due date. 

All members want to take another loan this time for a larger amount. They also said that they had a small problem in the field. The head of teh group said that the price of feed is currently more expensive so they need more capital so as to produce a good quality of pigs. In addition, Ni Nengah also said that to solve the problem, she and her group usually provide the pigs with traditional food made from banana tree or taro tree. Even so they still hope that MUK will always support their effort.

After seeing the results of the work done by the Sedana Yoga group, MUK trusts the Sedana Yoga group to manage a higher loan size, this time of 3,000,000 IDR per member. The total loan will be of 30,000,000 IDR. 

After getting this loan Ni Nengah said she will use it to buy 3 superior piglets. The price for one piglet is 650,000 IDR and the remainder of the loan will be used to purchase feed. Ni Nengah also hopes that this cooperation continues in a positive way and they could continue the effort independently.

loans.use: to buy 3 superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en: Aiza is 23 years old, married and has one kid. She is in an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Aiza has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to sustain her business. Aiza requested a 24,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Aiza would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Helenita

texts.en:
Helenita is 47 years old and has two children. Helenita is married, and one child is currently in school.

Helenita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Helenita requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Helenita has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Helenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Joy is 30 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Joy has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Joy requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Joy has been in this business for 5 years. Joy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her three children and husband. Her husband has been doing his own business of livestock for the past 20 years; he is the guardian of the family and responsible for managing to household.

Parveen's husband needs to buy fodder and other merchandise for his livestock business, but due to insufficient financial means, he is not in the position to buy these items for his business purposes.

Therefore, Parveen has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will assist her husband to buy these items for his business purposes, so that he can earn maximum profitable income to manage his business and household.

For this financial assistance, Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fodder and other merchandise to increase her cattle business

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been providing beauty parlor services for four years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials etc. Her daughter also assists her in running this business and they have become very famous in their community. 

To meet with the increasing demand of her customers, Salma needs to buy more variety of cosmetics for her parlor. She needs a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She is hopeful that if her business expands she will be able to cater for more customers time after time.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in fertilizer, seeds, manure, thread, needles etc., hoping to have better kept crops and more profit from his agave products.

loans.name: Olsen Bryam

texts.es:
Olsen es un hombre joven de 20 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y estudia kinesiología.
Él es emprendedor, responsable, independiente, constante y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘cruce villa Adela’ una zona caracterizada por ser el nexo que une a varios barrios de la ciudad, desde este lugar se encuentra transporte público para todos los barrio del lugar, de clima frio y seco a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Olsen es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymará y utiliza el español para el comercio y para estudiar. Su vida la comparte con su madre porque es hijo único y no tiene hermanos, viven en una casa propia de ladrillo que tiene agua potable, electricidad y gas. Su negocio es la venta de ropa. Desde hace tres años que incursionó en la venta de ropa; actualmente cuenta con una tienda en una galería del lugar, empezó con el dinero de herencia que le dejó su padre fallecido, combina el trabajo con los estudios, cuando tiene que estudiar el negocio lo atiende su madre, otras veces cuando no tiene quién le colabore lo cierra y se dedica a estudiar.  También cuenta con un dinero mensual que recibe de su madrastra por el alquiler de un cuarto en la ex casa de su padre. Él estudia la carrera de kinesiología en un instituto, se encuentra en cuarto semestre y ahora le tocan las prácticas profesionales. Su sueño es salir profesional y abrir su propio consultorio de fisioterapia para ayudar a todas las personas que requieran sus servicios, en especial a personas de la tercera edad. Él desea realizar la compra de instrumental médico para kinesiología porque empiezan sus prácticas y es el material que necesita. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en tres años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Olsen solicita un préstamo para la compra de instrumental médico para kinesiología para realizar sus prácticas profesionales y terminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Olsen is young man of 20 years of age; single, with no children. He is studying kinesiology. He is an entrepreneur, responsible, independent, reliable and hard working. 
He works in the area of Cruze Villa Adela, an area characterized for being the nexus which links various towns to the city. It is where public transport to all the towns in the area can be found. It has a cold and dry climate at an altitude of about 3800 meters above sea level. 
Olsen is dark-skinned, he has short black hair, is of medium height, his maternal tongue is Aymara and he uses Spanish for commerce and for his studies. He lives with his mother as he is an only child and doesn't have other siblings. He lives in a proper brick house which has potable water, electricity and gas.
His business is selling clothing. He started selling clothes 3 years ago, and he now has a store in a mall in the area. He started with the inheritance money his late father left him. He combines his work with his studies. When he has to study his mother tends the business, on other occasions when he doesn't have any help he closes it up and focuses on his studies. He also receives money monthly from his stepmother for renting a room in his father’s former house.  
He is studying kinesiology at a university, and is in his fourth semester and has to now do the professional internship. His dream is to graduate and to open his own physiotherapy office to help all those who require his services, especially seniors. He wishes to make the purchase of some medical equipment for kinesiology because his internship is starting and he requires that material.  This is the first loan request with this institution during the three years that he has been doing this work.
Those are the reasons why Olsen is requesting a loan to buy medical equipment for kinesiology in order to do his professional internship and complete his studies.

loans.use: to buy medical equipment for kinesiology in order to do his professional internship and complete his studies.

loans.name: Sinar Dewi Group

texts.en:
The Sinar Dewi group is made up of five women who are neighbors in the same village in Pejarakan, North Bali. The group is seeking a loan of 5,000.000 IDR, and each member will receive 1,000.000 IDR. The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to support their families, and out of their interest in education on best practices for pig raising. The group members have multiple jobs, not only as pig breeders, but also as small kiosk owners, teachers, services providers, etc. This is their first loan with MUK.

Ida Ayu, is the head of the Sinar Dewi group. Her primary job is as a teacher in junior high school. She plans to use her share of the loan to purchase superior feed because she already has a sow.  Over the six-month loan period, she hopes to have a fat and healthy pig. She will sell the pig as pig barbeque. With her income from this effort, she hopes to be able to fullfill her daily needs and save.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed.

loans.name: Dessy

texts.en:
Dessy is a 35-year-old woman and is married to Alosyus, a 37-year-old man. From the marriage they have been blessed with 3 children; Diva, 12 years old; Giofani, 11 years old, both of them are elementary school students; and Alexa, one year old. 

Dessy initiated a kiosk business selling daily needs such as cooking oil, instant noodles, soap, detergent, snacks, etc. She has been involved this business since 2010. The income from this business enables her to support her husband in generating more income to meet their family's needs. 

Recently, Dessy has decided to add rice and gasoline as demanded by her customers, however the money she has not enough to do that. Therefore she has applied for an individual loan of IDR 4,000,000 to TLM. The loan will be spent on rice, gasoline and more stocks of soft drinks and snacks.

loans.use: to purchase rice, gasoline and more stocks of soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Mylin

texts.en:
Mylin is 31 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Mylin works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mylin has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Mylin aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elicita

texts.en:
Elicita is 58 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like noodles, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Elicita has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Elicita aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like noodles, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Soccoro works hard to support her family. Soccoro is married and has a pig-raising business in the Philippines.

Soccoro requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Soccoro has been in this business for 10 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Soccoro would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza works hard to support her family. Aiza is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.

Aiza requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

Aiza has been in this business for a year now.

In the future, Aiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks-of-ready to wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is widowed mother and she works hard to support her family.

She has a house-rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Emelia is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy paint, hardwood and other equipment to repair her house.

Emelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy paint, hardwood and other equipment to repair her house.

loans.name: Maria Irish

texts.en:
Maria Irish is 27 years old and has three children. Maria Irish is married, and two children are currently in school.

Maria Irish is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Maria Irish requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria Irish has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maria Irish would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna works hard to support two children. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Elna requested an 8,890 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Elna is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Jennifer Arely

texts.es:
Jennifer, utilizo el préstamo anterior para mejorar la granja de pollos y cerdos, las utilidades son mayores y le han servido para cubrir gastos familiares, pagar sus deudas y establecer una venta de bebidas frías, así tiene ingresos extras.
Jennifer requiere un nuevo préstamo para comprar jugos, sodas, agua, etc., y concentrado para cerdos, fortalecerá su nuevo rubro y mantendrá los cerdos en óptimas condiciones para facilitar su comercialización.
texts.en:
Jennifer used the previous loan to improve her chicken and pig farm.  She earns more, which has helped her cover the family expenses and pay her debts.  Sh also set up a cold beverage business, so she has extra income.

Jennifer needs another loan to buy juice, soda, water, etc., as well as concentrated pig feed.  She'll strengthen her new line of work and keep the pigs in optimal condition to facilitate their sale.

loans.use: to buy juice, soda, water, etc., to strengthen her new business, as well as concentrated pig feed to keep the pigs in optimal condition

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is 45 years old and a married woman. She is been in a beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers, such as makeup, hairstyling and facials. Through her best efforts at providing services, she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demand of her customers, she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetics products for the parlor. That is why she has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers for gaining profits to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers for gaining profits to build her own house.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 33-year-old married woman. She is the mother of three children. Her husband (shown in the picture) is running a butcher shop near their home. Abida is making a great effort to support her family. She is accountable to provide for her family. 

For the growth of her husband’s business, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy small animals along with cutting instruments such as knives, cutters, etc., to meet the demand of customers time after time. She is positive that her husband's earnings will increase with this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy small animals along with cutting instruments such as knives, cutters, etc., to meet the demand of customers time after time.

loans.name: Salamat

texts.en: Salamat is a 56-year-old married lady. She has been running a small general store in her community from many years. She offers a wide variety of items at reasonable price and has retained many customers. Salamat makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 60,000 Pakistani rupees, which she will use to buy packs of sugar, biscuits, chocolates and other grocery items. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Salamat wishes to use part of her revenues to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy packs of sugar, biscuits, chocolates and other grocery items for her store

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more dried fish needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy a variety of dried fish to sell. More kinds of dried fish displayed at her stall will give people more choice and will result in increased sales. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her.

Felisa believes that all her hard work will bear fruit as she continues to trust God. She prays for good health and a better life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional dried fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en:
Ratha, 24, comes from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing cassava and sells the crop to the local dealers. She has been involved in this career since 2008. She is able to make an income of USD 2.00 per day, on average.  

As a supplementary earning, she has come up with a new business idea. She wants to use a cart to carry many types of meatballs and move around her community to sell. However, her insufficient capital to invest doesn't allow her to do so. Therefore, she is applying for a KIVA loan to buy a cart to run her business. She hopes that this new trade will help to improve her standard of living. She would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a cart.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 29 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, spices, coffee, sugar, etc.

Grace has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Grace aspires to save and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, spices, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. Violeta is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Violeta is borrowing 8,890 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of emergency.

Violeta is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 54 years old and married with six children.  

Eva is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her livestock.

Eva has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Eva would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her livestock.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 52 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.
