She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, etc.

Rosalinda has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 59 years old and married with three children.  

Francisca is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Francisca requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, vitamins, etc. for her business.

Francisca has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Francisca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is 42 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school.

Ma. Cristina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like rice, shampoo, soft-drinks, sardines and other groceries.

Ma. Cristina has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Ma. Cristina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, shampoo, soft-drinks, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 33-year-old married woman. For the past 9 years she has been selling spices which are used in cooking food. She purchases spices in bulk from wholesales market and then sells them in packs of various sizes. She has become famous by providing good quality spices in her locality and earns enough to have a decent life. 

She is a responsible mother of 5 children and needs to earn more to bear the daily expenditures of her family members. For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantities. 

She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of profits to provide a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantities.

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en:
Mukhtaran is 42 years old and widowed. She started her business with Kashf Foundation four years ago. Due to a shortage of money, she was not able to start her business but after meeting with a Kashf officer she received her first loan.  Now she is running a successful dressmaking business covering her everyday expenditures.

Mukhtaran requested another loan for 40,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase a new collection of cloth for the winter season. This loan will allow her to increase her sales and profits. Microfinance services helped her in improving her standard of living and meeting the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase different varieties of cloth at reasonable prices

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is married and works selling fabric conditioner in the Philippines. She has operated her business for 11 years and she works hard to support her family. 

Jenelyn is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of fabric conditioners to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric conditioner to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, beverages, cheese, sweets, condiments, meat, etc., to make pupusas, enchiladas, pastries, and other snacks she sells to students

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Rosibel, está acompañada, es madre de dos hijos de 10 y 11 años de edad, todos viven juntos y dependen económicamente de ella; su negocio consiste en vender tortillas, anteriormente ella trabajaba brindando cuidados a una anciana y tenía un sueldo fijo, al fallecer la anciana quedo desempleada, hace un año compro un aplancha en la que elabora las tortillas para vender.
Comprará 10 qq de maíz, tendrá materia prima para aumentar la producción de tortillas, generando así más ingresos y clientes satisfechos, espera que su situación económica mejore.
Aspira cancelar su crédito con puntualidad y que si vida tenga un cambio positivo.
texts.en:
Rosibel is married and is the mother of two children, who are 10 and 11 years old. They all live together and depend on her financially. She has a business where she sells tortillas. Previously, she provided care to an elderly woman and had a fixed salary. When the elderly woman passed away, Rosibel lost her job. 

A year ago, she purchased a griddle on which to cook tortillas. She will purchase 10 quintales of corn with the loan so that she will have enough raw material to increase tortilla production. This way, she will earn more income and have satisfied customers. 

She hopes that her financial situation will improve. She hopes to pay off her loan on time and that her life changes for the better.

loans.use: to purchase 10 quintales of corn so that she can have raw materials to increase tortilla production.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 48-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past two years. He is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family.

Shakeela's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g., rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purposes. But due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all of these products for reselling purposes. Therefore, Shakeela has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also will be helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.
 
Shakeela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business by purchasing different kinds of commodities

loans.name: Hafeez

texts.en:
Hafeez is a 43-year-old man who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with his children and spouse. 

Hafeez has been running his own retail garment business for many years. As the sole provider, he is responsible for feeding his family and managing the household. 

Hafeez needs to purchase a variety of clothing, in bulk, to sell in his shop, but, due to a lack of funds, he is unable to buy this inventory. Therefore, he has applied for a Kiva SEP loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With this loan, Hafeez will be able to make a bulk purchase of clothing and meet the needs of his business. He will also be able to increase the size of his shop and earn a greater profit.
 
Hafeez is very thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy ready-made dresses in bulk.

loans.name: Utamaduni . Group

texts.en:
Rukia, who is in her late 30s, is single with two children. One of them is still in school and the other one is grown-up. She has been running a genge (general store) business for five years now. She works from 4pm to 11pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rukia's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock her genge with the items that are now out of stock. She dreams of owning a clothing shop.

Rukia will share this loan with her loan group "Utamaduni" which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock her genge.

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
Rosel is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from photocopier services and running a boarding house. Rosel has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva.

Rosel is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married and works hard to support her family. For the past six years, she has run a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Lolita is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is married. For the past 10 years, she has worked running a water-selling business in the Philippines. Julita works hard to support her family.

Julita is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as water containers and for water bill payment. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase water containers

loans.name: Saul Alfonso

texts.es:
Saúl, comenta que el efecto del préstamo anterior ha sido positivo, puesto que el ganado y los cerdos que adquirió los vendió a buen precio, teniendo así mejores ganancias. Saúl ya no vive en casa de su madre actualmente vive solo.
Está requiriendo un nuevo préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta básica para tener nuevos productos en la tienda y seguir con su progreso con esté nuevo rubro.
texts.en:
Saúl said the previous loan had a positive effect because he sold the cattle and pigs he acquired for a good price, thus earning a better profit.  Saúl no longer lives in his mother's house; he lives alone.

He needs another loan to buy basic staples to have new products in his store and keep on making progress in this new line of work.

loans.use: to buy basic staples to have new products in his store

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana grows and harvests rice and raises pigs, work that she has done since she was married. She gets up early and has to go to the fields where she oversees her pigs as well as her crops. Juliana successfully repaid her previous loan that she used for buying piglets and pig feed.

Juliana is requesting a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and cover land preparation costs for this planting season. In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now and be able to give her children the education she did not have.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and cover land preparation costs for this planting season

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa owns and operates a motorcycle transport business and has been doing this for over eight years. She earns a better income from this and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for repair and maintenance costs. 

To expand her services, she took a new loan from GDMPC microfinance to buy a new unit of motorcycle sidecar. She always wants to augment her income. Marisa’s hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve her living situation.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle sidecar

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie, 50, is a resident of Dasmarinas,Cavite in the Philippines. She is married to Deogracius, a contractor, and they have seven children. Two are in college, two are in high school, one is in elementary school, and two are already working. With such a big family, she works hard to augment their income in order to meet their daily household and school expenses.

Marjorie makes and sells peanut butter and rice. Rice is a staple in the Filipino household, while peanut butter is a favorite sandwich and "pandesal" (hot bread) spread among Filipinos. As well, peanut butter is used as an ingredient in "kare-kare" (a spanish dish of either meat or seafood cooked in peanut butter). She has regular orders from her friends, neighbors, and relatives, and she also serves her local community. She earns a minimum of 10,500 PHP in sales every month.

To help her continue with her business, Marjorie would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy ingredients such as peanuts, sugar, coconut milk, and sacks of rice. She thanks God and you in advance for both the financial help that she will receive and a good return on her investment.  

Marjorie aims to grow her business and to send all of her children to college. She dreams for a bright future for her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and sacks of rice for resale.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and selling bananas. Lucia is borrowing 18,000 PHP (Phillipines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. Lydia is married and has a buying and selling of scrap materials business in the Philippines.

Lydia requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for three years now.

Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 48 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like coffee, canned goods, soft drinks, juice, beers, etc., to sell.

Wilma has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, canned goods, soft drinks, juice, beers, etc. 

Wilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like coffee, canned goods, soft drinks, juice, beers, etc., to sell

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa works hard to support four children. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Jesusa requested a PHP 8,890 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Jesusa is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 51 years old and has four children. Myrna is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Myrna is in the agricultural business, raising goats in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her goats.

Myrna has been raising goats for 7 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her goats.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. One of her sons has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for many years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Her son needs to make maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Riffat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Riffat's son can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn profitable income. Riffat also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her son's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Riffat is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the expense of her son's taxi repair.

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es: LIZET  de 19 años de edad,  soltera y sin hijos, es un agradable estudiante de la facultad de diseño grafico   ya está en últimos ciclos  le falta medio año para terminar,  con la ayuda de sus padres  está logrando muchas cosas,  Lizet ha sabido salir adelante estudiar mucho y  así culminar sus estudios y así poder ser  exitosa en la vida. Con el préstamo otorgado ella podrá realizar los pagos de su matrícula universitaria y la vez compra de útiles de estudio que necesita. Lizet   se encuentra muy agradecida  por la ayuda brindada que le está siendo  Kiva  y Edaprospo y se despide con un fuerte abrazo y diciéndoles que cumplirá la promesa de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Lizet is 19 years old, is single, and does not have children. She is a friendly student who is studying graphic design. She is in her last year and only has six more months left in her course of study. With her parents' help, she has been able to achieve many things. Lizet has known that the way to move forward is to study a lot so that she can finish school and be successful in life. 

With the loan, she will be able to pay registration costs for university and purchase supplies that she needs. Lizet is very grateful for the support provided by Kiva and Edaprospo. She leaves with a strong hug and tells us that she will comply with her promise of moving forward.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina has been helping her husband working in their own farm to make a living. She successfully repaid her previous loan which she used to buy goods to sell. 

To offer more goods to her customers, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods, canned and bottled products to sell. She wants and hopes to renovate their house as well as to improve the general living conditions of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods, canned and bottled products to sell.

loans.name: Apolonio

texts.es:
Apolonio, tiene 67 años de edad, vive solo en casa propia; se dedica a la crianza de ganado, compra y vende ganado en su localidad, lo mantiene en sus propiedades, ya cuenta con 20 años de tener su propio negocio, no tiene horario establecido para trabajar.
Comprará una vaquilla, la cuidara y para que en un futuro le generara más ganancias,  con ello el podrá tener oportunidad de tener más ganado y aumentar la producción de leche, su objetivo es mejorar situación económica para cubrir los costos de su negocio y la cancelación de la deuda.
Sus proyecciones son continuar trabajando para tener una vida más ocupada y asegurarse un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Apolonio is 67 years old and lives alone in his own home. He makes a living by raising cattle. He purchases and sells cattle in his area and raises them on his own property. He has owned his own business for 20 years. He does not have a set work schedule.

He will purchase a heifer and care for her so that he can earn more money in the future. He will have the opportunity to have more cattle and increase milk production. His goal is to improve his financial situation in order to cover his business expenses and pay off debt.

His goals are to continue working in order to have a busy life and assure that his future will be better.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer and care for her so that he can earn more money in the future.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 33 years old and has three children.  Maricel is married and has two children who are in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maricel has been farming vegetables for seven years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 59 years old and widowed with eight children.  

Rosalia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Rosalia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Rosalia has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Rosalia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feeds and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Wynie

texts.en:
Wynie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Wynie is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Wynie has a business buying and selling silver jewelry in the Philippines. Wynie has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of silver jewelry to sell to her customers.

Wynie has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Wynie would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of silver jewelry to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lucio Escobar

texts.es:
Lucio, aún trabaja en la carpintería y en la agricultura, utilizo el financiamiento anterior mejorar sus cultivos y optimizar las procesos de la recolección de la cosecha, obtuvo mayores ganancias y su popularidad aumento, cuenta que sus condiciones de vida son mucho más dignas.
Está necesitando de un nuevo crédito para cancelar los costos de la recolección de la nueva cosecha  de granos básicos y el transporte de la misma hacia su vivienda, podrá cumplir con los encargos de sus clientes y abastecer a su familia con alimento.
texts.en:
Lucio still works in carpentry and agriculture.

He used the previous loan to improve his crops and optimize his harvesting procedures.  He earned more profit and his popularity increased.  He said his living conditions are much more decent.

Lucio needs another loan to pay the costs of harvesting his new crop of basic grains and transporting it to his house.  He'll be able to fulfill his customers' orders and supply his family with food.

loans.use: to pay the costs of harvesting his crop of basic grains and transporting it to his home

loans.name: Jose Benjamin

texts.es:
José, tiene como fuente de ingresos una tienda en la que vende productos de la canasta básica, es soltero, vive con su madre, quien depende de él, no tiene ayuda del extranjero, su padre le enseño el oficio y hace 9 meses fundo su propio negocio, con el fin de tener ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, su horario de atención al público es de seis de la mañana a siete de la noche.
Mejorará su inventario comprando papel higiénico, aceite, granos básicos, bebidas, pan, sal, azúcar, etc., de esta manera ofrecerá nuevos productos a sus clientes para generar más ingresos, su anhelo es estabilizar su situación económica para dar a su madre una vida digna y tener oportunidad de seguir trabajando con créditos para mejorar su negocio. Los riesgos son la delincuencia.
Su sueño es trabajar para tener siempre su fuente de ingresos con al que pueda apoyar a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
José has a store where he sells general items as his source of income. He is single and live with his mother, who depends on him. He does not receive any help from abroad. His father taught him this trade. Nine months ago, he founded his own business in order to have an income to cover his family's expenses. His hours for serving the public are from six in the morning to seven at night.

He will improve his inventory, purchasing toilet paper, oil, basic grains, drinks, bread, salt, sugar, etc. This way he will be able to offer his customers new products to generate more income. His wish is to find financial stability in order to provide his mother with a decent life and have the opportunity to continue working with loans to improve his business. The risk is delinquency.

His dream is to work in order to always have a source of income so he can financially support his family.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, oil, basic grains, drinks, bread, salt, sugar, etc. so he can offer his customers new products.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz  is 43 years old and married woman. The man shown in the photo is Shahnaz ’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. 

He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Shahnaz  has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR, for her husband. 

He wants to buy new tires, some auto spare parts and tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shahnaz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires, some auto spare parts and tools.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat was born in the year 1977. She is divorced and has 2 children. Muhabbat is the only person who provides food to her children. She is a very hardworking woman. Muhabbat has her own business. She is busy buying and selling dried fruits and nuts in a local market. 

Muhabbat buys in a bulk and sells in a local market. She always tries to have a large assortment of her goods and in this way to attract more customers. 

Muhabbat manages to provide for her family with this business alone. She works hard to develop her business. Muhabbat is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy dried fruits so that she can increase her working capital. 

She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits.

loans.name: El Mirador Del Valle. Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Mirador del Valle lo integran tres socios emprendedores, que decidieron unirse para solicitar los financiamientos de la institución por primera vez. La coordinadora es la joven Francis de 25 años de edad y acompañada que se dedica a la comercialización de especies en diferentes departamentos del país, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de canela, salsa inglesa, mostaza, achote, pimienta, manzanilla, etc. A este grupo también lo integra Marbelí una mujer trabajadora de 40 años de edad y quien comercializa diversidad de especies en los departamentos del país, y José Ángel un hombre de 40 años de edad preocupado por el bienestar de su familia, comerciante de frutas en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en: Mirador del Valle (Viewpoint on the Valley) is a solidarity group composed of three entrepreneurs, who decided to get together to ask for loans for the first time to our institution. Francis, a young woman aged 25, is the group's coordinator. She has a life partner and she engages in selling spices in different departments of the country. She is requesting a loan to buy cinnamon, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, annatto, pepper and chamomile. Members of this group are also Marbelí, a 40-year-old hardworking woman, who sells various types of spices in the different departments of the country, and José Ángel, a 40-year-old man who is concerned for his family's well being and who has been selling fruits in the town market for four years.

loans.use: To buy cinnamon, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, annatto, pepper and chamomile.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his cacao and plantain crops.

loans.name: Feverex Jefrey

texts.en:
Feverex Jefrey is very dedicated to his studies and  wants to become successful in the future. He is studying a BS - Marine Engineering in a university. 

He has four siblings and is living with his family. He took this loan from GDMPC for the purpose of paying his school tuition fees for the second semester.

In the future, he wants to find a job that enables him to support himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fees for the second semester.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a mother of two who operates a piggery, growing and selling pigs to earn a living. She has been in this business for two years, and she earns well for her family. By selling pork meat in the villages, she was able to earn more profit than by selling the pigs whole.

She took a new loan recently from GDMPC Microcredit to buy feed for her piglets to boost her pigs. She plans to build another cage for her pigs as an expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her piglets to boost her pigs.

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene is 55 years old and married, with three children.

Gene is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm.

Gene has been farming rice and sugarcane for nine years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm.

loans.name: Maria Emerita

texts.es:
María, ha mejorado la venta de pupusas y venta de ropa con la buena inversión del préstamo anterior, su familia se mantiene y comparten un mejor estilo de vida, sus ingresos están mejorando.
Nuevamente solicita ayuda para comprar harina, quesillo, tomates, bebidas, aceite y otros ingredientes para la elaboración de la venta de pupusas, continuara mejorando sus ingresos para brindar a su familia lo mejor.
texts.en:
María was able to improve her business of selling pupusas and clothing with a good investment from her previous loan. She has supported her family, improved their quality of life, and increased her income.

Now, she is requesting assistance to purchase flour, cheese, tomatoes, beverages, oil, and other ingredients with which to make pupusas. She will continue to increase her income in order to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to purchase flower, cheese, tomatoes, beverages, oil, and other ingredients to make pupusas.

loans.name: Candelaria Digna

texts.es:
Candelaria, es sastre, vive con su hija de 25 años de edad y un nieto de 3 años de edad; con la responsabilidad de cubrir los gastos de su hogar aprendió a elaborar prendas de vestir, tiene más de 15 años de experiencia, trabaja todos los días y no representa problemas en su negocio.
Utilizará el capital para comprar hilos, telas, broches, aplicaciones y otros materiales de costura con los que elaborara las prendas de vestir, al realizar la inversión espera tener resultados positivos como nuevos clientes y mayores ingresos.
Sus sueños son continuar creciendo con el negocio y apoyar a su nieto para superarse académicamente.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a tailor with more than 15 years of experience.  She lives with her 25-year-old daughter and a 3-year-old grandchild.  She learned to make garments because she was responsible for the household expenses.  She works every day and has no problems in her business.

She'll use the capital to buy thread, fabric, fasteners, appliqués, and other sewing materials with which to make garments.  She hopes the investment will have positive results such as new customers and more income.

Candelaria's dreams are to keep on growing with her business and to help her grandson improve himself academically.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, fasteners, appliqués, and other sewing materials with which to make garments

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
Juana, tiene como actividad económica la siembra de maíz, crianza de ganado, cerdos y otros animales de corral, en ocasiones asiste al tiangue (mercado de compra y venta de animales de corral) para comercializar sus animales y obtener buenas ganancias; vive con sus hijos y nueras, todos trabajan juntos y se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante.
Comprará tres cerdos a $ 300.00 c/u y una vaca a $ 400.00, ampliara su negocio para continuar progresando junto a su familia, está comprometida con la idea de sacar el mejor provecho del crédito y tener una buena calificación financiera.
Su visión es tener una ganadería más grande para formar un mejor patrimonio que le dé a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Juana operates a farming business.  She grows maize and raises cattle, pigs and other farm animals.  She buys and sells animals at the market in El Tiangue because she can maximize her earnings there.  She lives with her sons and daughters-in-law.  Each member of the family works for the good of all the family.
Juana will use your loan to buy three pigs for $300 each and one cow for $400.  The investment will provide the fuel she needs to carry on the business and provide for her family.  She is committed, she says, to making the most of the loan and establishing herself as a good credit risk.
For the future, Juana wants to build her livestock business.  She hopes to leave the business to her sons one day so that they might have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy three pigs and one cow.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 39-year-old woman, and mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a milk shop for many years, he sells milk, yogurt and other things. He is the only person who is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Sajida's husband needs to buy milk in bulk to resell so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position he is not in a position to purchase the milk to fulfill the needs of his business.

Therefore Sajida has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the milk for business purposes. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy milk in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to perform maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is poor, and it requires maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to perform maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Tahira has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Tahira's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and so provide better transportation services to earn a profitable income. Tahira also plans to create savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Tahira is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the expense of repairing her husband's taxi

loans.name: Las Fresitas Group

texts.es: Las fresitas es un grupo solidario integrado por cuatro mujeres emprendedoras y con espíritu de superación, la coordinadora es Julia una mujer de 55 años de edad, casada y propietaria de un taller de tapicería en su domicilio, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y el crédito los solicita para la compra de materia prima como es tela damasco y productos de limpieza para tapizados. Otra integrante es la señora Lilliam de 48 años de edad, quien comercializa zapatos en el mercado más populosos de la capital desde hace veinte años, Elida una joven de 23 años de edad quien ofrece el servicio de reparación de zapatos en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace cuatro años, y Heydi una mujer de 29 años de edad comerciante de ropa desde hace diez años en la capital del país.
texts.en:
Las Fresitas is a support group of four self-motivated women in the spirit of self-improvement. The coordinator is Julia, a 55-year-old, married woman who is the owner of an upholstery shop in her home. She has help from her husband and is requesting the loan to buy raw materials such as damask fabric and cleaning products for upholstery. 

Another member is 48-year-old Lilliam, who has been selling shoes in the most populous market in the capital for twenty years. Elida, a young, 23-year-old woman, has had a shoe repair service at the municipal market for four years. Heydi, 29 years old, has been selling clothing in the capital for ten years.

loans.use: to buy damask fabric and cleaning products for upholstery.

loans.name: Melanton M.

texts.en:
Melanton is a 42-year-old man who is married to Yohana, a 40-year-old woman, and they have five children. The children are still in school. 

The first is Rocky, 18, attending third grade of electronic vocational high school; Rakel, 16, first grade student of vocational high school; Rikspin, 14, a junior high school student, second grade; Refika, 11, a fifth grade elementary school student; and the last is Russel, 9, a third grade student of elementary school.

In order to generate income for his family, Melanton runs a business, raising chickens to sell. The income earned was spent on the family's daily needs, to buy medicine for his father, and for the children's school expenses. 

Melanton dreams of improving his broiler business as the income earned from this business enables him to finance his family's living. 

He planned to purchase more chicks and feed, however, he needs more money to do so. Therefore, he requested a loan of IDR 3,000,000. This loan will be spent on two boxes of chicks and feed.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration et le commerce de l’habillement.
Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MARAMA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de l’habillement. Elle compte acheter des puces de pagne wax chez les grossistes à Fana.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri group is made up of married women who, on average, are 34 years old and have five children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Dioïla, in Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know each other from family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. They work in food preparation and the selling of clothing. 

With the goal of satisfying their clients' enormous demand, the group joined Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first group loan.

Marama, who is the first person standing on the right in the photo, is illiterate and works selling clothing. She plans to buy second-hand wax pagne [bright, colorful fabric] from the wholesalers in Fana.

Sales are made at retail for cash from her home, and sometimes by going door-to-door, to a mixed group of customers.

Marama hopes to earn a monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle repair tools and more catfish seeds (eggs).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, grains, beverages, candies, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover expenses associated with getting his diploma.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris has been working as a farmer ever since he was very young. His father taught him how to tend to the crops, poultry, and cattle so that he could get ahead in life. Today he is still a farmer and a poultry farmer. For five years, Morris has been practicing mixed farming. He is very content with the conservative nature of the farming lifestyle. He is appreciative of the fact that farming has enabled him to sustain his family of over the years. On his farm, he keeps dairy animals and grows maize. He also engages in other businesses outside but related to farming to earn additional income. 

Morris requested a loan, which he will use to purchase additional poultry. Like many farmers, he is planning to keep single poultry chickens. From the hens, he will be able to sell meat and eggs to the local hospitality industries. The demand for chicken products in Chuka is always high. With the loan, Morris will be in a position to acquire several chickens and establish his mark in this lucrative space. The money from the new venture will be dedicated to the education of his children. He believes with proper schooling as the foundation for his children, they will certainly lead a better life in their future and the generations to come.

loans.use: to purchase additional poultry

loans.name: Thomas Elliot

texts.es:
Thomas vive actualmente con su madre y su hermano menor. Sus padres son separados. Su madre se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de emolientes, para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos y puedan ser excelentes profesionales.

Debido a la actual situación económica por la que está atravesando su familia, Thomas está recurriendo al apoyo de KIVA para que pueda culminar el último ciclo de su carrera de Diseño Gráfico, que tanto le gusta ya que siente que puede emplear su creatividad y por la cual siente una gran pasión ya que le permitirá lograr sus objetivos personales y profesionales en la vida, para así poder apoyar a su madre con la educación de su hermano menor.

Thomas piensa que la acción que realiza KIVA mediante Programa de Créditos Educativos, es digna de imitar ya que siente que en esa organización existen personas de buen corazón dispuestas ayudar aquellos que tienen deseos de superación y llegar a ser excelentes profesionales en su área.
texts.en:
Thomas lives with his mother and younger sister.  His parents are separated.  His mother sells beauty products from door to door in order to support Thomas and his sister.

Thomas is applying to KIVA for a new loan so that he can complete a degree in graphics design.  He needs the loan because his family can't afford to pay his college fees and he is desperate to carry on.  He is passionate about graphics design and wants to finish his degree so that he can start working.  His income will, he says, help his mother pay for his sister's schooling.  

Thomas is grateful that KIVA and Programa de Créditos Educativos have partnered to support people like him who want to build better lives for themselves.

loans.use: to finish his graphics design degree.

loans.name: Paradi De Dolval 1, 3, 5 & 6 Group

texts.fr:
Yvonie est le coordinatrice de son groupe Paradi de Dolval 1, 3, 5 & 6. Elle est marié mais elle a 3 enfants. Elle habite dans la ville de Ouanaminthe d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Yvonie a dirigé son business pendant les 7 dernières années.

Yvonie voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du cosmetiques et accessoires. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres de Paradi de Dolval 1, 3, 5 & 6 ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, chaussures, vetement, et du riz. Yvonie dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant.
texts.en:
Yvonie is the coordinator for the Paradi de Dolval 1, 3, 5 & 6 group. She is married and has three children. She lives in Ouanaminthe, in Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

Yvonie has been managing her business for the last seven years. She would like to use this loan and invest in the buying of cosmetics and accessories. She hopes that his loan will help her expand her business.

The other group members need this loan to buy stock to sell, such as charcoal, shoes, clothing, and rice.

Yvonie says that her main challenge is the lack of constant customers.

loans.use: to buy various goods (cosmetics, accessories, etc.)

loans.name: Assurance De Phaeton 1, 3, 5 & 7 Group

texts.fr:
Jaccint est le coordinateur de son groupe Assurance de Phaeton 1, 3 5 7 7. Il habite dans la région de Phaeton où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Jaccint vend du poisson et Il a dirigé son commerce  pendant les 11 et demi dernières années. Il est marie il a 4 enfants. 

Jaccint voudrait utiliser cet emprunt d'investir dans l'achat de poisson. Jaccint espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son entreprise. Des autres membres Assurance ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, vetements usees et produits alimentaires.
texts.en:
Jaccint is the coordinator of the Assurance de Phaeton 1, 3 5 7 7 group. He lives in the Phaeton region, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

Jaccint sells fish for a living and has been managing this business for the past 11 1/2 years. He is married and has four children. 

Jaccint would like to use this loan to invest in the buying of fish. He hopes that this loan will help him expand his business.

The other group members need this loan to buy stock to sell, such as charcoal, used clothing, and food products.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 41-year-old mother of two children who both attend school. She owns and manages a general store selling different accessories and school supplies within the local community. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she wants to improve her business in order to earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she wants to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders (through ASKI) amounting to 50,000 PHP to buy more stock of accessories, toys, and school supplies to resell. 

Through this financial assistance, Marissa hopes that someday she will further improve the business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of accessories, toys, and school supplies to resell

loans.name: New Life School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Kabuye. He is the Director of New Life Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Makindye in Kampala with 286 students. New Life Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

New Life Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Kabuye ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Hadisa

texts.en:
Hadisa is 38 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband drives a microbus. She is one of the talented women of Isfara town. She is a seamstress of needlework of the ancient craft of Tajiks. Hadisa was interested in this craft from her childhood and learned it from her uncle's wife who was a famous seamstress of needlework at that time. Hadisa embroiders skullcaps, beautiful coatings for mannequins, bags, attire for brides, etc. Children diligently help her in cutting models. 

Hadisa is also a teacher by profession. She works at school in her city, which she has been doing for over eight years. She teaches primary classes. Hadisa loves both her profession and her craft. 

Hadisa requested a loan, which she will use to purchase fabrics, gold threads, and beads to continue her embroidering activity.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, gold threads, and beads

loans.name: Lady Irene School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Peace. She is the Head Teacher at Lady Irene Kindergarten School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Bulenga in Wakiso with 60 students. Lady Irene Kindergarten School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Lady Irene Kindergarten will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Peace ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Green Valley International School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Robert. He is the Head teacher of Green Valley International School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Mukono with 100 students. Green Valley International School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Green Valley International School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Robert ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Wakiso Junior School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Augustine. He is the Director of Wakiso Junior School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Wakiso town with 300 students. Wakiso Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Wakiso Junior School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Augustine ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Buzaya School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Florence. She is the Head teacher of Buzaya Secondary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kamuli district with 1,200 students. Buzaya Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Buzaya Secondary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Florence ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguiya est uniquement composé de femmes  monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Niomirambougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (oignons), jus, bananes plantains et œufs. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Wassa   (femme assise en 3ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (oignons). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  8 sacs d’oignons en gros à Médine Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Niomirambougou à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femme. Madame Wassa   espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif de subvenir aux besoins de la famille surtout les enfants dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Djiguiya group is made up of monogamous women. They are, on average, 37 years old and have four children. They all live in Niomirambougou, one of the areas in Bamako, and know each other from neighborhood ties. The group members work in small-scale commerce selling condiments (onions), juice, plantains, and eggs. With the goal of building up their stocks, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their second group loan.

Wassa (the woman seated third from the left in the photo) has a good reputation selling condiments (onions). She plans to use her loan to buy eight sacs of onions at wholesale in Médine, Bamako. 

Resales are made at retail in Niomirambougou to customers who are mostly women. 

With this loan, Wassa hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested back into her business. In this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, her goal is to support her family's needs, especially her children's.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a factory worker from Cavite, Philippines and is one of the beneficiaries of the employment program of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Marilyn is a fabric coordinator who identifies, evaluates and examines the color tone, shade and hue of fabrics used for production. Matching colors is a key element in the continuity from one fabric to the others. 

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Marilyn, is their salaries do not cover family expenses and they have no access to savings or credit. This situation makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Marilyn is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and had no problem paying them back since the loan payments are deducted every payday. She looks forward to your positive response and any loan funds will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to pay for her personal needs and also to help her extended family.

Marilyn dreams of giving her family a better future through all her hard work. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay for her personal needs and also to help her extended family.

loans.name: Rean

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rean works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Rean is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Rean has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 59 years old, married and has one child who is still in school.

Conchita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Conchita has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Conchita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Julio Wilmer

texts.es:
Julio, sabe que los créditos son herramientas útiles para tener recursos económicos con los que podrá mantener su negocio funcionando y generando mejores utilidades, ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un nuevo préstamo para invertir en ganado y pagar los costos de la recolección de la cosecha de maíz y frijol.
En la actualidad su patrimonio ha crecido con la ayuda del préstamo anterior, su familia está viviendo en un mejor nivel de vida y sus deudas han disminuido notablemente.
texts.en:
Julio knows that credit is a useful means of maintaining and growing a business and he is applying for a new loan, part of which he will use to buy cattle and the rest to pay the costs of harvesting his next maize and bean crop.  
Julio says that the investments that he has made with past loans have improved his family's living standards and made them more secure financially.

loans.use: to support his farming business.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 46 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con hija, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en: Teresa is 46 years old and is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her daughter, and earns her living selling clothing as a street vendor in different markets. She has many regular customers thanks to the quality of her clothes and her good prices. She is seeking a loan in order to buy more clothing wholesale, and so be able to continue with her sales and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Los Sanchez Group

texts.es: Los Sánchez es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, quien lo coordina es la señora Mariana de 42 años de edad, acompañada y dedicada a la hecha y venta de tortilla y cuajadas en su domicilio, con los financiamientos obtenidos en esta institución ha logrado múltiples beneficios, uno de ellos es que logro impulsar el negocio de comercialización de frutas en el mercado de la municipalidad, el crédito lo solicita para mantener los negocios e invertir en, flete de leña, quintal de maíz, jocote, naranja y cuajadas. El resto de los socios son, la señora Margarita de 34 años de edad y propietaria de una pulpería desde cuatro años en su domicilio, y Yelba una mujer de 34 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en: The Los Sánchez community bank has three enterprising members, all women.  The group's coordinator, Sra. Mariana, 42, operates a prepared foods business from a space in her house.  She makes and sells torillas and deserts.  Sra. Mariana used a past loan to start a business, buying and selling fruit in the local market.  She will use this loan to buy supplies--firewood, maize and other supplies--to carry on her prepared foods business.  The other members of the community bank are Sra. Margarita, 34, and Sra. Yelba, also 34, both of whom own corner groceries that they operate from spaces in their houses.

loans.use: to support her prepared foods business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides to use in farming

loans.name: Betty Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Rio De Oro.
En este lugar vive la señora Betty, tiene 49 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, 4 mayores de edad y la menor de 14 años la cual estudia en colegio y es la que aun vive con ella. 
Doña Betty es una mujer muy luchadora que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa, productos de catalogo de Yanbal, y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), actualmente quiere invertir parte de este crédito para comprar sabanas para la venta y con esto poder ganar más dinero que le sirvan para salir adelante junto a su hija, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 15  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito es justamente para comprar sabanas, ropa, perfumes, cremas y bisutería para incrementar su negocio. Este es su cuarto ciclo  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The members of the Rio de Oro credit group meet fortnightly in the community of La California de  Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds. This is where Betty lives. She is 49 years of age and is divorced with five children, 4 who are adults and one aged 14 who goes to school and still lives with her.

Betty is a very tenacious woman who has had to work very hard to get by. She runs a business selling clothing and products by Yanbal and Avon (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She wants to invest part of this loan to buy sheets to sell so she can earn more money to enable her to support her daughter. She sells her goods door to door and also sells items from her home to some of her customers who she knows well. She sells her goods on credit and then makes collections every eight days.  She has been earning her living from this business for over 15 years.

This loan will be used to buy sheets, clothing, perfume, creams and costume jewellery and build up her business. This is her fourth loan cycle in the credit group and she likes it because of the help it provides in the form of loans. Her dream is to do the best she can for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy sheets, clothing, perfume, creams and costume jewellery

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 57 years old and married with six children.

Lilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers.

Lilia has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and married, with four children. Two of her children are in school.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Josephine aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Twisungane Group

texts.fr:
Sillas fait partie du groupe  Twisununure  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a  30 ans et est marie a Justine une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants l’un a 1 an et l’autre 3 ans.

Il fait le commerce de chèvres   depuis  2 ans. 

Il est à son  deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup  beaucoup   de chèvres à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait construire une belle maison et voir les enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Silas is a part of the Twisununure group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 30 years old and is married to Justine, a farmer. Together they have two children, who are one and three years old. 

Sillas has worked selling goats for two years. He is on his second loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy many goats, which he will resell to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a nice house and see his children go to school.

loans.use: to buy many goats

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is married and has four children. She works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from farming rice and vegetables. 

Benita requested her thirteenth loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more seafood to sell to her customers. She hopes that her hard work will help her to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.ru: Шерзод молодой парень в возрасте 22 лет, не женат. Шерзод живет в сельской местности и с детства занимается скотоводством. Шерзод начинал с пары голов баранов и потихоньку расширил свой бизнес до нескольких голов крупного скота. Родители Шерзода работают наемными рабочими на поле по сезону и в свободное время помогают сыну ухаживать за скотом. Заработок родителей едва хватает на то, чтоб обеспечить семью и основным источником дохода является бизнес Шерзода. В данный момент бизнес Шерзода не приносит дохода из за того, что цены на скот резко упали, а на покупку корма для скота у Шерзода нет денег. С этой проблемой он обратился в "АРВАНД" за помощью. На полученные деньги Шерзод хочет купить корм для скота и из за упадка цен, несколько голов молодых бычков. Шерзод выражает благодарность "АРВАНД" за предоставление кредитов малоимущим слоям населения сельских местностей.
texts.en: Sherzod is a young 22-year old single man. He lives in a rural area and has been involved in raising livestock since his childhood. He started out with two sheep and eventually expanded his livestock to include large cattle. Sherzod’s parents work as seasonal agricultural workers and, when they have time, help their son to take care of the livestock. His parents’ income is barely enough to provide for the family, and thus Sherzod’s business is the main source of income. At present Sherzod’s business does not bring in revenues because the livestock prices have dropped sharply and he lacks the money to buy livestock feed. Because of this challenge he has reached out to Arvand for help. He would like to use his loan to buy livestock feed, and, thanks to the current dip in prices, several young bulls. Sherzod thanks Arvand for its loans to low-income rural dwellers.

loans.use: to buy   cattle and  cattle feed

loans.name: Lissette

texts.es:
Lissette de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta 4° grado de educación básica, esta soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con su padre y madrastra. Solamente el papá depende de ella. 

Lissette trabaja con ganado bovino, lo ha hecho por más de 2 años y lo aprendió de su papá, decidió hacerlo para buscar un dinero extra y mantenerse ocupada en algo, antes era empleada. La distancia donde mantiene el ganado esta como a 1 cuadra y le apoya su padre, no tiene horario fijo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar ganado de repasto. Con el préstamo le mejorará mucho su condición económica ya que tendrá mas ganado y también manteniéndose ocupada tendrá mejor calidad de vida. 

 Sus sueños son seguir trabajando lo mejor que se pueda para tener un mejor futuro, y con las ganancias ir pagando el préstamo muy bien para que Credicampo le siga prestando.
texts.en:
Lissette, 39, studied up to fourth grade.  She's single, has no children, and lives with her father and stepmother.  Only her father is dependent on her.

Lissette has worked with cattle for more than two years.  She learned the work from her father and decided to do it for the extra money and to keep busy.  Previously she was employed.  She keeps the cattle about a block away.  Her father helps her, and she doesn't have a fixed schedule.

The loan she's requesting from CrediCampo is to buy grazing cattle.  The loan will greatly improve her financial situation because she'll have more cattle.  Also, keeping busy will improve her quality of life.

Lissette's dreams are to keep on working the best she can so she has a better future and, with her profits, pay back the loan successfully so CrediCampo will keep on lending to her.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
To generate income, Mary Jane engages in cooking and selling snack foods within her community. She is 31 years old and blessed with three children. Mary Jane aims to make her business profitable and earn a higher income but is experiencing financial insufficiency. She wants to cook more snack recipes to sell but she doesn't have enough capital. 

Mary Jane is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan from Kiva lenders to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, cooking oil, and flour to cook and sell snacks in her local community. She believes that having this financial assistance will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, cooking oil, and flour

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita has been helping her husband work on their own farm to make a living. She has been doing this for many years and she earns well for the family. Her previous loan used for farming had been repaid successfully. 

Florita requested another loan, which she will use to purchase seedlings and organic fertilizer to have an abundant farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Gina Aracely

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Rio De Oro.
En este lugar vive la señora Gina, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 20 y 17 años de edad los mismos que estudian en universidad y colegio. Su marido trabaja en una empresa privada.
Doña Gina es una muy buena mujer que le gusta trabajar para así ganarse sus propios ingresos, ella se dedica al comercio, tiene un local en el cual da servicio de internet y vende  productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), ciertos útiles, colas, aguas, gelatinas y varios productos de picar, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00 y sus productos los vende en su local y también un día por semana visita a sus clientes, deja ciertos productos a crédito. Lleva más de 14  años dedicada al comercio.
Este crédito es para comprar aguas, colas, jugos, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, bisutería entre otras cosas. Lleva seis años  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the Rio de Oro credit group meet fortnightly in the community of La California de Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds. 

This is where Gina lives. She is 50 years old and lives with her partner with whom she has two children of 20 and 17 years of age.  One of her children is currently studying at university and the other is still at school. Her husband works for a private company.

Gina is a very good person who likes working so she can have her own income.  She works in business, running premises offering an internet service and selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories, useful items, glue, water, jellies, and various things to eat. She works every day from 8am to 9pm, selling her goods from her premises. One day a week, she also visits her customers and leaves certain items on credit. She has been running her shop for over 14 years.

The loan will be used to buy water, glue, fruit juice, perfume, creams, cosmetics and costume jewellery, among other things. She has been a member of the credit group for six years and she likes it because the loans enable her to get by. Her dream is to see her children work in professional careers.

loans.use: to buy water, glue, fruit juice, perfume. creams, cosmetics, costume jewellery, etc.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, con las utilidades de la inversión del crédito anterior pago la deuda, ha comprado electrodomésticos para el hogar, la alimentación para él y su familia es mucho mejor.
Considera que hoy en día tiene mayor demanda de sus productos pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para poderlas cubrir, eso hace que se decida a solicitar un nuevo préstamo con el comprara pantalones, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior y otras prendas de vestir que están de moda, de esta forma mantendrá un lugar en el mercado y tendrá recursos económicos para cumplir con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Miguel used the returns that he made from a past loan, now repaid, to buy kitchen appliances and says that his family can store and prepare food much more easily now.

Demand for the clothes that Miguel sells is greater than ever now and he is applying for a new loan that he will use to stock his business with pants, skirts and other clothing.  The investment will allow him to maintain his place in the market and deliver on his commitments to his customers.

loans.use: to stock his clothing sales business.

loans.name: Japheth's Group

texts.en:
Japheth's Group is comprised of 10 farmers in the Kakamega South District. Japheth, pictured above, is the group leader. He is 64 years old and married with four children. Japheth has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Japheth isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed that his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, Japheth will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Japheth's Group will purchase a total of seven solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests
