loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Balimaya  est composé majoritairement de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Bamako-coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako  et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, d’huiles rouge, des savons et des mèches. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme assise en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  35 pièces de pagnes wax en gros à  Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Bamako-coura à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Balimaya is composed mostly of monogamous women, who average 47 years of age and two children each. All the women live in Bamako-coura, a district of Bamako. And they know one another through community ties. The group members have small-scale businesses involving clothing, red oil, soaps, and hair extensions.

With the goal of building up their stock of merchandise, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle

Ms. Fatoumata (the woman sitting second from the right in the photo) is famous for selling clothing. She intends to use her loan to purchase 35 items of Wax 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) wholesale in Bamako. Her sales are made retail to a customer base composed mostly of women in Bamako-coura.

With this loan, Ms. Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business. Her goal is to buy a residential plot of land through this Soro Yiriwaso relationship.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Birokhila

texts.ru:
Женщину на фотографии зовут Бирохила. Она из района Руми. Ей 44 года. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Ее муж и сыновья уехали на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Бирохила зарабатывает путем предоставления услуги портнихи на дому. Бирохилу сестра научила шить и по сей день, она зарабатывает получая заказы шитье женских платьев. 
   Причина, по которой Бирохила обратилась за кредитом, является не достаточная сумма денег для завершения ремонта. Ей необходимо в скором времени закончить ремонт до прихода холодов. Поддержите Бирохила, она надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
The woman in the photograph is Birokhila. She is from the Rumy district and is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband and sons work in Russia and Birokhila works from home as a seamstress. Her sister taught her to sew and Birokhila earns an income taking orders for women's dresses.

The reason Birokhila requested a loan is that she does not have enough money to complete home repairs, which she needs to finish before the cold weather arrives. She is relying on your support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and complete home repairs.

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sérieux  est majoritairement composé de monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 35ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (tomates) et habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sali (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande renommée dans la vente des condiments (tomates). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 corbeilles de tomates en gros à   Médine. La revente s’effectue en détails à Djalakorodji à une  clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sali espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif de maintenir cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’avoir beaucoup plus d’argent.
texts.en:
The group Sérieux is composed mostly of monogamous women, who average 35 years of age and four children each. All the women live in Djalakorodji, a district of Bamako. And they know one another through community ties. The group members have small-scale businesses involving condiments (tomatoes) and clothing.

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 4th solidarity loan cycle

Ms. Sali (the woman standing at the far right in the photo) is famous for selling condiments (tomatoes). She intends to use her loan to purchase 4 baskets of tomatoes in bulk in Médine. Her sales are made retail to a customer base composed mostly of women in Djalakorodji.

With this loan, Ms. Sali hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business. Her goal is to maintain this Soro Yiriwaso relationship in order to obtain much more money.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as tomatoes

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées uniquement dans des ménages polygamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Bamako-coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Bamako-coura. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, de produits cosmétiques et restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme assise en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse des habits (pagnes wax). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 35 pièces de pagnes wax à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Bamako-coura à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariam compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 140 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkadi Group are married women who live within polygamous family frameworks. On average, each member is 36 years old and has on average four children. They all live in Bamako-Coura, one of the districts of Bamako. They all know each other through the bonds of community and their revenue-generating activities. The members of this group earn a living through selling clothing and cosmetics and running food stalls. In order to increase their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate alongside Soro Yiriwaso. This will be their fourth group loan.

Mariam (the woman sat second from the right in the photo) is a successful clothing vendor. She sells traditional pagne wax cloth. She plans on using this loan to purchase 35 sheets of pagne wax cloth in Bamako. She will then resell her stock in Bamako-Coura to a customer base predominantly made up of women. Mariam plans to make an average monthly profit of 140,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested back into her business and used to meet pay for her household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 49 years old and married with eight children. Four of her children are in school. Elvira has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from running a general store and fattening pigs. Elvira is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF.

Elvira is requesting a 16,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is married and two children. She works hard to support her family. She operates a general store business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from farming sugar cane. 

Marife requested another loan from NWTF for 29,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional items such as candies, detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, chocolate drinks, juice, etc. to sell at her general store. She hopes that her hard work will help her to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as candies, detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, chocolate drinks, juice, etc.

loans.name: Phoeun's Group

texts.en:
Phoeun is 34 years old and a father of two children. He is a local rice farmer living in Kampong Speu province. Phoeun earns about 16,000 KHR per day. 

Phoeun is the leader of a nine-person group loan. This will be his first loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund. Phoeun will use his entire portion of the group loan to buy water filter. He hopes that his family has clean water to drink.

loans.use: to buy a water filter

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Afshan

texts.en:
Afshan is 49 years old and a mother of two children. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Afshan’s husband has been running his own auto workshop for many years and he is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. He wants to buy different kinds of tools and spare parts for his business, but due to insufficient financial means, he cannot afford to buy this merchandise. 

Afshan is requesting a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase tools and spare parts for her husband’s business. She hopes her loan will help him to earn a profitable income to meet the daily needs of their family and business. Afshan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools and accessories for her husband's auto repair workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Nyetaga Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq  membres du groupe Nyetaga  ont en moyenne 41 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji  l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Djalakorodji. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (tomates), charbon du bois, pain et huile d’arachides. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sira (femme  arrêtée au milieu sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (tomates). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 corbeilles de tomates  en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à  Djalakorodji   en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sira compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in monogamous households, the five members of the group Nyetaga average 41 years of age and six children each. All the women live in Djalakorodji, a district of Bamako. And they know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses in Djalakorodji. The group members have small-scale businesses involving condiments (tomatoes), charcoal, bread, and peanut oil.

With the goal of growing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 4th solidarity loan cycle

Ms. Sira (the woman standing in the middle in the photo) is a major vendor of condiments (tomatoes). She intends to use her loan to purchase 4 baskets of tomatoes in bulk in Médine. Her sales are made retail in Djalakorodji by hawking to a customer base composed mostly of women.

With this loan, Ms. Sira expects to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and satisfying the sundry needs at home.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as tomatoes

loans.name: Emely

texts.en: Emely helps her husband with his manufacturing business selling woven nipa in their village. Her previous loan used for buying nipa leaves had been repaid successfully. To deliver more woven products, Emely requested another loan, which she will use to buy more raw materials for nipa making. She hopes to meet the demand for orders this season. In the future, she wants to repair their house for a better and comfortable living.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for nipa making.

loans.name: Chỉ

texts.en:
Mrs. Chỉ works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Chỉ is 45 years old, and she is married with eight children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Chỉ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Chỉ has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Chỉ faces in her life is not having hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Chỉ hopes for her business to do well. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Soutoura sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans à Bamako-coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Bamako-coura. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, sacs, laits en poudre et habits. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bintou  (femme  assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de sacs à main. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  15 sacs à main en gros à Bamako.  La revente se fait à Bamako-coura à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Bintou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Soutoura are married for the most part in monogamous households. And they average 36 years of age and three children each. All the women live in Bamako-coura, a district of Bamako. They know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses in Bamako-coura. The group members have small-scale businesses involving handbags, powdered milk, and clothing.

With the goal of replenishing their cash, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle

Ms. Bintou (the woman sitting at the far left in the photo) is famous for selling handbags. She intends to use her loan to purchase 15 handbags wholesale in Bamako. Her sales are made retail in Bamako-coura to a customer base composed mostly of women.

With this loan, Ms. Bintou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 85,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting the children’s healthcare needs.

loans.use: to purchase handbags to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for corn farming

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl lives in Alcala with her family. She is 30 years old, married, and has a child studying in elementary school. 

Her spouse is a farmer and she also helps him manage the business. Aside from corn farming, they also engage in planting vegetables and operating a retail store for additional sources of income. 

Cheryl and her spouse had unstable income. That is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy farm inputs (i.e., fertilizer, insecticide) to use in farming. This will help nourish crops and give them further, good production. Additional revenue will also be used to improve Cheryl's small retail store.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (i.e., fertilizer, insecticide) used in farming.

loans.name: Handolina

texts.en:
Handolina is 52 years old and a married woman with nine children. Three of her children are in school; she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Handolina has a dry goods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy an additional stock of dry goods to sell.

Handolina has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of dry goods.

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee is married and has four children. She works hard to support her family. She operates a restaurant business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from tailoring. 

Imee requested her eleventh loan from NWTF for 35,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional utensils and spices for her restaurant. She hopes that her hard work will help her to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional utensils and spices for her restaurant.

loans.name: Nelson's Group

texts.en:
Nelson's Group is formed by 16 farmers in Kakamega south district, and is being represented by Nelson, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 42 years old, is married, and has four children. Nelson has been a farmer for 10 years, and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Nelson isn’t new to One Acre Fund; he actually joined the program in 2013, and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Nelson will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Nelson's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 10 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his maize harvests.

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
Lalyn is from Laguna, Philippines. She is married and has children. She has been employed to a garment factory in Cavite for two years now through the aid of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Lalyn works as a sewer. She does the sewing and designing of clothing apparel according to the company or client’s demand. She sews clothes using a sewing machine or other stitching machines, or often does hand stitching of edges and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Lalyn, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses. And, they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Lalyn is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative, and she had no problem in paying it back since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day.  She looks forward for your positive response, and any coming amount from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to pay the enrollment fees of her children.

Lalyn hopes to improve the general living condition of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its' core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay the enrollment fees of her kids.

loans.name: Độ

texts.en:
Mr. Độ works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Độ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. He lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Độ is 58 years old, and he is married with no children

This is Độ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Độ faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine.  He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cements and bricks to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Độ hopes for his business to do well. He also hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel his house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more school supplies, snack foods, canned goods, laundry soaps, candies, soft drinks and frozen foods

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai has a retail business selling dry food. She has been involved in this business for six years.

Mai is 36 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Bim Son town, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

The main hardship that Mai faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her  business profit, Mai hopes for her business to do well and to remodel her house. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Ahrorjon

texts.ru: Ахрорчон молодой парень в возрасте 26 лет, женат и имеет 3 детей. Ахрорчон живет сельской местности и занимается животноводством на протяжение 13 лет. Он начал это занятие в юном возрасте. Отец купил ему молодого бычка и Ахрорчон начал самостоятельно ухаживать за ним и кормить. Вырастив бычка он его продал и купил два молодых бычка и корм для них. Таким образом Ахрорчон увеличил поголовье своего скота. Ахрорчон покупает молодых бычков, откармливает и потом продает по более высокой цене. Этот бизнес является для Ахрорчона основным источником дохода. Так как сам Ахрорчон не получил в свое время достойного образование он хочет, чтобы у его детей было хорошее образование и они не испытывали трудностей в жизни, как сам Ахрорчон. Сейчас доход Ахрорчона упал из за низкой цены на скот и он не может продать своих быков не потеряв часть своей прибыли. Ахрорчон решил обратится в "АРВАНД" за поддержкой и взять кредит. На полученные деньги он хочет купить корм для скота на зиму. Ахрорчон заранее благодарен организации за предоставленную помощь сельским жителям.
texts.en: Ahrorjon is a young, 26-year-old man, who is married and has 3 children. Ahrorjon lives in a rural area and has been involved in animal husbandry for 13 years. He started this business when he was very young. His father bought him a young bull, and Ahrorjon started to care and feed the bull independently. After raising the bull, he sold him and bought two more young bulls and feed for them. This is how Ahrorjon increased his livestock headcount. Ahrorjon buys young bulls, fattens them up and then sells them at a higher price. This business is Ahrorjon's primary source of income. Because Ahrorjon never obtained a decent education, he wants his children to have a good education and not experience hardships in life like Ahrorjon did. Now, Ahrorjon's income has fallen due to lower livestock prices, and he cannot sell his bulls without losing some of his profit. Ahrorjon decided to come to "Arvand" for the support and obtain a loan. He wants to use the requested amount to buy feed for his livestock for the winter. Ahrorjon is grateful to the organization in advance for the help provided to rural residents.

loans.use: to buy feed for his livestock for the winter

loans.name: Pilot

texts.en:
Pilot is 21 years old and a student at university taking a banking and finance major. He lives in the Battambang province of Cambodia. To cover his study expenses, he has also been working as a credit officer at a microfinance institution, earning $5.43 daily. 

Pilot requested a loan, which he will use to pay his tuition fees. With this loan, he will be able to graduate successfully. For his future after graduation, he wants to find a better job to save money to run a business.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Mrs Dung has a stall selling fruit. She has been involved in this business for seven years.

Dung is 61 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Bim Son town, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

The main hardship that Dung faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Dung hopes to expand her business and to remodel her house. Her children study well,

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lâm

texts.en:
Lâm is 55 years old, married and has three children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She works in agriculture farming food, which she has been doing for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Lâm faces in her life is not having money to repair the latrine. She requested a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which she will use to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to repair her latrine/toilet and construct a well. Lâm hopes her children find good jobs, her business does well, and her family stays healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to repair her latrine/toilet

loans.name: Mi Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Mi sagrada familia es un grupo solidario integrado por cuatro socios laboriosos que tomaron la iniciativa para solicitar los financiamientos de la institución con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia como también mejorar sus negocios. Este grupo lo coordina la señora Juana quien tiene la edad de 28 años, casada y madre de un hijo que depende económicamente de ella, se dedica a la comercialización de verduras y productos lácteos en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace más de un año, anteriormente se dedicaba a la comercialización de ropa nueva, este crédito lo solicita para la compra de queso, crema, cuajadas, tomate, chiltoma, cebolla, plátano verde y huevo. 
Esta socia cuenta con excelente equipo de trabajo, el señor Carlos de 64 años de edad y quien se dedica a la comercialización de frutas en uno de los mercados de la capital desde hace siete años, Ángela una mujer de 43 anos y quien se dedica a la hecha y venta de cosa de horno desde hace cuatro años, comercializándolos en su comunidad, y Marbeli de 39 años de edad y quien comercializa ropa nueva en su comunidad.
texts.en:
"Mi Sagrada Familia" is a solidarity group made up of four har-working membersl, who have taken the initiative to request a loan with the aim of increasing their incomes, in order both to improve the qualities of life of their families and to develop their businesses.

The group's coordinator is Juana, who is 28 years old, married, and mother of one child who depends on her. She earns her living by selling vegetables and dairy products from her home. She started this business more than a year ago, having previously worked selling new clothing. She is seeking her part of the loan in order to buy cheese, cream, cheese curds, tomatoes, peppers, green bananas, and eggs. This will help her to diversify the range of products that she offers. 

Juana can count on an excellent team: Carlos, who is 64 years old and for the last seven years has worked selling fruit in one of the markets of the capital; Ángela, who is 43 years old and for the past four hears has earned her living by baking and selling "cosas de horno", traditional Nicaraguan sweet corn cakes; and Marbelí, who is 39 years old and works selling new clothing in her community.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, cheese curds, tomatoes, peppers, green bananas, and eggs, and so diversify the range of products she offers.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 55 years old and married, with seven children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Rubina is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Rubina has been raising livestock for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Connie is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Connie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet is a 41-year-old proud mother of seven children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 16 farmers in Kakamega south district. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Violet has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Violet described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Violet’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 45 years, and married with four children. He is living in Kasese, Uganda. For nine years Justus has been selling clothes and also offering tailoring services to earn a living. Justus has a dream of being the biggest supplier of school uniforms in his area. However, he is faced with a challenge of market competition and limited capital. 

Justus will use the loan to buy school uniform materials, and zips and other textiles for selling.

loans.use: to buy school uniform material, zips and other textiles for selling.

loans.name: Barnaba

texts.en:
Barnaba is 35 and he wants to make a radical change in his lifestyle. He doesn't want to have to rely on someone else any longer, and work for a low salary. He doesn't want to live a life that's not worthy at times due to a low income. 

Barnaba is tired of all this, so he wants to increase his dairy farming. Barnaba has four children whom he adores and cherishes, and a beautiful wife who always paints a smile on Barnaba’s face. 

Barnaba has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years, and is making great strides. He has been able to earn a decent and honest living through milk and egg selling, and personal business. These ventures have enabled him to send his children to school and feed his family. Barnaba has planted many trees on his compound and also has Napier grass, which has high protein and is used to feed his dairy cow, thereby enhancing his milk-selling profits. 

Because of increased demand, Barnaba is kindly requesting a loan to buy a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is a very profitable venture, and he wants to take full advantage of the ready market for dairy products. Through the loan, Barnaba is sure of satisfying the demand for milk in his area. Through increased profits, Barnaba is sure that he will repay the loan on time, and also be in a position to comfortably take care of his family. 

Barnaba, with his entrepreneurial spirit, strength and tenacity, would like to continue fighting so that he can achieve his dream of owning his own business and empowering society by being a source of employment. Juhudi Kilimo, through its training, has helped Barnaba save more effectively, and through his accumulated profits, he plans to add value to his milk through packaging. 

He also hopes to one day start manufacturing milk products such as yogurt and cream.

loans.use: To buy an additional dairy cow

loans.name: Quy

texts.en:
Mrs. Quy works in agriculture, growing pineapple. She has been involved in this business for seven years.

Quy is 48 years old, and she is married, with four children. She lives and works in Bim Son town, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

The main hardship that Quy faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her  business profit, Quy hopes for her business to do well and to remodel her house.  She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet .

loans.name: Lý

texts.en:
Mrs. Lý operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. Lý has been involved in this business for three years.

Lý is 30 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lý's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Lý faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to repair her latrine/toilet.

With her business profit, Lý hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to repair her latrine (toilet).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beds and mattresses  to use in his   lodges.

loans.name: Aisalkyn

texts.ru: Айсалкын, 51 год, в разводе. Имеет 2 детей школьного возраста. У Айсалкын высшее образование, она работает заместителем директора в школе, также занимается сельским хозяйством. Она успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, в котором у нее имеется: 6 коров, 20 овец и 1 лошадь. Бизнес Айсалкын на сегодняшний день приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере 10,000 сом (KGS), однако этих средств не хватает Айсалкын для содержания и обучения ее детей. Поэтому она решила обратиться в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Она хочет увеличить поголовье скота и улучшить условия жизни ее семьи.
texts.en:
Aisalkyn is 51 years old and divorced. She has two children of school age. Aisalkyn has a higher education. She as the deputy director in a school, and also engages in agriculture. She is a successful farmer on her own small homestead, on which she has: six cows, 20 sheep and one horse. Aisalkyn's currently brings ijn monthly profits of 10,000 som (KGS), which at the same time is not sufficient for Aisalkyn to support and educate her children. Therefore she decided to apply to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep.

She wants to increase her livestock count and to improve living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep in order to grow her income.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 14 farmers in Kakamega South District. He is 64 years old, is married and has six children.

John likes to think of himself as a very experienced farmer. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has learnt a lot from farming trainings. John plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, John’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Tiến

texts.en:
Mrs. Tiến operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. Tiến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Tiến is 35 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Tiến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tiến has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
 
The main harship that Tiến faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to repair her latrine/toilet.

With her business profit, Tiến hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to repair her latrine (toilet).

loans.name: Nghị

texts.en:
Mr. Nghị works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Nghị has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Nghị is 54 years old and he is married with two children. Nghị lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nghị's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Nghị faces in his life is not having a clean water system and hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

With his business profit, Nghị hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel his house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Monte Oreb Group

texts.es: Monte Oreb está integrado por tres mujeres laboriosas, y coordinado por la señora Emerita quien tiene la edad de 47 años, acompañada, comerciante de artículos ferreteros y medicamentos de manera ambulante, es primer ciclo que solicita de los financiamientos en ADIM, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de balanzas, martillos, candados, cucharas, apagador aéreos, vitaminas, etc., una de sus metas es pagar puntual para gozar de un buen récord crediticio en la institución. Arelys es otra de las integrantes del grupo, tiene la edad de 26 años y comercializa cosméticos AVON desde hace tres años en su comunidad y Johanna quien tiene la edad de 30 años y comercializa cosméticos y ropa desde hace seis años en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Monte Oreb is a group made up of three hard-working women, and coordinated by Emerita. She is 47 years old, lives with her partner, and earns her living as a street vendor of hardware and medicines. This is the first time she has sought a loan via ADIM, and she will use her portion to buy weighing scales, hammers, padlocks, spoons, light switches, vitamins, and other stock, to meet the demand she has for these products. One of her goals is to make her payments punctually, and so enjoy a good credit record with the institution.

The other members of the group are Arelys, who is 26 years old and for the past three years has worked selling Avon cosmetics in her community, and Johanna, who is 30 years old and for the past six years has earned her living selling cosmetics and clothing in her community.

loans.use: to buy weighing scales, hammers, padlocks, spoons, light switches, vitamins, and other stock, to meet the demand she has for these products

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is 19 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. 

Saida is a student in her first course at Tajikistan State University Politics and Business. She is learning law. She is a very hard-working and smart woman. Saida studies well and is knowledgeable. She dreams of being a good specialist after graduating university. 

Saida is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. Kiva lenders are only the ones who can help her. She awaits your mercy and, in advance, thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Due to capital insufficiency, Monica wants to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders to improve her small retail store. She wants to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more junk food, candies, biscuits, soft drinks, beverages, seasonings and laundry soaps to resell. Having this financial assistance, Monica believes that she will be able to improve her business and make it more profitable, and hopes that someday she will improve the living status of her family.

loans.use: to buy more junk food, candies, biscuits, soft drinks, beverages, seasonings and laundry soaps to resell.

location.town: Brgy. San Pedro, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Paulito

texts.en: Paulito is 37 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with 2 children. He has a bakery shop that sells different kinds of delicious bread. He has had this business for 6 years. He has requested a loan to buy more ingredients to make more delicious bread for his customers. He has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Paulito wants to open a new bakery house in the neighbouring city.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make more bread to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a farming rice business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her farming rice business.

She has been in this business for four years and earns more income from rice retailing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena is 33 years old and married with two children. Rena works very hard to provide for them.

Rena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rena has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and school supplies. 

In the future Rena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kirana

texts.en:
Kirana is 45 years old and married with eleven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

Kirana has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seventeen years.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Kirana aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Jonard (student, in the picture wearing a black shirt beside his mother Ludivina) is 17 years old and the first of five children in the family. His mother, Ludivina, a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF), supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Jonard is studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in Criminology and is currently on his first of this four-year program.

Ludivina is borrowing PHP 7,000 to pay for tuition fees of her son, Jonard, for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Jonard plans to graduate and be gainfully employed, so he can help his family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees of her son.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora works hard to support her family. She is married and has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines.

Nora requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, cube ice, etc.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Nora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, cube ice, etc

loans.name: Flordenia

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Flordenia works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Flordenia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

Flordenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Mariées uniquement dans des ménages polygamiques, les quatre membres du groupe Nièta ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Bamako-coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Bamako-coura. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits cosmétiques (pommades et parfums), habits et grains d’arachides. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mamou (femme assise en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de produits cosmétiques (pommades et parfums). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 cartons de pommades et 8 cartons de parfums Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Bamako-coura  à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mamou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of the Nieta Group are married women who live within polygamous family frameworks. On average, each member is 37 years old and has on average four children. They all live in Bamako-Coura, one of the districts of Bamako. They all know each other through the bonds of community and their revenue-generating activities. The members of this group earn a living through selling cosmetics (pomades and perfumes), clothing and peanuts. In order to increase their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate alongside Soro Yiriwaso. This will be their fourth group loan.

Mamou (the woman sat second from the right in the photo) is a successful cosmetics vendor. She plans on using this loan to purchase 10 boxes of pomade and eight boxes of perfume in Bamako. She will then resell her stock in Bamako-Coura to a customer base predominantly made up of women. Mamou plans to make an average monthly profit of 200,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested back into her business and used to pay for her household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Mạnh

texts.en:
Mr. Mạnh  works in agriculture, farming food. Mạnh is 22 years old and he is single with no children. He lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents

This is Mạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Mạnh  has been involved in this business for 4 years. The main hardship that Mạnh  faces in his life is not having latrine so his family share a neighbor's latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With his business profits, Mạnh hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business, to build a new house and to get married.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nhóm 02_Thôn 3_Minh Châu Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Hương is 40 years old and married with four children.

Hương is the group leader of the Nhóm 02_Thôn 3_Minh Châu solidarity group, which consists of three members. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, she hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 02_Thôn4_Minh Châu Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoan works in agriculture farming rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase a machine to saparate rice cover and core to do service.

Ngoan is 59 years old and she is married with six children. Ngoan is the group leader of the Nhóm 02_Thôn4_Minh Châu  solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

This is Ngoan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ngoan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Ngoan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Ngoan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to saparate rice cover and core to do service

loans.name: Thát

texts.en:
Thát works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. 

Thát is 49 years old and is married with 5 children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.


In 2002, Thát joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thát has successfully repaid one loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hadrship that Thát faces in her life is not having a clean water systerm and hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Thát hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She has children and she is working in a garment factory. She was employed through the assistance of Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Ruby is a Roving Quality Control Officer. She inspects garments, such as men's denim bottoms, during manufacturing operations to determine the number of defects per worker and reasons for rejects by examiners. She counts the number of pattern parts, layers of cloth prior to cutting, number of stitches per inch during sewing operations, and collects other measurement knowledge.

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Ruby, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Ruby is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments were deducted every payday. She looks forward to your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will be using the loan as her additional capital for her direct-selling business.

Ruby wants to be promoted to supervisor someday or become a successful businesswoman. She dreams of giving her children a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, provide quality jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring, and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, empowering the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to create starting capital for her direct-selling business.

loans.name: Mùi

texts.en:
Mùi has a retail business selling animal feed. She has been involved in this business for 3 years.

Mùi is 49 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives with one dependent. in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build toilet. This is Mùi's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Mùi hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Jocknus

texts.en:
Jocknus is thirty years old. He is married without children but living with two dependents in Kasese Uganda. 

Jocknus has been operating a general merchandise shop since 2007 to earn a living and eradicate poverty. His dream is to grow his business into a wholesale operation. However, he faces a challenge of high electricity bills and rental costs. 

He is a hard working man in need of a loan to buy soap, cosmetics, sugar and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, cosmetics, sugar and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Semu

texts.en:
Semu is a fifty five year old male, married with eight children and living in Kasese Uganda. 

Semu owns a motorcycle transport business alongside earning a monthly salary as a store keeper. He has a dream of having the smartest rental houses in the area. However, he is faced with a challenge of  market competition. Semu wants money to buy cement and sand to plaster his rental houses.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to plaster his rental houses.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en: A father of three children, Chan is 33 years old and lives in Kampong Speu province. To support his family, he grows rice as his main source of income and he can earn about 18,000 KHR per day to support his family. This is Chan's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of five members, he is the group leader. He will spend his entire loan portion to buy a water filter. He hopes that his family will now have clean water to use.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is an experienced farmer from the Gndevaz village in the Vayots Dzor region. She lives with her husband and one-year-old son. To take care of their needs, Anna and her husband are extensively engaged in an agribusiness which involves cattle breeding. Anna's husband sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family’s income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Anna needs to invest more in the business. A loan of 2,100 USD will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family and will enable her to buy a cow and forage to feed the livestock (400 bales). Anna and her husband highly rely on the goodwill of lenders and appreciate their support in collecting the amount for the loan needed to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy a cow and forage to feed the livestock (400 bales)

location.town: Gndevaz village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a solar panel to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.name: Nakhou Group

texts.en:
Bounsuan's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village, including Bounsuan, are able to buy bottled water.  The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The water in nearby villages is also dirty and unsafe.

Bounsuan is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter.

Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Bounsuan, due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal, by decreasing time spent foraging for wood, and decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water.

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find that the filter works for 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters in order to have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nabonetai Group

texts.en:
Thong's village takes water from wells and the local streams. The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The drinking water in nearby villages is also dirty and unsafe for drinking. Some people in the village, including Thong, are able to buy bottled water.

Thong is excited that she, like her group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases.

The water filter also increases disposable income to users like Thong by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. As well, the decreased need to boil water reduces the amount spent purchasing charcoal and the time spent foraging for wood.

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find the filter works for 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters to access safe drinking water.

loans.name: Thonghab Group

texts.en:
SaVath's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village, including SaVath, are able to buy bottled water. The water from natural sources in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from this problem.

SaVath is excited that he, like his fellow group members, was able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases.

The water filter also increases disposable income to users like SaVath, due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal and time spent foraging for wood, both in order to boil water, and due to the decreased amount of money required to purchase bottled water.

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most find that the filter works for 3-5 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters to access safe drinking water.

loans.name: Pamela's Group

texts.en:
Pamela is a 42-year-old proud mother of five children. She is the group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Pamela has noticed that she has learnt a lot from farming trainings.

Pamela described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Pamela’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rihab

texts.en:
Rihab is 31 years old and single. She works as a nurse, which she has been doing for 10 years, to cover the needs and expenses of her family, which consists of four members. 

Rihab is the sole earner of her family and she is trying desperately to satisfy their needs. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use to pay the costs of her mother's surgery to heal her pain and rescue her from her illness.

loans.use: to pay the costs of her mother's surgery

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Loan is 50 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Loan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Loan has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Loan faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment for a toilet to repair her latrine/toilet.

With her business profit, Loan hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment for a toilet to repair her latrine/toilet.

loans.name: Nên

texts.en:
Nên is 56 years old, married, and has three children. She  lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province, and works in agriculture farming, poultry, and cattle, which she has been doing for more than 10 years.

The main harship that Nên faces in her life is not having a clean water cistern and hygienic latrine. She requested her third loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which she will use to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build toilet. Nên hopes that her business does well and her family stays healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build toilet

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is 51 years old and she is married with three children. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Mai has a retail business selling general food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. With her business profit, Mai hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet. This is Mai's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Hằng

texts.en:
Hằng is 43 years old and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Hằng is an accountant for a factory producing bricks. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to build a new house.

The main hardship that Hằng faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. This is Hằng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Sayyora

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Сайёра. Она замужняя женщина в возрасте 39 лет. Ее муж на данный момент находиться в Российской Федерации на заработках. Сайёра на Родине, как и большинство жителей Таджикистана, занимается животноводством. Она родилась в семье фермеров и с самого детства знает все о деятельности животноводства. 
  Сайёра решила расширить животноводческую деятельность и купить большое количество скотин, для увеличения поголовья скотин и повышения доходности от бизнеса. Сайёра имеет большой опыт, и уверенность в том, что ее ждет успех.
texts.en: Her name is Sayyora. She is a married, 39-year-old woman. At the present time, her husband is working in the Russian Federation. Sayyora is in her native land and, just like the majority of the Tajikistan population, is involved in animal husbandry. She was born in a farmer's family and has known everything about the animal husbandry business since her childhood. Sayyora decided to expand her animal husbandry business and buy a large number of livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount and business profitability. Sayyora has a lot of experience and confidence that success awaits her.

loans.use: to buy livestock and expand her business

loans.name: Oybibi

texts.ru: Ойбиби пожилая женщина в возрасте 68 лет. Она вдова. Ойбиби родила и воспитала пятерых детей. Она 35 лет проработала юристом. Но сейчас Ойбиби пенсионерка и занимается скотоводством. Ойбиби не считает себя старой и хочет создать хороший устойчивый бизнес. Она имеет не большое количество скотин и решила увеличить поголовья скота путем получения кредита. Кредит поможет ей создать хороший бизнес и не остаться без дела на пенсии.
texts.en: Oybibi is an elderly, 68-year-old woman. She is a widow. Oybibi gave birth to and raised five children. She spent 35 years working as a jurist, but now Oybibi is retired and involved in animal husbandry. Oybibi does not consider herself old and wants to create a good and stable business. She has a small number of livestock and decided to increase the livestock headcount by obtaining this loan. The loan will help her create a good business and not be left without an occupation during her retirement.

loans.use: to buy several heads of livestock

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, invirtió el préstamo anterior en la venta de ropa, teniendo así mejores oportunidades de atraer nuevos clientes, aumentar su ventas y ha mejorado la situación financiera.
En vísperas de las fiestas navideñas, ha identificado un inventario poco llamativo en su negocio para sus clientes, por lo que requiere un nuevo préstamo para comprar nuevas prendas de vestir, con las que mantendrá a sus clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Mario invested his previous loan in clothing sales.  He had better opportunities for attracting new customers and increasing his sales, and his financial situation has improved.

On the eve of the Christmas holiday, he sees that his inventory isn't very appealing for his customers, so he needs another loan to buy new garments to keep his customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy new garments to keep his customers satisfied

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en:
Yuliana is a 41-year-old mother of four children; Martin and Melki went to another province to work, while Samuel, 14, is studying in the second year of junior high school, and Renny, 11, is studying in the sixth grade of elementary school. Both are living with Yuliana.

To make a living, Yuliana helps a farmer raise their cattle for six months to sell. The owner usually gives a partial payment from the sale to her. The money was spent for paying her daughter’s school fees.

Currently, she plans to raise pigs as her own business. Yuliana intends to buy three piglets and build a stall. She needs more capital to do so. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and build a stall.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat, 36, is originally from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She has three children; one is married and lives independently, while the other two are single and live under her support. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice, and sells the crop to the local dealers. So far, she has been a farmer for almost 20 years.

Apart from being involved with the agriculture sector, her husband, Hern, 36, is a construction project contractor. During this time, her husband’s job is not running so well since he cannot avail himself of the construction materials he needs to be able to compete with others.

Therefore, Sophat is applying for a Kiva loan to buy some construction materials such as brick, stone, timber, cement, plumbing and so on for her husband. She hopes this loan will help her husband’s job to go smoothly as well as bring regular income for her family. She would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy some construction materials

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh has a manufacturing business making iron furniture. 

She is 60 years old and married with one child. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thanh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical consultations and treatment

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina, 36, has a child and has been helping her husband work on their farm to make a living. She took a new loan recently to finance farm cultivation for the next cropping season. She is hopeful of gaining more income from her farm so she has invested more capital in order to improve her farm.

loans.use: to finance farm cultivation for the next cropping season

loans.name: Nghĩa

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghĩa has a manufacturing business making wood furniture.

She is 55 years old and married with five children. Nghĩa lives with two dependents in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nghĩa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nghĩa faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Nghĩa hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Teonila Elizabeth

texts.es:
Teonila Elizabeth tiene 48 años, es soltera, conocida en el medio, por su labor de elaboración y venta de comida. Vive en casa propia con madre y 03 hijos de los cuales 02 trabajan y mabre percibe pension de viudez en ONP, Teonila Elizabeth lleva separada de conyuge varios años. Ella es una persona con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Vive en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, con clima caluroso, habitada por gente amigable y amable, que se dedicadan a la agricultura, comercio y ganaderia.

Teonila Elizabeth se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida, la cual la ofrece en su casa, pues en su sala tiene mesitas y sillas donde atiende a su público pero ella también ofrece el servicio delivery, y los fines de semana prepara anticucho, polladas, etc. Necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de utensilios, vallijas y mesa, con lo cual seguirá brindando dicho servicio. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teonila Elizabeth is 48 years old and is single.  She is known for her work making and selling food.  She lives in her own house with her mother and 3 children.  Two of her children work, and her mother receives a widow's pension from ONP.  Teonila Elizabeth has been separated from her husband for a number of years.  She is a person with good personal and work references.  She lives in a community in the Cayalti district of Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru.  This area has a hot climate, and is inhabited by friendly and kind people who work in agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry.

Teonila Elizabeth has a business making and selling food.  Her business is located in her house.  She has small tables and chairs in the room where she serves the public, but she also offers delivery services.  On the weekends, she prepares kebabs, grilled chicken, and other dishes.  She needs a loan to invest in utensils, tableware, and tables so that she can continue to provide her services.  In the short run this will enable her to increase her income and earnings, and thereby improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy utensils, tableware and tables

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She has children and she is working in a garment factory. She was employed through the assistance of Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Analyn is a Roving Quality Control Officer. She inspects garments, such as men's denim bottoms, during manufacturing operations to determine the number of defects per worker and reasons for rejects by examiners. She counts the number of pattern parts, layers of cloth prior to cutting, number of stitches per inch during sewing operations and collects other measurement knowledge.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Analyn, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Analyn is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying them since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day. She looks forward to your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will be incorporating her loan to the capital needed in making peanut butter.

Analyn dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman. She wants for her children to finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to add to her capital needed in making peanut butter she sells for additional income.

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Hương is 45 years old and married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2011, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hương faces in her life is not having money to build a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment for a toilet…to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to maintain a successful business and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business. She wants her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment for a toilet…to build a toilet

loans.name: Tashiroy

texts.en: Tashiroy is widowed. She has experienced a lot of difficulties in life. She was born in 1972. She has a child. Tashiroy has been busy cooking and selling biscuits. She has worked in this field more than eight years and developed her business little by little with the passing of time. Tashiroy manages the business alone. Her son is a student. He studies at the second course. Tashiroy works hard to increase business and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 7500 somoni to buy flour and sugar to increase working capital and to produce more biscuits. She will pay for the tuition of her son from the profit of her business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar to increase working capital and to produce more biscuits.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre  femmes, les membres du groupe Dembagnouma sont toutes  mariés dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 45 ans et 4 enfants.
