Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente de, friperies, échalotes, petit mortier et charbon du bois. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  1èr  cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Kadia (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de friperies de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 balles friperies.  Elles s’approvisionnent en friperie à Médine. La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Kadia compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Dembagnouma group is composed of four women, who are all married and living in polygamous households. On average, they are 45 years old and have four children. They all live in Daoudabougou, one of the neighbourhoods in Bamako, and know each other through being relations, neighbours and business partners.

The group members sell used clothing, shallots, small mortar bowls and charcoal. In order to build up their stocks, the group has decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first loan cycle.

Kadia (pictured on the far left) is known for the high-quality used clothing she sells. She buys her supplies in Médine and will use her loan to buy two bundles of used clothing. She resells her products for cash and on credit, and sometimes to order, as a travelling saleswoman. 

Kadia hopes to make 40,000 CFA francs per month on average, which will be used to meet healthcare costs for her children. Her aim is to expand her business through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Agustinus

texts.en:
Agustinus is a 45-year-old man who lives with his wife, Remina, a 50-year-old lady. They were blessed with two children, namely: Adipapa, working in Bali; and Sumalia, working in Malaysia. Agustinus owns a kiosk business selling household items such as sugar, coffee, detergent, cigarettes, bath soap, mosquito coils, snacks and soft drinks. 

He initiated the business one and a half years ago using his own capital. This business is really vital to Agustinus, as it enables him to cover his family's living expenses. 

The increase in market price and demand for more stock from the customers led Agustinus to seek more money to buy various items. Unfortunately, he does not have enough capital for business improvement. He then submitted a loan application amounting to IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. Agustinus plans to spend the loan on petrol, cigarettes, more snacks and soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase petrol, cigarettes, more snacks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Catachilla Vaja Group

texts.es:
Arminda es una mujer de 52 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija de 19 años y su negocio es el comercio de la hoja de coca.
Ella es fuerte, luchadora, trabajadora, activa, constante y responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’; que es un municipio, capital de la provincia, y es la segunda en población del departamento. Es una población de clima cálido y medianamente seco, localizada a 13 kilómetros de la ciudad.
Arminda es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el Quechua y habla español (tercera de la derecha, usa blusa beige y suéter negro). Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura y su hija que se encuentra en tercer semestre de la universidad, viven en una casa propia de ladrillo y cuentan con agua de pozo y electricidad. La necesidad de trabajar constantemente la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; tienda de barrio, carnicería,  venta de sándwiches, venta de empanadas, agricultura, venta de refrescos y librería para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de la hoja de coca; que ha sido consumida durante miles de años por los habitantes originarios del lugar. Gracias a sus valores nutricionales y medicinales, masticar hojas de coca o beber mate de coca continúa siendo de vital importancia para mantener la salud de millones de personas. Una de las razones de esto es que las hojas de coca contienen más minerales, proteínas y vitaminas que muchos de los cultivos alimentarios en los Andes. Su sueño es mejorar su producción agrícola, ella desea preparar el terreno para la producción agrícola, es decir, remover y voltearla a través de una operación que requiere de tracción (animal o mecánica), y luego la desmenuza con la ayuda de la rastra. La preparación de tierras es un componente esencial en el proceso de establecimiento y desarrollo de los cultivos, y al mismo tiempo es parte vital en el manejo integrado de plagas y enfermedades. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Arminda solicita un préstamo para la preparación de la tierra para el cultivo.
texts.en:
Arminda is 42 years, married and has a 19 year old daughter. Her business is selling coca leaves. She is strong, a fighter, active, consistent and responsible. Her business is located in Sacaba which is a municipality and the capital of a province. It is the second largest city in the department. It has a warm fairly dry climate, located 13 km from the city.

Arminda has dark skin, long black, braided hair ans is of medium stature. Quechua is her native language and she speaks Spanish. (she is the third from the right wearing a beige blouse and black sweater). She lives with her husband who is a farmer. Her daughter is in her 3rd semester at university. She lives in her own brick house that has electricity and well water.

The need to constantly work has lead her to form a communal bank with other people with businesses like: a neighborhood store, a meat shop, sandwich sales, the sale of empanadas, farming, soft drink sales and a bookstore.

Her business is the sale of coca leaves which have been used for thousands of years by the locals. Thanks to their nutritional and medicinal value people chew coca leaves or drink coca tea, This is of vital importance in maintaining the health of millions of people. One of the reasons is that coca leaves contain more minerals, vitamins and proteins than many of the foods in the Andes.

Her dream is to increase her agricultural production. She wants to prepare the land for production that is clear and turn the land in a process that requires traction, animal or mechanical. Then she needs to break up the soil with the help of a plow. Preparing the land is an essential step in the process of developing and growing of plants. At the same time it is a vital component of infestation control. This is her first loan from the institution in her 15 years of this production. For these reasons she is requesting a loan to prepare the land.

loans.use: to prepare the land for growing.

loans.name: Pablo De Jesus

texts.es: Pablo de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 15 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, Pablo está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Pablo is 44 years old and lives with his wife in a home of his own.  He has been making clothing for 15 years from his workshop in his home.  He has many customers because of the quality of his work.  Pablo is asking for this loan to buy thread, needles, fabric, buttons, etc. so he can continue the work that generates a good income for him.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza is married and has two children.  Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Nargiza always wanted to provide her children with good education.  Since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Nargiza decided to start new business, buying and selling dried fruits. With this aim she completed the course of ‘To Get Ahead’ about women's organizations and learned enough skills about business. Her husband will help her with her new business. 

She will sell dried fruits at a local market. She is asking a loan of 5,000 TGS to buy dried fruits for launching her business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits for starting a new business at the market

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is 43 years old and married with 3 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Thanh works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Thanh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build a toilet. This is Thanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes to maintain a successful business and to make enough money to provide for her kids. She wants her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build a toilet.

loans.name: Yance

texts.en:
Yance, a 50 year old lady, is married to Baltzasar, a 54 year old man. They are blessed with three children, namely Cornelia, 21, who is at college; Mores, 19, working after having graduated from high school; and Asni, 15, in the 1st grade of High School. 

Yance owns a business selling vegetables and fruits at a traditional market. Every second day, she goes to the market to sell her agricultural produce such as corn, cassava leaves, fresh pumpkin leaves, etc. The income from selling the products is spent to buy food for her family and pay school fees. 

In order to generate more income, Yance plans to start a kiosk business to sell rice. She is expecting to generate more income from the business to pay her children’s schooling fees. Therefore, she submitted a loan application to TLM and requested a loan of IDR 3,000,000.

loans.use: to initiate a kiosk business to sell rice.

loans.name: Prescell

texts.en:
Prescell is 39 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Prescell is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Prescell has been raising pigs for four years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 39 years old, married and has one children who is in school. 

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Analyn has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 42 years old, married and has six children. 

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Florita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pig.

Florita has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard, 29 years of age, is a very passionate, hardworking and dedicated farmer who hails from Chebwagon, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. He is committed to his wife with whom he is blessed to have three children. 

Like most small-scale farmers in rural Kenya, he has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years with milk, crops, and some small personal business. He has been able to earn a decent income. He loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of his dairy cows. He loves milking and feeding his cow which is his hobby. 

Dairy farming is very fulfilling to Leonard. Although he makes profits from selling milk he is faced with one major challenge that is dragging him behind, that is lack of a proper dairy unit. He is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. A modern dairy unit will assist him to properly feed his cows and also be able to milk them properly. Through the loan his cows will not be affected by harsh weather conditions because they will have a comfortable place to stay. All this will result to increased productivity of milk will lead to improved profits. 

Leonard is a believer that freedom from poverty is a basic human right and through the loan he will get out of the poverty bracket he is in right now. Through Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva he believes that the loan will create ripples of changes in his living conditions. Through a partnership between Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, aspiring men such as Leonard are assured of achieving their dreams through loans and technical financing.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a twenty-nine-year-old hardworking man charged with the responsibility of taking care of two children both of whom attend school. 

He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling maize and beans among others. He gets additional income from farming. 

He hopes to expand and develop his business so as to improve on his standards of living. He will use the loan money to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Adelisa

texts.en:
Adelisa is 60 years old, and she is married, with three children.

Adelisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Adelisa has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for three years, and she also earns an income from pig fattening.

Adelisa aspires to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Doke Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de cinq femmes, les membres du groupe Dokè sont uniquement  mariés dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente de, condiments  (tomates), habits, poissons et restauration. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  1èr cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Oumou (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite) à une bonne réputation dans la vente condiments  (tomates). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  3 corbeilles de tomates. Elles s’approvisionnent en condiments à Médine.  La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Oumou compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The five women in the Doke group are all married and living in monogamous households. On average, they are 35 years old and have five children. They live in Daoudabougou, a neighbourhood of Bamako, and know each other through being relations, neighbours and business partners.

The group members sell produce (tomatoes), clothing, fish, and meals. In order to build up their stock, the group members have decided to seek Soro Yiriwaso's help. This is their first loan cycle.

Oumou (pictured second from the left) has a good reputation as a seller of produce (tomatoes). She buys her supplies in Médine and will use her loan to buy three baskets of tomatoes. She sells her produce on foot, for cash or on credit, and most of her customers are women.

Oumou expects to make an average monthly income of 40,000 CFA francs, which she will spend on sending her children to school and meeting their healthcare costs.

loans.use: to buy produce.

loans.name: Beyler

texts.en:
Beyler is 39 years old. He has been married for over 15 years and has three children. All his children go to school. His wife is a violinist. They are living in Absheron region with his lovely family. 

Beyler has had this store since 2007. Today Baylar wants to support his business and for that he needs a loan of an amount of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). With this amount Beylar wants to buy more goods (pipes, parts for pipes, faucets and etc.) to sell, In this way, he will develop his business and increase monthly income. He wishes to have the best for his children.

Beyler says “Thanks dear Kiva lenders for your support. I’m greatly thankful to you”.

loans.use: to buy goods for his store including pipes and faucets.

loans.name: Thuận

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuận has a retail business selling dry food.

She is 31 years old and married with two children. Thuận lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thuận's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Thuận faces in her life is not having a clean water syterm and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Thuận hopes for her children to find a good jobs, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Eunise

texts.en:
Eunise is a 38-year-old married woman who has been earning well from her farm after taking her previous loan. She has repaid her previous loan successfully through her increased income.

To expand her farm, she has taken a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and pesticide for her corn farm. In the future, she wants to expand her farm further, in order to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and pesticide for her corn farm

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 35-year-old widow; she lives with three children: Thomas, 12, who is in the 6th grade of elementary school; Ona, 9, in the 3rd grade of elementary school; and Jurni, 6, in the 1st grade of elementary school.

To support her family, Sofia raises the farmer's cattle so it can be sold after 6 months. The money earned was spent on her children's school fees. Sofia was thinking to run her own business which is raising pigs. 

Now Sofia intends to buy two piglets and build a stall. She needs more capital to do so. Therefore she has requested a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and build a stall.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 49, married and blessed with four children. She and her husband aspire to improve their standard of living and give their children a better life. 

With this objective, Lorna aims to further improve her retail store to increase her income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP10,000 to buy more grocery items and personal products to resell. 

She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items and personal products to resell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen has been helping her husband by managing her own piggery to make a living. For more than five years, the couple has earned well for the family and has sustained their living.  

Aside from their piggery, they also sell fish in the market to make more income for the family. Helen took a new loan recently to buy more variety of fish to sell. Her previous loan has been repaid successfully.

In the future, Helen wants to improve the general living condition of her entire family.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Demostenes Amador

texts.es:
Demostenes Amador tiene 37 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Demostenes Amador se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 9 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para mejoramiento de infraestructura donde se encuentran sus animales, dicha inversión le servirá para criar en mejores condiciones a sus animales, Demostenes Amador tiene gran influencia en el negocio; él piensa mejorar productividad de animales para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona; lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Demostenes Amador, 37, is single and has no children.  He lives with his family in a rural area of the Oyotún district of the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  The community works mainly in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

Demostenes Amador earns a living raising and selling animals.  He has more than nine years of experience with his business, which is located at his own home.

He's requesting a loan to improve the infrastructure where he keeps his animals.  This will help him raise his animals in better conditions.

Demostenes Amador has a lot of influence in the business.  He plans to improve the productivity of his animals to be able to take care of the various needs and tastes of his customers in the area.  This will allow him to improve his income in the short term, increase his profits, and, consequently, improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure where he keeps his animals

loans.name: Eliana Pamela

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Rio De Oro.
En este lugar vive la señorita Eliana, tiene 28 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de su mamá. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque de esta forma ella y su mamá pueden seguir con su negocio el cual les permite salir adelante.
Doña Eliana con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto  ayudarle a su mamá con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda. Trabaja todos los días, dejan a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Sus sueños es seguir mejorando con el paso de los días.
texts.en:
In the citadel La California de Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, which has been known for many years as the city of the Reales Tamarindos stadium, the members of Rio De Oro Credit Group meet. 

This is where Eliana lives. She is 28 years old, single, and lives in her mother's home. She has undergone three loan cycles with the Credit Group, which she has enjoyed because it allows her and her mother to continue progressing forward with their business. 

With the intention of helping her mother cover the household expenses, Eliana sells clothing of all types, both door-to-door and from her home, where her customers can visit if they need any type of garment. She works every day, and allows her customers to purchase on credit, which she collects every fifteen days. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil either every fifteen days or monthly, whichever aligns with her needs. She will utilize this loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, tee shirts, and children's clothing. Her dreams are to keep improving with the passing of each day.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, tee shirts, and children´s clothing.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she can improve her business even more if you will lend her an amount of 60,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stocks of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely to buy more items if she has more products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Erlinda hopes that prosperity will dwell in her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 25 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ann is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ann has been raising pigs for three years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Daria

texts.en:
Daria is 57 years old, and she is married, with six children.

Daria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF ito buy more groceries to sell.

Daria has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 15 years, and she also earns an income from pig fattening.

Daria aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 48 years old and lives in the village of Tsav in Syunik region. Anush has no higher education, but it has never been a hardship for her to always be employed in order to properly take care of her children.

This woman already asks for her second Kiva loan, being greatly satisfied with her first loan with Kiva and Nor Horizon. Anush is divorced, and she has two sons and a daughter. Her elder son now lives with his father. Anush’s daughter is married, and only the smallest son lives with Anush (he is school-aged).

Anush now has a cute farm established by her little by little, and today she is already developed her poultry (she has 60 chickens), and she also cultivates potatoes on some part of her land. Part is a nice apple orchard. All her farm goods are poultry meat, eggs, potatoes, and apples. Anush sells at the city wholesale market, and she spends all the income on the needs of her lovely children. As she says, each product from her farm that she manages to sell is great happiness for her, since she knows that with it, she can solve one more problem of her family.

Anyway, among with all her problems she also has another one, which is connected with her health. Anush suffers from a very serious disease that is just incurable, and she needs constant control by doctors. Anush asks for this loan, since she must buy a lot of medicines that are very expensive but important and urgent for her.

loans.use: to buy very important medicine for herself.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Florencia works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Florencia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of bananas to sell to customers.

Florencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in livestock, primarily rearing cattle which he later sells. 

Like all good fathers he desires to educate his children up to university and build a permanent house, as they are currently living in a semi-permanent one. Drought and diseases hinder his business. His business plan is to construct a permanent house. 

Sam is requesting for a loan to buy cattle to rear.

loans.use: to buy cattle to rear.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a thirty-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He owns a barber shop as his main source of income which he started so as to educate his children. He also earns additional income from farming. He hopes to be a prominent businessman however his main challenge is inadequate capital. 

Gilbert is requesting a loan to buy a machine for cutting hair to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy a machine for cutting hair to boost his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soap, sodas, and rice to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Phouk's Group

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Speu province, Phouk is 57 years old and a mother of six children. To improve her family's condition, she grows rice as her single source of income. She has been involved in this business for ages and she can earn income about 24,000 KHR per day. For Phouk, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of five members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She expects that her family will have enough clean water to use.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Fungisai

texts.en:
Thanks to your support of Fungisai's Kiva loan, she now operates a successful booth at a local flea market where she sells both children’s and adults’ clothing. Fungisai started out selling vegetables, but changed to clothing sales because it provided greater profits. Her income is now helping the family with food, clothing and school fees for her four children.

She shared with us, "I am now able to use my money better. I am now somebody in the community, and respected in my community and in my family."

Fungisai has overcome some of the challenges that come with starting a business, including understanding her customers and anticipating when local farmers’ crops are sold. 

She hopes to get a second Kiva loan to help her build on her business by purchasing more inventory and making some improvements to her booth.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Rumbidzai

texts.en: After Rumbidzai received her first loan from Kiva, she boosted her business by purchasing in bulk to expand her business. She no longer suffers from competition because she now offers a variety of products such as suits, blankets, track suits, t-shirts and socks. Using the profit she gets monthly, she is now able to pay fees for her younger brothers and buy basic commodities for home consumption. She also started a poultry production business where she intends to supply the local business center. Besides that, Rumbidzai plans to expand her home, so she bought building materials such as door frames and doors. Her home used to have no doors but the profits from the business have changed that. She is glad and overjoyed to have got this loan because she never thought she would be able to get such a big loan in her life. She plans to get into bigger projects and her greatest desire is to build her own shop. Rumbidzai also wants to further her education by sitting for examinations next year. She plans to use the bigger loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more towels, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Soon after she received her first loan, Margaret became so frustrated with the constant outbreaks of Newcastle disease and other poultry diseases in her area that she decided to change businesses for the time being. 

Margaret has since ventured into buying and selling second-hand clothing. She soon discovered that this business was very lucrative, and has since seen an increase in her income by 20%. 

Margaret plans to continue to increase her sales by purchasing more stock of used clothing.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: With the first Kiva loan, Maria purchased clothes to resell. She maintained both a grocery shop and the clothing business for a while, until she decided to concentrate on clothing. She successfully sells these clothes and is well supported by family members. She recently had to engage in barter trading for groundnuts, which she then resells. She has used the profits to pay for family expenses as well as paying fees for her child who just started school. She is planning to continue with this business since it is profitable and purchase more stock to increase sales if she gets a second loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Emmanuel Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Salome, a member of Emmanuel Women Group in Nakuru Kenya. She is twenty-nine years old, married, and the mother of one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

She has been operating a shoe-selling enterprise for the past three years. Salome appreciates Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on business record-keeping, enterprise development, savings and financial management, as it has made her business thrive.

She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase more shoes to sell due to the increased demand from her customers and to boost her income in order to cater for her family’s basic needs, such as food and clothing, with ease.

Salome is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Lmc Group

texts.en:
Carlyn is the featured borrower of LMC group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon to earn a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Carlyn is a 37-year-old married mother of two children who is working hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. She is acquiring a loan to pay her children's school tuition fees.

Carlyn is the first lady on the right of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Limbania is the lady standing in the middle, and Maribel is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, who is 56 years old, is an experienced and active farmer. She lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She is a single mother of four children; two are single, and two are married. 

By operating her farming business on a small rice field, she can earn around five US dollars a day to support her family. So far, she has been involved in this career for nearly forty years.

Chantha is applying for a loan to dig a pump well at a location near her house.  With the support of this loan, she hopes that she can get water to use easier and spent a shorter time hauling it than before. 

She is thankful for all lenders for their financial support towards poor people.

loans.use: to dig a pump well nearer to her house

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de sept  femmes, les membres du groupe Benkadi sont toutes  mariés dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 45 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Daoudabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente du bois de charbon et du bois de chauffe et des céréales. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  1èr cycle de  prêt  solidaire.
Madame Socona (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de charbon de bois  et du bois de chauffe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 chargement du bois de charbon et du bois de chauffe. Elles s’approvisionnent charbon de bois et du bois de chauffe  dans les villages environnants de Bamako.  La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit  et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Socona compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The seven women in the Benkadi Group are all married and living in polygamous households. On average, they are 45 years old and have four children. They all live in Daoudabougou, a neighbourhood in Bamako, and know each other through their businesses, and being relations and neighbours.

The members of the group sell charcoal, firewood and cereals. In order to increase their stock, they have decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and this is their first solidarity loan.

Socona (pictured on the far left) is a renowned seller of charcoal and firewood. She will use her loan to buy one load of charcoal and firewood, which she usually gets from the villages around Bamako and resells for cash or on credit, and sometimes to order, to a mostly female clientele.

With this loan, Socona hopes to make 30,000 CFA francs per month on average, which will be used to pay her children's healthcare costs. She would like to expand her business in partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a hard working married man with two children whom all attend school. 

Richard runs a butcher shop for pork selling. He also supplemented his income by cassava farming. 
Richard desires to expand and grow his business so that he can improve his family's standards of living. He will use this loan to buy land for rearing pigs.

loans.use: to buy land for rearing pigs.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 50 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Leonida has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns more income from pig fattening.

Leonida aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elgie

texts.en:
Elgie is a 27-year-old married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elgie has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Elgie would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Baker

texts.en:
Baker is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He sells second hand shoes as his main source of income. He also practices farming to earn additional income. He hopes to be a prominent businessman. However, his main challenge is inadequate capital. 

Baker is requesting a loan to buy stock of second hand shoes to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy stock of second hand shoes to boost his business.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock used his previous loan to buy more coffee and maize to sell.  He is a hard-working single man who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He still deals in selling maize and coffee as his main source of income, although he also practices farming and motorcycle transport to earn extra income. He started this business to have a better standard of living and to pay school fees for his children. 

Even though his businesses face challenges of price fluctuations, prolonged drought, and inadequate capital, Enock still has a vision of becoming a prominent business man.

He is requesting a loan to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee  to sell.

loans.name: Trufosa Group

texts.en:
Trufosa's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Trufosa, who is the group leader pictured above. 

Trufosa is 60 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual. She isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially from the learning she receives from the farm training. 

This year, Trufosa will get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, and will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to study.

From this loan, Trufosa's Group will purchase a total of 6 solar lights, as well as the farming supplies to plant a total land area of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvest

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda’s business is doing very well. After receiving her first loan in April, she bought more carrier bags to sell at her business place in Gokwe. With the profits she earned, she managed to expand her business into selling clothing and jewelry. Members of her family rely on her. Yolanda works very hard trying to fight against more competitors in town. 

She also involves her mother in running the business, since she considers it a family business. She paid fees for sister’s children and said that she wants to build her own shop for clothing and jewelry in town using the profits she’s made. Yolanda managed to pay back her loan and her business growth is amazing. If she gets a second loan she intends to build her own shop.

loans.use: to build her own shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bulk purchases of sugar, rice, flour, sour and soft drinks, candles, cooking oil, snacks, and sweets to boost her sales volume and profits.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en:
Murodjon is a student of the second course. He is 19 years old. Murodjon is not married and lives with his parents in a rural area. His parents have been busy with animal husbandry. Murodjon helps them to feed their cattle.

After graduating from school, Murodjon applied to the Tajikistan State University of Law, Business and Politics. He had always dreamed of getting a higher education, and now he is happy because he studies at the university and learns law.

Murodjon is asking for a loan to pay for tuition at the university. His parents do not have the opportunity to support him. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria tiene 53 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 6 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 53 years old and lives with her son in a home of her own.  She has had a small store in her home for six years and has many customers because of her good prices and friendliness.  She is asking for a loan to buy soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc. so she can increase her income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Joel De Jesus

texts.es: Joel de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la compra y venta de madera su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas  logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Joel quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando piso cerámico pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, cerámica y pago de mano de obra y así puedan vivir mas cómodos con su esposa.
texts.en: Joel is 46 years old and lives with his wife in his own home.  He buys and sells lumber from his business set up in his home and he is able to pay the household expenses out of his earnings.  Joel wants to make improvements to his home by adding a tile floor, but he doesn’t earn enough money to do it, so he is asking for a loan to buy cement, sand, tiles, and pay for labor.  This will allow him allow him and his wife to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to install a tile floor in his home.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina was born in 1984.  She lives with her family in Buston, Tajikistan. She is the married mother of three children. She is industrious and works hard to earn her living. 

Madina has been busy with buying and selling children clothes at a local market for more than 10 years. She has a store at the market. She has great experience in this field and hopes to develop her business further. 

Madina is going to buy a new collection of women's clothes for the winter season and in this way offer a wider assortment of goods.  She is asking a loan of TGS 5,000 to buy women's clothes for the new season.   She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes for the new season for her store

loans.name: Jenie

texts.en: Jenie, 47 years old and married with five children, operates a fish selling business while her husband catches fish to earn a living. For over eight years, she earns a good income to support her family but it is still not enough to sustain the business. She repaid successfully her previous loan used for buying fishing equipment. To improve the business, she took a new loan recently to cover the cost of  pump boat maintenance and to buy additional fishing nets. She plans to buy another fishing boat for business expansion.

loans.use: to cover the cost of pump boat maintenance and to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Candy Vanessa

texts.es:
Candy Vanessa tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente, dedicada a la venta de ropa al contado y al crédito. Vive con su sus padres, quien es pensionista, su hermano, su cónyuge y su hija de 09 años de edad. Candy Vanessa cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Tiene una familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Candy Vanessa se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y producos de belleza. El préstamo lo desea para realizar la inversión en compra de mercadería de temporada primavera – verano para atender pedidos de su público consumidor. Atendiendo la demanda solicitada por clientes conocidos. Lo que le permitirá ampliar su cartera de clientes, contando con clientes nuevos e ingresos adicionales a la familia; lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Candy Vanessa is 27 years old, married, and works in clothing sales. She lives with her parents, who are living on pensions, her brother, her husband, and her 9 year-old daughter. Candy Vanessa counts on good professional and working references. She has a united family, and lives in a community oriented around commerce, agriculture, and livestock that is located in the Saña district, Chiclaya provines, Lamayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. 

Candy Vanessa works in clothing and beauty product sales. She hopes to use this loan to invest in merchandise purchases for the spring/summer season to fulfill orders from her customers. This will allow her to expand her customer base and count on new clients and additional income for her family. Over the short term, she will increase her business earnings and personal income, and as a result, improve hers and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the spring/summer season.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 60 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlinda has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs'.

loans.name: Auxilium

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Auxilium works hard to support her family. She has a business, selling vegetables in the Philippines, and she also earns income from farming vegetables.

Auxilium is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy fruit and vegetables to sell, for her vegetable-vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell, in her food stall.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis’s poultry business is doing well. When she got her first loan, she purchased more chicks and feed. She is now producing 100 birds every three weeks and is very proud of the development she has had so far. 

Her income has increased by 15% since April. She used her profits to provide for her family and pay for her husband’s college tuition. 

Her major challenge was Newcastle disease, which affected most of her chickens in June. She lost over 30 birds, but she has managed to improve her production yet again. 

She hopes to venture into egg production in the near future.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of chicks, feed, and vaccines

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 31 years old. She is hard working and a single mother of two children whom all attend school. 

She runs a retail shop, mainly selling sugar, salt, and soap among other items, in Hoima, Uganda. She will use this loan to buy more salt and sodas to sell.

Caroline hopes to expand her business and educate her children better.

loans.use: to buy more salt and sodas to sell

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a thirty-two-year-old hardworking married man with two children aged six and two years old, living in Kamwenge Uganda. He owns a retail shop as his main source of income as well as riding a motorcycle to earn himself an extra income. He started this business so as to earn a living and improve on his standard of living. He hopes to become rich; however, his main challenge is price fluctuations.

Godfrey is requesting a loan to buy more items like soap, salt, sugar and others to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy more items like soap, salt, sugar and others to boost his business.
